A creature inspired with greatness gains 2 bonus Hit Dice (d10s), the commensurate number of ~temporary hit points~[TAG_TEMPORARY_HIT_POINTS] (apply the target's ~Constitution~[TAG_CONSTITUTION] modifier, if any, to these bonus Hit Dice), a +2 competence bonus on ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL], and a +1 competence bonus on ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] saves.  The bonus Hit Dice count as regular Hit Dice for determining the effect of spells such as ~Sleep~[TAG_SPELLS_SLEEP].Note: In ToEE, a creature inspired with greatness only gains the temporary hit points.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_BARD_INTIMIDATE:TAG_D: A bard of 6th level or higher with 9 or more ranks in a ~Perform~[TAG_PERFORM] skill can cause a single creature to be intimidated while the creature is ~fascinated~[TAG_FASCINATED].  Using this ability does not break the bard's concentration on the fascinate effect, nor does it allow a second saving throw for the target.  The use of intimidate counts towards a bard's daily limit on performances. The creature is affected if it fails a ~Will~[TAG_WILL] ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] (DC 11 + bard's ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA] modifier).  If the saving throw fails, affected creatures move away from the bard as if they are victim of a ~Fear~[TAG_SPELLS_FEAR] spell for the number of rounds equal to the number of levels the bard has.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_BARD_SPELLS:TAG_BARDS: A bard casts ~arcane spells~[TAG_ARCANE_SPELLS] (the same type of spells available to ~sorcerers~[TAG_SORCERERS] and ~wizards~[TAG_WIZARDS]) which are drawn from the bard spell list.  A bard can cast any spell he or she knows without preparing for it ahead of time.  Every bard spell has a verbal component.  To learn or cast a spell, a bard must have a ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA] score equal to at least:                                           10 + the spell level(Cha 10 for 0-Level spells, Cha 11 for 1st-level spells, and so forth)
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_BARD_WEAPON_ARMOR_PRO: A bard is proficient with all ~simple weapons~[TAG_SIMPLE_WEAPONS], plus the ~longsword~[TAG_WEAPONS_LONGSWORD], ~rapier~[TAG_WEAPONS_RAPIER], ~sap~[TAG_WEAPONS_SAP], ~short sword~[TAG_WEAPONS_SWORD_SHORT], and ~shortbow~[TAG_WEAPONS_SHORTBOW].     Bards are proficient with ~light~[TAG_ARMOR_LIGHT] armor and ~shields~[TAG_ARMOR_SHIELD].     Because the somatic components required for bard spells are relatively simple, a bard can cast spells while wearing light armor without incurring the normal ~arcane spell failure~[TAG_ARCANE_SPELL_FAILURE] chance.  However, like any other arcane spellcaster, a bard wearing medium or heavy armor or using a shield incurs a chance of arcane spell failure if the spell in question has a somatic component (most do).  A ~multiclass~[TAG_MULTICLASS] bard still incurs the normal arcane spell failure chance for arcane spells received from other classes.[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_BARD:TAG_DUMMY:::1: Bard Base Attack & Base Save Bonuses
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_CLERIC_DEITY_DOMAINS_: Choose a ~deity~[TAG_RELIGION] for your cleric.  The cleric's deity influences his ~alignment~[TAG_ALIGNMENT], what magic he can perform, his values, and how others see him.     If the typical worshipers of a deity include the members of a specific ~race~[TAG_RACES], a cleric must be of the indicated race to choose that deity as his own.  (The god may have occasional worshipers of other races, but not clerics.)     When you have chosen an alignment and a deity for your cleric, choose two domains for the deity.  While the clerics of a particular religion are united in their reverence for their deity, each cleric emphasizes different aspects of the deity's interests.  You can select an alignment domain (~Chaos~[TAG_CHAOS_D], ~Evil~[TAG_EVIL_D], ~Good~[TAG_GOOD_DOMAIN], or ~Law~[TAG_LAW_D]) for your cleric only if his alignment matches that domain.     Each domain gives your cleric access to a domain spell at each spell level he can cast, from 1st on up, as well as a granted power.  Your cleric gets the granted powers of both the domains selected.  With access to two domain spells at a given spell level, a cleric prepares one or the other each day in his domain spell slot.  If a domain spell is not on the cleric spell list, a cleric can prepare it only in his domain spell slot.  Domain spells and granted powers are given in ~Cleric Domains~[TAG_DOMAINS].
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_CLERIC_SPELLS:TAG_CLE: A cleric casts ~divine spells~[TAG_DIVINE_SPELLS] (the same type of spells available to the ~druid~[TAG_DRUIDS], ~paladin~[TAG_PALADINS], and ~ranger~[TAG_RANGERS]) which are drawn from the cleric spell list.  However, a cleric's ~alignment~[TAG_ALIGNMENT] may restrict him from casting certain spells opposed to his moral or ethical beliefs.     To prepare or cast a spell, a cleric must have a ~Wisdom~[TAG_WISDOM] score equal to:                                           10 + the spell level(Wis 10 for 0-level spells, Wis 11 for 1st-level spells, and so forth)
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_CLERIC_SPONTANEOUS_CA: A good cleric (or a neutral cleric of a good ~deity~[TAG_RELIGION]) can channel stored spell energy into healing spells that the cleric did not prepare ahead of time.  The cleric can "lose" any prepared spell, that is not a domain spell, in order to cast a Cure spell of the same spell level.  For example, a good cleric who has prepared ~Command~[TAG_SPELLS_COMMAND] (a 1st-level spell) may lose Command in order to cast ~Cure Light Wounds~[TAG_SPELLS_CURE_LIGHT_WOUNDS] (also a 1st-level spell).  Clerics of good deities can cast Cure spells in this way because they are especially proficient at wielding positive energy.     An evil cleric (or a neutral cleric of an evil deity), on the other hand, can't convert prepared spells to Cure spells but can convert them to Inflict spells (for example, ~Inflict Light Wounds~[TAG_SPELLS_INFLICT_LIGHT_WOUNDS]).  Such clerics are especially proficient at wielding negative energy.     A cleric who is neither good nor evil and whose deity is neither good nor evil can convert spells to either Cure spells or Inflict spells (player's choice), depending on whether the cleric is more proficient at wielding positive or negative energy.  Once the player makes this choice, it cannot be reversed.  This choice also determines whether the cleric turns or rebukes undead.     Exceptions: All lawful neutral clerics of ~Wee Jas~[TAG_WEE_JAS] (the goddess of death and magic) convert prepared spells to Inflict spells, not Cure spells.  All clerics of ~St. Cuthbert~[TAG_CUTHBERT] (the god of retribution) and all nonevil clerics of ~Obad-Hai~[TAG_OBAD_HAI] (the god of nature) convert prepared spells to Cure spells, not Inflict spells.Note: To use spontaneous casting in the game, hold down the SHIFT key and select the spell you would like to cast.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_CLERIC_TURN_REBUKE_UN: Any cleric, regardless of ~alignment~[TAG_ALIGNMENT], has the power to affect undead creatures (such as skeletons, zombies, ghosts, and vampires) by channeling the power of his faith through his holy (or unholy) symbol.     A good cleric (or a neutral cleric who worships a good ~deity~[TAG_RELIGION]) can turn or destroy undead creatures.     An evil cleric (or a neutral cleric who worships an evil deity) instead rebukes or commands such creatures, forcing them to ~cower~[TAG_COWERING] in awe of his power.     If your character is a neutral cleric of a neutral deity, you must choose whether his turning ability functions as that of a good cleric or an evil cleric.  Once you make this choice, it cannot be reversed.  This decision also determines whether the cleric can cast spontaneous Cure or Inflict spells.     Exceptions: All lawful neutral clerics of ~Wee Jas~[TAG_WEE_JAS] rebuke or command undead.  All clerics of ~St. Cuthbert~[TAG_CUTHBERT] and all nonevil clerics of ~Obad-Hai~[TAG_OBAD_HAI] turn or destroy undead.     A cleric may attempt to turn undead a number of times per day equal to 3 + his ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA] modifier.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_CLERIC_WEAPON_ARMOR_P: Clerics are proficient with all ~simple weapons~[TAG_SIMPLE_WEAPONS], with all types of armor (~light~[TAG_ARMOR_LIGHT], ~medium~[TAG_ARMOR_MEDIUM], and ~heavy~[TAG_ARMOR_HEAVY]), and with ~shields~[TAG_ARMOR_SHIELD].     Every ~deity~[TAG_RELIGION] has a favored weapon, and his or her clerics consider it a point of pride to wield that weapon.  A cleric who chooses the ~War domain~[TAG_WAR_D] receives the ~Weapon Focus~[TAG_WEAPON_FOCUS] feat related to that weapon as a bonus feat.  He also receives the appropriate ~Martial Weapon Proficiency~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF] feat as a bonus feat, if the weapon falls into that category.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_CLERIC:TAG_DUMMY:::1: Cleric Base Attack & Base Save Bonuses
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_DRUID_ANIMAL_COMPANIO: A druid may begin play with an animal companion that must be selected from the following list:     Attack Dog, Brown Bear, Chicken, Dire Rat, Giant Lizard, Jackal, Panda Bear, Polar Bear, or Wolf     This animal is a loyal companion that accompanies the druid on her adventures as appropriate for its species.     A druid of 4th level or higher may select from alternate lists of animals.  Should she select an animal companion from one of these alternate lists, the creature gains abilities as if the character's druid level were lower than it actually is.Animal Companion ListLevels 1-3+:~Attack Dog~[TAG_MONSTER_ATTACK_DOG]~Chicken~[TAG_MONSTER_CHICKEN]~Dire Rat~[TAG_MONSTER_DIRE_RAT]~Jackal~[TAG_MONSTER_JACKAL]~Wolf~[TAG_MONSTER_WOLF]Levels 4-6+:~Black Bear~[TAG_MONSTER_BLACK_BEAR]~Giant Lizard~[TAG_MONSTER_GIANT_LIZARD]~Panda Bear~[TAG_MONSTER_PANDA_BEAR]Levels 7-9+:~Brown Bear~[TAG_MONSTER_BROWN_BEAR]Levels 10-20:~Polar Bear~[TAG_MONSTER_POLAR_BEAR]
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_DRUID_NATURE_SENSE:TA: A druid gains a +2 bonus on ~Survival~[TAG_SURVIVAL] checks.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_DRUID_RESIST_NATURES_: Starting at 4th level, a druid gains a +4 bonus on ~saving throws~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] against the spell-like abilities of fey (such as dryads, nymphs, and sprites).
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_DRUID_SPONTANEOUS_CAS: A druid can channel stored spell energy into summoning spells that she hasn't prepared ahead of time. She can "lose" a prepared spell in order to cast a Summon Nature's Ally spell of the same level.Note: To use spontaneous casting in the game, hold down the SHIFT key and select the spell you would like to cast.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_DRUID_TRACKLESS_STEP:: Starting at 3rd level, a druid leaves no trail in natural surroundings and cannot be tracked.  She may choose to leave a trail if so desired.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_DRUID_VENOM_IMMUNITY:: At 9th level, a druid gains immunity to all ~poisons~[TAG_POISON].
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_DRUID_WEAPON_ARMOR_PR: Druids are proficient with the following weapons: ~club~[TAG_WEAPONS_CLUB], ~dagger~[TAG_WEAPONS_DAGGER], ~dart~[TAG_WEAPONS_DART], ~quarterstaff~[TAG_WEAPONS_QUARTERSTAFF], ~scimitar~[TAG_WEAPONS_SCIMITAR], ~sickle~[TAG_WEAPONS_SICKLE], ~shortspear~[TAG_WEAPONS_SHORTSPEAR], ~sling~[TAG_WEAPONS_SLING], and ~spear~[TAG_WEAPONS_SPEAR]     They are also proficient with natural attacks (~unarmed strike~[TAG_WEAPONS_STRIKE_UNARMED], claw, bite, etc.), regardless of the forms they assume.     Druids are proficient with ~light~[TAG_ARMOR_LIGHT] and ~medium~[TAG_ARMOR_MEDIUM] armor, but can only wear ~nonmetallic~[TAG_ARMOR_NONMETALLIC] armor.  They are proficient with ~shields~[TAG_ARMOR_SHIELD] but must use only wooden ones.     Druids are unable to wear prohibited armor or use a prohibited shield.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_DRUID_WILD_SHAPE:TAG_: At 5th level, a druid gains the ability to turn herself into a ~Wolf~[TAG_MONSTER_WOLF] (at 5th level), ~Brown Bear~[TAG_MONSTER_BROWN_BEAR] (at 6th level), ~Legendary Rat~[TAG_MONSTER_LEGENDARY_RAT] (at 7th level), ~Polar Bear~[TAG_MONSTER_POLAR_BEAR] (at 8th level), ~Dire Lizard~[TAG_MONSTER_DIRE_LIZARD] (at 9th level), or Giant Snake (at 10th level) and back again once per day. The effects last for 1 hour per druid level, or until she changes back.  Changing form (to animal or back) is a ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION] and doesn't provoke an ~attack of opportunity~[TAG_AOO].     The form chosen must be that of an animal the druid is familiar with.  For example, a druid who has never been outside a temperate forest could not become a Polar Bear.     A druid loses her ability to speak while in an animal form because she is limited to the sounds that a normal, untrained animal can make, but she can communicate normally with other animals of the same general grouping as her new form.     A druid can use this ability more times per day at 6th, 7th, 10th, 14th, and 18th levels.  In addition, she gains the ability to take the shape of a Large animal at 8th level.  However, the new form's Hit Dice can't exceed the character's druid level.  For example at 8th level, a druid can't assume the form of a ~Dire Bear~[TAG_MONSTER_DIRE_BEAR], because although it is a Large animal, it has at least 12 Hit Dice.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_DRUID:TAG_DUMMY:::1: Druid Base Attack & Base Save Bonuses
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_FIGHTER_BONUS_FEATS:T: At 1st level, a fighter gets a bonus combat-oriented feat in addition to the feat that any 1st-level character gets and the bonus feat granted to a ~human~[TAG_HUMANS] character. The fighter gains an additional bonus feat at 2nd level and every two fighter levels thereafter (4th, 6th, 8th, 10th, 12th, 14th, 16th, 18th, and 20th). A fighter must still meet all prerequisites for a bonus feat, including ~ability score~[TAG_ABILITY_SCORES] and ~base attack bonus~[TAG_LEVEL_BONUSES] minimums. These bonus feats are in addition to the feat that a character of any class gets every three levels.List of Fighter Bonus Feats[CMD_CHILDREN_SORTED]
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_FIGHTER_WEAPON_ARMOR_: A fighter is proficient with all ~simple~[TAG_SIMPLE_WEAPONS] and ~martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_WEAPONS] weapons and with all armor (~heavy~[TAG_ARMOR_HEAVY], ~medium~[TAG_ARMOR_MEDIUM], and ~light~[TAG_ARMOR_LIGHT]) and ~shields~[TAG_ARMOR_SHIELD].
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_FIGHTER:TAG_DUMMY:::1: Fighter Base Attack & Base Save Bonuses
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_ABUNDANT_STEP:TA: At 12th level or higher, a monk can slip magically between spaces, as if using the spell ~Dimension Door~[TAG_SPELLS_DIMENSION_DOOR], once per day.  A monk can only use this ability, if she is equipped with a ~Monk's Belt~[TAG_MONK'S_BELT].
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_AC_BONUS:TAG_MON: A monk is highly trained at dodging blows, and she has a sixth sense that lets her avoid even unanticipated attacks.     When unarmored and unencumbered, the monk adds her ~Wisdom~[TAG_WISDOM] bonus (if any) to her ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS].  In addition, a monk gains a +1 bonus to AC at 5th level.  This bonus increases by 1 for every 5 levels thereafter (+2 at 10th, +3 at 15th, and +4 at 20th level).     These bonuses to AC apply even against touch attacks or when the monk is ~flat-footed~[TAG_FLAT_FOOTED].  She loses these bonuses when she is immobilized or ~helpless~[TAG_HELPLESS], when she wears any armor, when she carries a shield, or when she carries a medium or heavy load.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_BONUS_FEAT:TAG_M: 1st level:    gains ~Stunning Fist~[TAG_STUNNING_FIST]     2nd level: may select either ~Combat Reflexes~[TAG_COMBAT_REFLEXES] or ~Deflect Arrows~[TAG_DEFLECT_ARROWS]     6th level:  gains ~Improved Trip~[TAG_IMPROVED_TRIP]     A monk need not have any of the prerequisites normally required for these feats to select them.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_DIAMOND_BODY:TAG: At 11th level, a monk gains immunity to ~poisons~[TAG_POISON] of all kinds.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_DIAMOND_SOUL:TAG: At 13th level, a monk gains ~spell resistance~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_SPELL_RESISTANCE] equal to her current monk level + 10.  In order to affect the monk with a spell, a spellcaster must get a result on a caster level check (1d20 + ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL]) that equals or exceeds the monk's spell resistance.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_EMPTY_BODY:TAG_M: At 19th level, a monk gains the ability to assume an ethereal state for 1 round per monk level per day.  She may go ethereal on a number of different occasions during any single day, as long as the total number of rounds spent in an ethereal state does not exceed her monk level.Note: In ToEE, the Empty Body ability has not been implemented.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_EVASION:TAG_MONK: A monk of 2nd level and higher can avoid even magical and unusual attacks with great agility.  If she makes a successful ~Reflex~[TAG_REFLEX] ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] against an attack that normally deals half damage on a successful save (such as a ~Fireball~[TAG_SPELLS_FIREBALL]), she instead takes no damage.  Evasion can be used only if a monk is wearing light armor or no armor.  A ~helpless~[TAG_HELPLESS] monk (such as the one who is ~unconscious~[TAG_UNCONSCIOUS] or ~paralyzed~[TAG_PARALYZED]) does not gain the benefit of evasion.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_FAST_MOVEMENT:TA: At 3rd level and higher, a monk gains an ~enhancement~[TAG_ENHANCEMENT_BONUS] bonus to her speed.  A monk in armor (even light armor) or carrying a medium or heavy load loses this extra speed.Level   @tSpeed3rd     @t+10 ft.6th     @t+20 ft.9th     @t+30 ft.12th    @t+40 ft.15th    @t+50 ft.18th    @t+60 ft.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_FLURRY_OF_BLOWS:: When unarmored, a monk may strike with a flurry of blows at the expense of accuracy.  When doing so, she may make one extra attack in a round at her highest ~base attack bonus~[TAG_LEVEL_BONUSES], but this attack takes a -2 penalty, as does each other attack made that round.  This penalty applies for 1 round, so it also affect ~attacks of opportunity~[TAG_AOO] the monk might make before her next action.     When a monk reaches 5th level, the penalty lessens to -1, and at 9th level it disappears entirely.  A monk must use a ~full attack~[TAG_FULL_ATTACK] action to strike with a flurry of blows.     When using flurry of blows, a monk may attack only with ~unarmed strikes~[TAG_WEAPONS_STRIKE_UNARMED] or with special monk weapons (~broom~[TAG_WEAPONS_BROOM], ~butterfly sword~[TAG_WEAPONS_SWORD_BUTTERFLY], ~dao~[TAG_WEAPONS_DAO], ~kama~[TAG_WEAPONS_KAMA], ~quarterstaff~[TAG_WEAPONS_QUARTERSTAFF], ~rake~[TAG_WEAPONS_RAKE], ~sai~[TAG_WEAPONS_SAI], ~shuriken~[TAG_WEAPONS_SHURIKEN], ~siangham~[TAG_WEAPONS_SIANGHAM], ~tonfa~[TAG_WEAPONS_TONFA], and ~war fan~[TAG_WEAPONS_WAR_FAN]).  She may attack with unarmed strikes and special monk weapons interchangeably as desired.     For example, at 6th level, the monk Ember could make one attack with her unarmed strike at an attack bonus of +3 and one attack with a special monk weapon at an attack bonus of +3.     When using weapons as a part of a flurry of blows, a monk applies her ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH] bonus to her damage rolls for all successful attacks, whether she wields a weapon in one or both hands.  The monk can't use any weapon other than a special monk weapon as part of a flurry of blows.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_IMPROVED_EVASION: At 9th level, a monk's evasion ability improves.  She still takes no damage on a successful ~Reflex~[TAG_REFLEX] ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] against attacks such as a ~Fireball~[TAG_SPELLS_FIREBALL], but henceforth she takes only half damage on a failed save.  A ~helpless~[TAG_HELPLESS] monk (such as one who is ~unconscious~[TAG_UNCONSCIOUS] or ~paralyzed~[TAG_PARALYZED]) does not gain the benefit of improved evasion.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_KI_STRIKE:TAG_MO: At 4th level, a monk's unarmed attacks are empowered with ki.  Her unarmed attacks are treated as magic weapons for the purpose of dealing damage to creatures with ~damage reduction~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_DAMAGE_REDUCTION].  Ki strike improves with the character's monk level.     At 10th level, her unarmed attacks are also treated as lawful weapons for the purpose of dealing damage to creatures with damage reduction.  At 16th level, her unarmed attacks are treated as ~adamantine~[TAG_ADAMANTINE] weapons for the purpose of dealing damage to creatures with damage reduction and bypassing hardness.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_PERFECT_SELF:TAG: At 20th level, a monk becomes a magical creature.  She is forevermore treated as an outsider rather than as a humanoid (or whatever the monk's creature type was) for the purpose of spells and magical effects.  Additionally, the monk gains ~damage reduction~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_DAMAGE_REDUCTION] 10/magic, which allows her to ignore the first 10 points of damage from any attack made by a nonmagical weapon or by any natural attack made by a creature that doesn't have similar damage reduction.  Unlike other outsiders, the monk can still be brought back from the dead as if she were a member of her previous creature type.Note: In ToEE, the Perfect Self ability has not been implemented.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_PURITY_OF_BODY:T: At 5th level, a monk gains control over her body's immune system.  She gains immunity to all ~diseases~[TAG_DISEASED] except for supernatural and magical diseases.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_QUIVERING_PALM:T: Starting at 15th level, a monk can set up vibrations within the body of another creature that can thereafter be fatal if the monk so desires.  She can use this quivering palm attack once a week, and she must announce her intent before making her ~attack roll~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL].  Constructs, oozes, plants, undead, incorporeal creatures, and creatures immune to ~critical hits~[TAG_CRITICAL_HIT] cannot be affected.  Otherwise, if the monk strikes successfully and the target takes damage from the blow, the quivering palm attack succeeds.  Thereafter the monk can try to slay the victim at any later time, as long as the attempt is made within a number of days equal to her monk level.  To make such an attempt, the monk merely wills the target to die (a ~free action~[TAG_FREE_ACTION]), and unless the target makes a ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] (DC 10 + 1/2 the monk's level + the monk's ~Wis~[TAG_WISDOM] modifier), it dies.  If the saving throw is successful, the target is no longer in danger from that particular quivering palm attack, but it may still be affected by another one at a later time.Note: In ToEE, the Quivering Palm ability has not been implemented.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_SLOW_FALL:TAG_DU: At 4th level and higher, a monk within arm's reach of a wall can use it to slow her descent.  When first using this ability, she takes damage as if the fall were 20 feet shorter than it actually is.  The monk's ability to slow her fall (that is, reduce the effective distance of the fall when next to a wall) improves with her monk level.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_STILL_MIND:TAG_M: A monk of 3rd level and higher gains a +2 bonus on ~saving throws~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] against spells and effects from the ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] school, since her meditation and training improve her resistance to mind-affecting attacks.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_STILL_MIND:TAG_DUMMY:: A monk of 3rd level and higher gains a +2 bonus on ~saving throws~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] against spells and effects from the ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] school, since her meditation and training improve her resistance to mind-affecting attacks.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_UNARMED_STRIKE:T: Monks are highly trained in fighting unarmed, giving them considerable advantages when doing so.  At 1st level, a monk gains ~Improved Unarmed Strike~[TAG_IMPROVED_UNARMED] as a bonus feat.  A monk's attacks may be with either fist interchangeably or even from elbows, knees, and feet.  This means that a monk may even make unarmed strikes with her hands full.  There is no such thing as an off-hand attack for a monk striking unarmed.  A monk may thus apply her full ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH] bonus on damage rolls for all her unarmed strikes.     Usually a monk's unarmed strikes deal lethal damage, but she can choose to deal ~nonlethal damage~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU_NONLETHAL_DAMAGE] instead with no penalty on her ~attack roll~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL].     A monk's unarmed strike is treated both as a manufactured weapon and a natural weapon for the purposes of spells and effects that enhance or improve either manufactured weapons or natural weapons (such as the ~Magic Fang~[TAG_SPELLS_MAGIC_FANG] and ~Magic Weapon~[TAG_SPELLS_MAGIC_WEAPON] spells).                                     Unarmed Damage TableLevel     ~small~[TAG_SIZE_MODIFIER] monk              ~medium~[TAG_SIZE_MODIFIER] monk                  ~large~[TAG_SIZE_MODIFIER] monk1                @t1d4                               @t1d6                              @t1d82                @t1d4                               @t1d6                              @t1d83                @t1d4                               @t1d6                              @t1d84                @t1d6                               @t1d8                              @t2d65                @t1d6                               @t1d8                              @t2d66                @t1d6                               @t1d8                              @t2d67                @t1d6                               @t1d8                              @t2d68                @t1d8                               @t1d10                            @t2d89                @t1d8                               @t1d10                            @t2d810               @t1d8                               @t1d10                            @t2d811               @t1d8 @t2d6                              @t3d616               @t2d6                             @t2d8                              @t3d817               @t2d6                             @t2d8                              @t3d818               @t2d6                             @t2d8                              @t3d819               @t2d6                             @t2d8                              @t3d820             @t2d8                             @t2d10                          @t4d8
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_WEAPON_ARMOR_PRO: Monks are proficient with certain basic peasant weapons and some special weapons that are part of monk training.     The weapons with which a monk is proficient are: ~club~[TAG_WEAPONS_CLUB], crossbow (~light~[TAG_WEAPONS_CROSSBOW_LIGHT] or ~heavy~[TAG_WEAPONS_CROSSBOW_HEAVY]), ~dagger~[TAG_WEAPONS_DAGGER], ~handaxe~[TAG_WEAPONS_HANDAXE], ~javelin~[TAG_WEAPONS_JAVELIN], ~kama~[TAG_WEAPONS_KAMA], ~quarterstaff~[TAG_WEAPONS_QUARTERSTAFF], ~sai~[TAG_WEAPONS_SAI], ~shuriken~[TAG_WEAPONS_SHURIKEN], ~siangham~[TAG_WEAPONS_SIANGHAM], and ~sling~[TAG_WEAPONS_SLING]     Monks are not proficient with any armor or shield--in fact, many of the monk's special powers require unfettered movement.     When wearing armor, using a shield, or carrying a medium or heavy load, a monk loses her ~AC bonus~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_AC_BONUS], as well as her ~Fast Movement~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_FAST_MOVEMENT] and ~Flurry of Blows~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_FLURRY_OF_BLOWS] abilities.     Special monk weapons include the ~broom~[TAG_WEAPONS_BROOM], ~butterfly sword~[TAG_WEAPONS_SWORD_BUTTERFLY], ~dao~[TAG_WEAPONS_DAO], ~kama~[TAG_WEAPONS_KAMA], ~quarterstaff~[TAG_WEAPONS_QUARTERSTAFF], ~rake~[TAG_WEAPONS_RAKE], ~sai~[TAG_WEAPONS_SAI], ~shuriken~[TAG_WEAPONS_SHURIKEN], ~siangham~[TAG_WEAPONS_SIANGHAM], ~tonfa~[TAG_WEAPONS_TONFA], and ~war fan~[TAG_WEAPONS_WAR_FAN].  A monk can perform ~Flurry of Blows~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_FLURRY_OF_BLOWS] while wielding a special monk weapon.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_WHOLENESS_OF_BOD: At 7th level or higher, a monk can heal her own wounds.  She can heal a number of ~hit points~[TAG_HIT_POINTS] of damage equal to twice her current monk level each day, and she can spread this healing out among several uses.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK:TAG_DUMMY:::1: Monk Base Attack & Base Save Bonuses
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_PALADIN_AURA_OF_COURA: Beginning at 3rd level, a paladin is immune to ~fear~[TAG_FEAR] (magical or otherwise).  Each ally within 10 feet of her gains a +4 morale bonus on ~saving throws~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] against fear effects.  This ability functions while the paladin is conscious, but not if she is ~unconscious~[TAG_UNCONSCIOUS] or ~dead~[TAG_DEAD].
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_PALADIN_AURA_OF_GOOD:: The power of a paladin's aura of good (see the ~Detect Good~[TAG_SPELLS_DETECT_GOOD] spell) is equal to her paladin level, just like the aura of a ~cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] of a good ~deity~[TAG_RELIGION].
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_PALADIN_DETECT_EVIL:T: At will, a paladin can use the spell ~Detect Evil~[TAG_SPELLS_DETECT_EVIL].
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_PALADIN_DIVINE_GRACE:: At 2nd level, a paladin gains a bonus equal to her ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA] bonus (if any) on all ~saving throws~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC].
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_PALADIN_DIVINE_HEALTH: At 3rd level, a paladin gains immunity to all ~diseases~[TAG_DISEASED], including supernatural and magical diseases.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_PALADIN_LAY_ON_HANDS:: Beginning at 2nd level, a paladin with a ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA] score of 12 or higher can heal wounds (her own or those of others) by touch.  Each day she can heal a total number of ~hit points~[TAG_HIT_POINTS] of damage equal to:                 the paladin's level x the paladin's Charisma bonus     For example, a 7th-level paladin with a 16 Charisma (+3 bonus) can heal 21 points of damage per day.  A paladin may choose to divide her healing among multiple recipients, and she doesn't have to use it all at once.  Using lay on hands is a ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION].     Alternatively, a paladin can use any or all of this healing power to deal damage to undead creatures.  Using lay on hands in this way requires a successful melee touch attack and doesn't provide an ~attack of opportunity~[TAG_AOO].  The paladin decides how many of her daily allotment of points to use as damage after successfully touching an undead creature.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_PALADIN_REMOVE_DISEAS: At 6th level, a paladin can produce a ~Remove Disease~[TAG_SPELLS_REMOVE_DISEASE] effect, as the spell, once per week.  She can use this ability one additional time per week for every three levels after 6th (twice per week at 9th, three times at 12th, and so forth).
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_PALADIN_SMITE_EVIL:TA: Once per day a paladin may attempt to smite evil with one normal ~melee attack~[TAG_MELEE_ATTACKS].  She adds her ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA] bonus (if any) to her ~attack roll~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] and deals 1 extra point of damage per paladin level.  If the paladin accidentally smites a creature that is not evil, the smite has no effect, but the ability is still used up for that day.     At 5th level, and at every five levels thereafter, the paladin may smite evil one additional time per day to a maximum of five times per day at 20th level.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_PALADIN_TURN_UNDEAD:T: When a paladin reaches 4th level, she gains the supernatural ability to ~turn undead~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_CLERIC_TURN_REBUKE_UNDEAD].  She may use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + her ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA] modifier.  She turns undead as a ~cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] of three levels lower would.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_PALADIN_WEAPON_ARMOR_: Paladins are proficient with all ~simple~[TAG_SIMPLE_WEAPONS] and ~martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_WEAPONS] weapons, with all types of armor (~heavy~[TAG_ARMOR_HEAVY], ~medium~[TAG_ARMOR_MEDIUM], and ~light~[TAG_ARMOR_LIGHT]) and with ~shields~[TAG_ARMOR_SHIELD].
TAG_EX_PALADIN:TAG_PALADINS:::2: A paladin who ceases to be ~Lawful Good~[TAG_LAWFUL_GOOD], who willfully commits an evil act, or who grossly violates the code of conduct loses all paladin spells and abilities.  She may not progress any farther in levels as a paladin.     She regains her abilities and advancement potential if she ~atones~[TAG_SPELLS_ATONEMENT] for her violations.  High ranking ~clerics~[TAG_CLERICS] of good gods can help fallen paladins atone for their past deeds.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_PALADIN:TAG_DUMMY:::1: Paladin Base Attack & Base Save Bonuses
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_RANGER_ANIMAL_COMPANI: At 4th level, a ranger gains an animal companion that must be selected from the following list:     Attack Dog, Brown Bear, Chicken, Dire Rat, Giant Lizard, Jackal, Panda Bear, Polar Bear, or Wolf     This animal is a loyal companion that accompanies the ranger on his adventures as appropriate for its species.     This ability functions like the ~druid ability~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_DRUID_ANIMAL_COMPANION] of the same name, except that the ranger's effective ~druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] level is one-half his ranger level. A ranger may select from the alternative lists of animal companions just as a druid can, though again his effective druid level is half his ranger level.Animal Companion ListLevels 4-7+:~Attack Dog~[TAG_MONSTER_ATTACK_DOG]~Chicken~[TAG_MONSTER_CHICKEN]~Dire Rat~[TAG_MONSTER_DIRE_RAT]~Jackal~[TAG_MONSTER_JACKAL]~Wolf~[TAG_MONSTER_WOLF]Levels 8-13+:~Black Bear~[TAG_MONSTER_BLACK_BEAR]~Giant Lizard~[TAG_MONSTER_GIANT_LIZARD]~Panda Bear~[TAG_MONSTER_PANDA_BEAR]Levels 14-19+:~Brown Bear~[TAG_MONSTER_BROWN_BEAR]Level 20:~Polar Bear~[TAG_MONSTER_POLAR_BEAR]
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_RANGER_COMBAT_STYLE:T: At 2nd level, a ranger must select one of two combat styles to pursue: Archery or Two-Weapon Combat     If the ranger selects Archery, he is treated as having the ~Rapid Shot~[TAG_RAPID_SHOT] feat, even if he does not have the normal prerequisites for that feat.     If the ranger selects Two-Weapon Combat, he is treated as having the ~Two-Weapon Fighting~[TAG_TWO_FIGHTING] feat, even if he does not have the normal prerequisites for that feat.     The benefits of the ranger's chosen style apply only when he wears light or no armor.  He loses all benefits of his combat style when wearing medium or heavy armor.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_RANGER_EVASION:TAG_RA: At 9th level, a ranger can avoid even magical and unusual attacks with great agility.  If he makes a successful ~Reflex~[TAG_REFLEX] ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] against an attack that normally deals half damage on a successful save (such as a ~Fireball~[TAG_SPELLS_FIREBALL]), he instead takes no damage.  Evasion can be used only if a ranger is wearing light armor or no armor.  A ~helpless~[TAG_HELPLESS] ranger (such as one who is ~unconscious~[TAG_UNCONSCIOUS] or ~paralyzed~[TAG_PARALYZED]) does not gain the benefit of evasion.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_RANGER_FAVORED_ENEMY:: At 1st level, a ranger selects a type of creature to act as his favorite enemy.  Due to his extensive study of his chosen type of foe and training in the proper techniques for combating such creatures, the ranger gains a +2 bonus on ~Bluff~[TAG_BLUFF], ~Listen~[TAG_LISTEN], ~Sense Motive~[TAG_SENSE_MOTIVE], ~Spot~[TAG_SPOT], and ~Survival~[TAG_SURVIVAL] checks when using these ~skills~[TAG_SKILLS] against creatures of this type.  Likewise, he gets a +2 bonus on weapon damage rolls against such creatures.     At 5th level and every five levels thereafter (10th, 15th, and 20th level), the ranger may select an additional favored enemy.  In addition, at each interval, the bonus against any one favored enemy (including the one just selected, if so desired) increases by 2.  For example, a 5th-level ranger has two favored enemies; against one he gains a +4 bonus on Bluff, Listen, Sense Motive, Spot, and Survival checks and weapon damage rolls, and against the other he has a +2 bonus.  At 10th level, he has three favored enemies, and he gains an additional +2 bonus, which he can allocate to the bonus against any one of his three favored enemies.  Thus, his bonuses could be either +4, +4, +2, or +6, +2, +2.     If a specific creature falls into more than one category of favored enemy (for instance, devils are both evil outsiders and lawful outsiders), the ranger's bonuses do not stack; he simply uses whichever bonus is higher.Note: At Levels 15 and 20, you may have to select a previously chosen Favored Enemy, as a new Favored Enemy, if you want your ranger to receive the +2 bonus against that creature type.Ranger Favored Enemy typesAberrationAnimalBeastConstructDragonElementalFeyGiantMagical BeastMonstrous HumanoidOozePlantShapechangerUndeadVerminEvil OutsiderGood OutsiderLawful OutsiderChaotic OutsiderGoblinoidReptilianDwarfElfGnollGnomeHalflingOrcHuman
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_RANGER_IMPROVED_COMBA: At 6th level, a ranger's aptitude in a chosen combat style (Archery or Two-Weapon Combat) improves.     If he selected Archery at 2nd level, he is treated as having the ~Manyshot~[TAG_MANYSHOT] feat, even if he does not have the normal prerequisites for that feat.     If the ranger selected Two-Weapon Combat at 2nd level, he is treated as having the ~Improved Two-Weapon Fighting~[TAG_IMPROVED_TWO_WEAPON_FIGHTING] feat, even if he does not have the normal prerequisites for that feat.     As before, the benefits of the ranger's combat style apply only when he wears light or no armor.  He loses all benefits of his combat style when wearing medium or heavy armor.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_RANGER_SWIFT_TRACKER:: Beginning at 8th level, a ranger can move at his normal speed while following tracks without taking the normal -5 penalty.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_RANGER_TRACK:TAG_RANG: A ranger gains ~Track~[TAG_TRACK] as a bonus feat.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_RANGER_WEAPON_ARMOR_P: A ranger is proficient with all ~simple~[TAG_SIMPLE_WEAPONS] and ~martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_WEAPONS] weapons, and with ~light~[TAG_ARMOR_LIGHT] armor and ~shields~[TAG_ARMOR_SHIELD].
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_RANGER:TAG_DUMMY:::1: Ranger Base Attack & Base Save Bonuses
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_CRIPPLING_STRIK: On attaining 10th, 13th, 16th, and 19th levels, a rogue gains a special ability of her choice from among Crippling Strike, ~Defensive Roll~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_DEFENSIVE_ROLL], ~Improved Evasion~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_IMPROVED_EVASION], ~Opportunist~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_OPPORTUNIST], and ~Slippery Mind~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_SLIPPERY_MIND].  The following describes Crippling Strike.     A rogue with this ability can ~sneak attack~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_SNEAK_ATTACK] opponents with such precision that her blows weaken and hamper them.  An opponent damaged by one of her sneak attacks also takes 2 points of ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH] damage.  Ability points lost to damage return on their own at the rate of 1 point per day for each damaged ability.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_DEFENSIVE_ROLL:: On attaining 10th, 13th, 16th, and 19th levels, a rogue gains a special ability of her choice from among ~Crippling Strike~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_CRIPPLING_STRIKE], Defensive Roll, ~Improved Evasion~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_IMPROVED_EVASION], ~Opportunist~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_OPPORTUNIST], and ~Slippery Mind~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_SLIPPERY_MIND].  The following describes Defensive Roll.     The rogue can roll with a potentially lethal blow to take less damage from it than she otherwise would.  Once per day, when she would be reduced to 0 or fewer ~hit points~[TAG_HIT_POINTS] by damage in combat (from a weapon or other blow, not a spell or special ability), the rogue can attempt to roll with the damage.  To use this ability, the rogue must attempt a ~Reflex~[TAG_REFLEX] ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC]:                                               DC = damage dealt     If the save succeeds, she takes only half damage from the blow; if it fails, she takes full damage.  She must be aware of the attack and able to react to it in order to execute her defensive roll--if she is denied her ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY] bonus to ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS], she can't use this ability.  Since this effect would not normally allow a character to make a Reflex save for half damage, the rogue's ~evasion~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_EVASION] ability does not apply to the defensive roll.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_EVASION:TAG_ROG: A rogue of 2nd level and higher can avoid even magical and unusual attacks with great agility.  If she makes a successful ~Reflex~[TAG_REFLEX] ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] against an attack that normally deals half damage on a successful save (such as a ~Fireball~[TAG_SPELLS_FIREBALL]), she instead takes no damage.  Evasion can be used only if a rogue is wearing light armor or no armor.  A ~helpless~[TAG_HELPLESS] rogue (such as one who is ~unconscious~[TAG_UNCONSCIOUS] or ~paralyzed~[TAG_PARALYZED]) does not gain the benefit of evasion.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_IMPROVED_EVASIO: On attaining 10th, 13th, 16th, and 19th levels, a rogue gains a special ability of her choice from among ~Crippling Strike~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_CRIPPLING_STRIKE], ~Defensive Roll~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_DEFENSIVE_ROLL], Improved Evasion, ~Opportunist~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_OPPORTUNIST], and ~Slippery Mind~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_SLIPPERY_MIND].  The following describes Improved Evasion.     This ability works like ~evasion~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_EVASION], except that while the rogue still takes no damage on a successful ~Reflex~[TAG_REFLEX] ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] against attacks such as a dragon's breath weapon or a ~Fireball~[TAG_SPELLS_FIREBALL], henceforth she takes only half damage on a failed save.  A ~helpless~[TAG_HELPLESS] rogue (such as one who is ~unconscious~[TAG_UNCONSCIOUS] or ~paralyzed~[TAG_PARALYZED]) does not gain the benefit of improved evasion.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_IMPROVED_UNCANN: A rogue of 8th level or higher can no longer be ~flanked~[TAG_FLANKING]; she can react to opponents on opposite sides of her as easily as she can react to a single attacker. This defense denies another rogue the ability to ~sneak attack~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_SNEAK_ATTACK] the rogue by flanking her, unless the attacker has at least four more rogue levels than the target does.     If a character already has ~uncanny dodge~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_BARBARIAN_UNCANNY_DODGE] from a second class, the character automatically gains improved uncanny dodge instead, and the levels from the classes that grant uncanny dodge stack to determine the minimum rogue level required to flank the character.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_OPPORTUNIST:TAG: On attaining 10th, 13th, 16th, and 19th levels, a rogue gains a special ability of her choice from among ~Crippling Strike~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_CRIPPLING_STRIKE], ~Defensive Roll~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_DEFENSIVE_ROLL], ~Improved Evasion~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_IMPROVED_EVASION], Opportunist, and ~Slippery Mind~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_SLIPPERY_MIND].  The following describes Opportunist.     Once per round, the rogue can make an ~attack of opportunity~[TAG_AOO] against an opponent who has just been struck for damage in melee by another character.  This attack counts as the rogue's attack of opportunity for that round.  Even a rogue with the ~Combat Reflexes~[TAG_COMBAT_REFLEXES] feat can't use the opportunist ability more than once per round.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_SKILL_MASTERY:T: On attaining 10th level, a rogue gains the special ability of Skill Mastery.  The following describes Skill Mastery.     The rogue becomes so certain in the use of certain ~skills~[TAG_SKILLS] that she can use them reliably even under adverse conditions.  Upon gaining this ability, she selects a number of skills equal to 3 + her ~Intelligence~[TAG_INTELLIGENCE] modifier.  When making a ~skill check~[TAG_USING_SKILLS] with one of these skills, she gains a +2 bonus.  This bonus stacks with ~Skill Focus~[TAG_SKILL_FOCUS].Note: In ToEE, the Skill Mastery ability has not been implemented.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_SLIPPERY_MIND:T: On attaining 10th, 13th, 16th, and 19th levels, a rogue gains a special ability of her choice from among ~Crippling Strike~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_CRIPPLING_STRIKE], ~Defensive Roll~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_DEFENSIVE_ROLL], ~Improved Evasion~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_IMPROVED_EVASION], ~Opportunist~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_OPPORTUNIST], and Slippery Mind.  The following describes Slippery Mind.     This ability represents the rogue's ability to wriggle free from magical effects that would otherwise control or compel her.  If a rogue with slippery mind is affected by an ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] spell or effect and fails her ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC], she can attempt it again 1 round later at the same DC.  She gets only this one extra chance to succeed on her saving throw.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_SNEAK_ATTACK:TA: If a rogue can catch an opponent when he is unable to defend himself effectively from her attack, she can strike a vital spot for extra damage.  Basically, the rogue's attack deals extra damage any time her target would be denied a ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY] bonus to ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS] (whether the target actually has a Dexterity bonus or not), or when the rogue ~flanks~[TAG_FLANKING] her target.  This extra damage is 1d6 at 1st level, and it increases by 1d6 every two rogue levels thereafter.  Should the rogue score a ~critical hit~[TAG_CRITICAL_HIT] with a sneak attack, this extra damage is not multiplied.     ~Ranged attacks~[TAG_RANGED_ATTACKS] can count as sneak attacks only if the target is within 30 feet.  A rogue can't strike with deadly accuracy from beyond that range.  With a ~sap~[TAG_WEAPONS_SAP] (blackjack) or an ~unarmed strike~[TAG_WEAPONS_STRIKE_UNARMED], a rogue can make a sneak attack that deals ~nonlethal damage~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU_NONLETHAL_DAMAGE] instead of lethal damage.  She cannot use a weapon that deals lethal damage to deal nonlethal damage in a sneak attack, not even with the usual -4 penalty, because she must make optimal use of her weapon in order to execute a sneak attack.     A rogue can sneak attack only living creatures with discernible anatomies--undead, constructs, oozes, plants, and incorporeal creatures lack vital areas to attack.  Any creature that is immune to critical hits is not vulnerable to sneak attacks.  The rogue must be able to see the target well enough to pick out a vital spot and must be able to reach such a spot.  A rogue cannot sneak attack while striking a creature with ~concealment~[TAG_CONCEALMENT] or striking the limbs of a creature whose vitals are beyond reach.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_TRAPS:TAG_ROGUE: Trapfinding: Rogues (and only rogues) can use the ~Search~[TAG_SEARCH] skill to locate traps when the task has a Difficulty Class higher than 20.  Finding a nonmagical trap has a DC of at least 20, or higher if it is well hidden.  Finding a magic trap has a DC of 25 + the level of the spell used to create it.     Rogues (and only rogues) can use the ~Disable Device~[TAG_DISABLE_DEVICE] skill to disarm magic traps.  A magic trap generally has a DC of 25 + the level of the spell used to create it.     A rogue who beats a trap's DC by 10 or more with a Disable Device check can study a trap, figure out how it works, and bypass it (with her party) without disarming it.Trap Sense: At 3rd level, a rogue gains an intuitive sense that alerts her to danger from traps, giving her a +1 bonus on ~Reflex~[TAG_REFLEX] saves made to avoid traps and a +1 dodge bonus to ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS] against attacks made by traps.  These bonuses rise to +2 when the rogue reaches 6th level, to +3 when she reaches 9th level, to +4 when she reaches 12th level, to +5 at 15th, and to +6 at 18th level.  Trap bonuses gained from multiple classes stack.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_UNCANNY_DODGE:T: Starting at 4th level, a rogue can react to danger before her senses would normally allow her to do so.  She retains her ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY] bonus to ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS] (if any) even if she is caught ~flat-footed~[TAG_FLAT_FOOTED] or struck by an ~invisible~[TAG_INVISIBLE] attacker.  However, she still loses her Dexterity bonus to AC if immobilized.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_WEAPON_ARMOR_PR: Rogues are proficient with all ~simple weapons~[TAG_SIMPLE_WEAPONS], plus the ~rapier~[TAG_WEAPONS_RAPIER], ~shortbow~[TAG_WEAPONS_SHORTBOW], and ~short sword~[TAG_WEAPONS_SWORD_SHORT].     Rogues are proficient with ~light~[TAG_ARMOR_LIGHT] armor, but not with shields.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE:TAG_DUMMY:::1: Rogue Base Attack & Base Save Bonuses
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_SORCERER_CALL_FAMILIA: A sorcerer can obtain a familiar.  A familiar is a magical beast that resembles a small animal and is unusually tough and intelligent.  The creature serves as a companion and a servant.     The sorcerer chooses the kind of familiar he gets (see list below) and gives it a name.  As the sorcerer advances in level, his familiar also increases in power.     The master of a familiar gains the benefit of a special bonus and the ~Alertness~[TAG_ALERTNESS] feat.     A sorcerer may summon his familiar as a party member using the ~radial menu~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU].  He can have the familiar return to his ~inventory~[TAG_HMU_CHAR_INVENTORY_UI] by using the ~Talk~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU_TALK] command with the familiar.     If the familiar dies, the sorcerer must attempt a DC 15 ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC].  Failure means he loses 200 ~experience points~[TAG_EXPERIENCE_AND_LEVELS] per sorcerer level; success reduces the loss to one-half that amount.  However, a sorcerer's experience point total can never go below zero as the result of a familiar's demise.  A slain familiar can be raised from the dead just as a character can be, and it does not lose a level or ~Constitution~[TAG_CONSTITUTION] point when this happy event occurs.     A slain or dismissed familiar cannot be replaced for a year and day.  A character with more than one class that grants a familiar may have only one familiar at a time.Sorcerer FamiliarsFamiliar    @tSpecial~Bat~[TAG_MONSTER_FAMILIAR_BAT]         @tMaster gains a +3 bonus on ~Listen~[TAG_LISTEN] checks~Cat~[TAG_MONSTER_FAMILIAR_CAT]         @tMaster gains a +3 bonus on ~Move Silently~[TAG_MOVE_SILENTLY] checks~Hawk~[TAG_MONSTER_FAMILIAR_HAWK]        @tMaster gains a +3 bonus on ~Spot~[TAG_SPOT] checks~Lizard~[TAG_MONSTER_FAMILIAR_LIZARD]      @tMaster gains a +2 bonus on ~Will~[TAG_WILL] saves~Owl~[TAG_MONSTER_FAMILIAR_OWL]         @tMaster gains a +3 bonus on Spot checks~Rat~[TAG_MONSTER_FAMILIAR_RAT]         @tMaster gains a +2 bonus on Fortitude saves~Raven~[TAG_MONSTER_FAMILIAR_RAVEN]       @tMaster gains a +3 bonus on ~Appraise~[TAG_APPRAISE] checks~Snake~[TAG_MONSTER_FAMILIAR_SNAKE]       @tMaster gains a +3 bonus on ~Bluff~[TAG_BLUFF] checks~Toad~[TAG_MONSTER_FAMILIAR_TOAD]        @tMaster gains a +3 ~hit points~[TAG_HIT_POINTS]~Weasel~[TAG_MONSTER_FAMILIAR_WEASEL]      @tMaster gains a +2 bonus on ~Reflex~[TAG_REFLEX] saves
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_SORCERER_WEAPON_ARMOR: Sorcerers are proficient with all ~simple weapons~[TAG_SIMPLE_WEAPONS].     They are not proficient with any type of armor, nor with shields.     Armor of any type ~interferes~[TAG_ARCANE_SPELL_FAILURE] with a sorcerer's arcane gestures, which can cause his spells to fail (if those spells have somatic components).
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_SORCERER:TAG_DUMMY:::: Sorcerer Base Attack & Base Save Bonuses
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_WIZARD_BONUS_FEATS:TA: At 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th level, a wizard gains a bonus feat.  At each such opportunity, he can choose an item creation feat or a metamagic feat.  The wizard must still meet all prerequisites for a bonus feat, including ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] minimums.  These bonus feats are in addition to the feat that a character of any class gets every three levels.List of Wizard Bonus Feats~Item Creation Feats~[TAG_ITEM_CREATION]~Metamagic Feats~[TAG_METAMAGIC]
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_WIZARD_CALL_FAMILIAR:: A wizard can call a familiar.  A familiar is a magical, unusually tough and intelligent version of a small animal.  It is a magical beast, not an animal.  The creature serves as a companion and servant.     The wizard chooses the type of familiar he gets (see list below) and gives it a name.  As the wizard increases in level, his familiar also increases in power.     The master of a familiar gains the benefit of a special bonus and the ~Alertness~[TAG_ALERTNESS] feat.     A wizard may summon his familiar as a party member using the ~radial menu~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU].  He can have the familiar return to his ~inventory~[TAG_HMU_CHAR_INVENTORY_UI] by using the ~Talk~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU_TALK] command with the familiar.     If the familiar dies, the wizard must attempt a ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] (DC 15).  If the saving throw fails, the wizard loses 200 ~experience points~[TAG_EXPERIENCE_AND_LEVELS] per class level.  A successful saving throw reduces the loss to half of that amount.  However, a wizard's experience point total can never go below zero as the result of a familiar's demise.  Slain familiars can be raised from the dead just as characters can be, but do not lose a level or a ~Constitution~[TAG_CONSTITUTION] point when this joyful event occurs.     A slain or dismissed familiar cannot be replaced for a year and day.  A character with more than one class that grants a familiar may have only one familiar at a time.Wizard FamiliarsFamiliar    @tSpecial~Bat~[TAG_MONSTER_FAMILIAR_BAT]         @tMaster gains a +3 bonus on ~Listen~[TAG_LISTEN] checks~Cat~[TAG_MONSTER_FAMILIAR_CAT]         @tMaster gains a +3 bonus on ~Move Silently~[TAG_MOVE_SILENTLY] checks~Hawk~[TAG_MONSTER_FAMILIAR_HAWK]        @tMaster gains a +3 bonus on ~Spot~[TAG_SPOT] checks~Lizard~[TAG_MONSTER_FAMILIAR_LIZARD]      @tMaster gains a +2 bonus on ~Will~[TAG_WILL] saves~Owl~[TAG_MONSTER_FAMILIAR_OWL]         @tMaster gains a +3 bonus on Spot checks~Rat~[TAG_MONSTER_FAMILIAR_RAT]         @tMaster gains a +2 bonus on Fortitude saves~Raven~[TAG_MONSTER_FAMILIAR_RAVEN]       @tMaster gains a +3 bonus on ~Appraise~[TAG_APPRAISE] checks~Snake~[TAG_MONSTER_FAMILIAR_SNAKE]       @tMaster gains a +3 bonus on ~Bluff~[TAG_BLUFF] checks~Toad~[TAG_MONSTER_FAMILIAR_TOAD]        @tMaster gains a +3 ~hit points~[TAG_HIT_POINTS]~Weasel~[TAG_MONSTER_FAMILIAR_WEASEL]      @tMaster gains a +2 bonus on ~Reflex~[TAG_REFLEX] saves
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_WIZARD_SCRIBE_SCROLL:: At 1st level, a wizard gains ~Scribe Scroll~[TAG_SCRIBE_SCROLL] as a bonus feat.  This feat enables him to create magic scrolls.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_WIZARD_SPELLBOOK:TAG_: A wizard must study his spellbook each day to prepare his spells.  A wizard begins play with a spellbook containing all 0-level wizard spells (except those from his prohibited schools, if any) plus two 1st-level spells of your choice.  For each point of ~Intelligence~[TAG_INTELLIGENCE] bonus the wizard has, the spellbook holds one additional 1st-level spell of your choice.  At each new wizard level, he gains two new spells of any spell level or levels that he can cast (based on his new wizard level) for his spellbook.     A wizard can also copy spells into his spellbook from scrolls.  To start, first the wizard needs at least 1 ~skill point~[TAG_ACQUIRE_SKILLS] in the ~Spellcraft~[TAG_SPELLCRAFT] skill for training.  Then you select a scroll that the wizard has in his ~inventory~[TAG_HMU_CHAR_INVENTORY_UI] by using the ~radial menu~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU] and under the Person icon, select Copy Scroll.  The wizard must make a Spellcraft check against a DC of:                                           15 + the spell's level     If successful, the spell is entered into his spellbook and the scroll is destroyed.  If unsuccessful, the scroll is unharmed, but the wizard may not try again until he gains at least one more rank in Spellcraft.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_WIZARD_WEAPON_ARMOR_P: Wizards are proficient with the ~club~[TAG_WEAPONS_CLUB], ~dagger~[TAG_WEAPONS_DAGGER], ~heavy crossbow~[TAG_WEAPONS_CROSSBOW_HEAVY], ~light crossbow~[TAG_WEAPONS_CROSSBOW_LIGHT], and ~quarterstaff~[TAG_WEAPONS_QUARTERSTAFF].     Wizards are not proficient with any type of armor nor with shields.     Armor of any type ~interferes~[TAG_ARCANE_SPELL_FAILURE] with a wizard's movements, which can cause his spells to fail (if those spells have somatic components).
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_WIZARD:TAG_DUMMY:::1: Wizard Base Attack & Base Save Bonuses
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ANIMAL_COMPANION:TAG_: A druid may begin play with an animal companion that must be selected from the druid ~Animal Companions~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_DRUID_ANIMAL_COMPANION].  At 4th level, a ranger gains an animal companion that must be selected from the ranger ~Animal Companions~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_RANGER_ANIMAL_COMPANION].
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_CALL_FAMILIAR:TAG_DUM: A sorcerer can call a ~familiar~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_SORCERER_CALL_FAMILIAR].  A wizard can also call a ~familiar~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_WIZARD_CALL_FAMILIAR].
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_EVASION:TAG_DUMMY:::2: A monk or rogue of 2nd level and higher or a ranger of 9th level and higher can avoid even magical and unusual attacks with great agility.  If he makes a successful ~Reflex~[TAG_REFLEX] ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] against an attack that normally deals half damage on a successful save (such as a ~Fireball~[TAG_SPELLS_FIREBALL]), he instead takes no damage.  Evasion can be used only if a monk, rogue, or ranger is wearing light armor or no armor.  A ~helpless~[TAG_HELPLESS] monk, rogue, or ranger (such as one who is ~unconscious~[TAG_UNCONSCIOUS] or ~paralyzed~[TAG_PARALYZED]) does not gain the benefit of evasion.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_FAST_MOVEMENT:TAG_DUM: A barbarian's land speed is ~faster~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_BARBARIAN_FAST_MOVEMENT] than the norm for his race by +10 feet.  This benefit applies only when he is wearing no armor, light armor, or medium armor, and not carrying a heavy load.  Apply this bonus before modifying the barbarian's speed because of any load carried or armor worn.At 3rd level and higher, a monk gains an enhancement ~bonus~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_MONK_FAST_MOVEMENT] to her speed.  A monk in armor (even light armor) or carrying a medium or heavy load loses this extra speed.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_IMPROVED_EVASION:TAG_: At 9th level, a monk's evasion ability improves.  On attaining 10th, 13th, 16th, and 19th levels, a rogue may gain (your choice) the special ability of improved evasion.  This ability works like ~evasion~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_EVASION], except that while the monk or rogue still takes no damage on a successful ~Reflex~[TAG_REFLEX] ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] against attacks such as a ~Fireball~[TAG_SPELLS_FIREBALL], but henceforth she takes only half damage on a failed save.  A ~helpless~[TAG_HELPLESS] monk or rogue (such as one who is ~unconscious~[TAG_UNCONSCIOUS] or ~paralyzed~[TAG_PARALYZED]) does not gain the benefit of improved evasion.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_IMPROVED_UNCANNY_DODG: A barbarian of 5th level or higher or a rogue of 8th level or higher can no longer be ~flanked~[TAG_FLANKING]; he can react to opponents on opposite sides of him as easily as he can react to a single attacker.  This defense denies a ~rogue~[TAG_ROGUES] the ability to ~sneak attack~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_SNEAK_ATTACK] the barbarian or rogue by flanking him, unless the attacker has at least four more rogue levels than the target has barbarian or rogue levels.     If a character already has ~uncanny dodge~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_UNCANNY_DODGE] from a second class, the character automatically gains improved uncanny dodge instead, and the levels from the classes that grant uncanny dodge stack to determine the minimum rogue level required to flank the character.
TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_UNCANNY_DODGE:TAG_DUM: A barbarian at 2nd level or a rogue at 4th level gains the ability to react to danger before his senses would normally allow him to do so.  He retains his ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY] bonus to ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS] (if any) even if he is caught ~flat-footed~[TAG_FLAT_FOOTED] or struck by an ~invisible~[TAG_INVISIBLE] attacker.  However, he still loses his Dexterity bonus to AC if immobilized.
TAG_SKILLS::::2: A character's skills represent a variety of abilities. As a character advances in level, he or she gets better at using some or all of her skills.[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_ACQUIRE_SKILLS:TAG_SKILLS:::2: Characters begin with a certain number of skill points to assign to various skills. Depending on the class, this is 2, 4, 6, or 8 + the ~Intelligence~[TAG_INTELLIGENCE] modifier, and then multiplied by 4. ~Humans~[TAG_HUMANS] gain an extra 4 skill points.              ~Clerics~[TAG_CLERICS], ~Fighters~[TAG_FIGHTERS], ~Paladins~[TAG_PALADINS], ~Sorcerers~[TAG_SORCERERS], and ~Wizards~[TAG_WIZARDS]                                        (2 + Int modifier) x 4                                ~Barbarians~[TAG_BARBARIANS], ~Druids~[TAG_DRUIDS], and ~Monks~[TAG_MONKS]                                        (4 + Int modifier) x 4                                           ~Bards~[TAG_BARDS] and ~Rangers~[TAG_RANGERS]                                        (6 + Int modifier) x 4                                                      ~Rogues~[TAG_ROGUES]                                        (8 + Int modifier) x 4After first level, skill points are assigned at the same rates above, but without the x 4 multiplier. Thus a 2nd level bard gains 6 + Int modifier new skill points. Humans gain one extra skill point each level as well.To spend skill points to buy skill ranks, one skill point can be spent for each class skill. If a character wants to buy a non-class skill rank, he or she must spend 2 skill points to gain one rank, or one skill point to gain a half rank.A character may never buy more than their level + 3 skill ranks in any one class skill. So a 4th level rogue cannot buy skill ranks above level 7 for class skills. For non-class skills, this maximum number is halved. So the same level 4 rogue could not buy ranks above 3.5 in any non-class skill.
TAG_USING_SKILLS:TAG_SKILLS:::2: Skills are used by performing skill checks.To make a skill check, roll:                                        1d20 + skill modifier(skill modifier = skill rank + ability modifier + miscellaneous modifiers)Each skill has a key ability associated with it, which affects the ability modifier above. Miscellaneous modifiers include racial bonuses, armor check penalties, and bonuses provided by feats, among others.Some checks are made against a DC (difficulty class). This number is assigned according to the situation, and then the skill check is made against it. If the skill check roll matches or exceeds the DC, the skill has been performed successfully.Usually a character can try again on a fail, although time may pass. If failure would result in danger, then trying again may not be possible.Characters may perform untrained skill checks against their key ability modifiers.
TAG_APPRAISE:TAG_SKILL_DES:::2: Use this skill to tell an antique from junk, an old, fancy sword from an elven heirloom, and high-quality jewelry from cheap imitations. In the game, the displayed values for items that appear in the bartering interfaces will be modified depending upon your level of expertise (or rank) in Appraise.  Therefore, you will be able to purchase items for less money, and in turn sell items for more profit, if you have a higher Appraise skill. The key ability for Appraise is ~Intelligence~[TAG_INTELLIGENCE].
TAG_BLUFF :TAG_SKILL_DES:::2: You can make the outrageous or the untrue seem plausible. The skill encompasses acting, conning, fast talking, misdirection, and misleading body language.  A ~Sense Motive~[TAG_SENSE_MOTIVE] check allows an NPC to determine if you are bluffing.  Bluff can also be used to ~feint~[TAG_FEINT] an opponent in combat. In the game, the success or failure of an attempted Bluff is determined by your skill level.  Within the dialogue, some lines will have a DC that your skill level must equal or exceed in order to be successful.  In the event that your skill level does beat the DC, a line of dialogue will appear with an icon, acknowledging your superior ability in that skill.  Selecting the line will draw you into an appropriate course of conversation for your actions. The key ability for Bluff is ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA].
TAG_CONCENTRATION:TAG_SKILL_DES:::2: You are particularly good at focusing your mind. As a spellcaster, you must make a Concentration check whenever you take damage while casting a spell, to determine whether or not the spell is disrupted.  A spellcaster may be vulnerable to damage while casting a spell or while readying an action through ~attacks of opportunity~[TAG_AOO].  The higher your skill level in Concentration, the more likely that you will be successful in casting a spell, even under duress. The key ability for Concentration is ~Constitution~[TAG_CONSTITUTION].
TAG_DIPLOMACY:TAG_SKILL_DES:::2: Diplomacy is a skill that can be used when speaking with NPCs. It encompasses etiquette, social grace, tact, and a way with words. This skill represents the ability to give others the right impression of yourself. Like other dialogue skills, your true success regarding Diplomacy in the game is dependent upon your skill level.  Within the dialogue, some lines will have a DC that your skill level must equal or exceed in order to be successful.  In the event that your skill level does beat the DC, a line of dialogue will appear with an icon, acknowledging your superior ability in that skill.  Selecting the line will draw you into an appropriate course of conversation for your actions. The key ability for Diplomacy is ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA].
TAG_DISABLE_DEVICE:TAG_SKILL_DES:::2: Use this skill to attempt to disarm a trap on a chest or door. The Disable Device skill check determines if your skill level is higher or lower than the DC of the trap that you are trying to disable.  If this skill check succeeds, the trap is deactivated.  A character must be aware of a trap in order to disable it. If the Disable Device skill check fails by 4 or more, the trap will be triggered.  Otherwise, the skill check may be used indefinitely. ~Rogues~[TAG_ROGUES] (and other characters with the trapfinding class feature) can disarm magical traps against a DC of 25 + the spell level of the magic used to create it. The key ability for Disable Device is ~Intelligence~[TAG_INTELLIGENCE], though it can only be used if one has been trained in it.
TAG_GATHER_INFORMATION:TAG_SKILL_DES:::2: Gather Information is the key ability used to garner rumors, find out local gossip, and collect general knowledge from others throughout the game. It can be used in conversations with NPCs to open up new avenues of dialogue. In ToEE, the quality of information and rumors that you obtain from others is directly related to your skill level in Gather Information.  The higher your skill level, the juicier the rumor or the more interesting and helpful the information will be.  Regardless of skill level, you will be asked to pay a standard fee for any information you accumulate. The game has several different story-states, and in each story there are different levels of success in gathering information.  If you return to a story in which you have previously had little success, after bumping up your skill level you might find the situation to be much improved.  There are many avenues of dialogue that Gather Information can open for your character. The key ability for Gather Information is ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA].
TAG_HEAL:TAG_SKILL_DES:::2: Use this skill to keep a badly wounded friend from dying. Heal can only be used on a ~dying~[TAG_DYING] creature.  If a character has negative ~hit points~[TAG_HIT_POINTS] and is losing hit points (at the rate of 1 per round, 1 per hour, or 1 per day), you can make him or her stable.  A character can be healed if the Heal check succeeds against a DC of 15.  A stable character is unable to regain hit points but will no longer lose any hit points. The key ability for Heal is ~Wisdom~[TAG_WISDOM].
TAG_HIDE:TAG_SKILL_DES:::2: Use this skill to sink back into the shadows and proceed unseen. A hostile character may not detect you if you have hidden well.  As a player, you can use Hide (and ~Move Silently~[TAG_MOVE_SILENTLY] as well) for being in "~sneak~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU_SNEAK]" mode.  A successful attempt at using Hide is opposed by the ~Spot~[TAG_SPOT] check of anyone who might be able to see you. The key ability for Hide is ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY].  Armor check penalties apply.
TAG_INTIMIDATE:TAG_SKILL_DES:::2: Intimidate is another skill that can be used to open up new avenues of dialog with NPCs, although they may not warm to you in the same manner. You may use this skill to get a bully to back down, to frighten an opponent, or to get information by forceful means. In the game, some lines of dialogue will have a DC that your skill level must equal or exceed in order to be successful.  In the event that your skill level does beat the DC, a line of dialogue will appear with an icon, acknowledging your superior ability in that skill.  Selecting the line will draw you into an appropriate course of conversation for your actions. The key ability for Intimidate is ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA].
TAG_LISTEN:TAG_SKILL_DES:::2: Use a Listen check to try to hear enemies approaching or to listen through a door to an adjacent room. It can alert you to the presence of enemies, taking away ~surprise rounds~[TAG_SURPRISE] (for example, the enemy could surprise you, but you make the Listen check and manage to avoid a surprise round) and possibly even give you a surprise round (in turn, you are able to surprise the enemy).  Listen is used as the opposing check for ~Move Silently~[TAG_MOVE_SILENTLY], enabling you to hear a person while they are in "~sneak~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU_SNEAK]" mode (which Move Silently is a part of). The key ability for Listen is ~Wisdom~[TAG_WISDOM].
TAG_MOVE_SILENTLY:TAG_SKILL_DES:::2: As with ~Hide~[TAG_HIDE], you use this skill to remain undetected by an enemy while moving. If you are unsuccessful at making your skill check against an opposing ~Listen~[TAG_LISTEN] check, you will be heard and the enemy will see you.  Move Silently is used as part of being in "~sneak~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU_SNEAK]" mode, and its skill bonuses apply only when sneaking. The key ability for Move Silently is ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY].  Armor check penalties apply.
TAG_OPEN_LOCK:TAG_SKILL_DES:::2: You can pick all kinds of locks with this skill. Your skills in using Open Lock are pitted against the DC of the lock (or the lock's difficulty).  If successful, the lock is picked (and will never again be locked).  This skill check can be used indefinitely. Its key ability is ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY], though it can only be used if one has been trained in it.
TAG_PERFORM:TAG_SKILL_DES:::2: Perform is used solely for the purpose of increasing one's ~bardic music~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_BARD_BARDIC_MUSIC] abilities. This skill is not recommended for use by any class other than the ~bard~[TAG_BARDS]. Its key ability is ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA].
TAG_SEARCH:TAG_SKILL_DES:::2: You can find secret doors and simple traps by searching. Search does not allow a character to find complex traps unless she is a ~rogue~[TAG_ROGUES].  Search lets characters discern some small details or irregularities through active effort, while ~Spot~[TAG_SPOT] lets the character notice something, such as a hiding rogue. A concentrated Search skill check is available via the ~radial menu~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU], using the Hammer & Anvil icon. This skill allows a player to search for traps.  This skill check will result in an automatic 20 ("take 20"), including help from any party members who can successfully complete a skill check of DC 10 (rolled automatically in the game).  Those party members who were successful in making the Search check would help through gaining a +2 bonus.  Only rogues can find magical traps (DC 20+). There is also a passive search conducted when "using" any container or portal that contains an unnoticed trap.  This passive search will stop the "use" if it successfully finds a trap.  If unsuccessful, the trap will go off. This skill check can be retried indefinitely. Its key ability is ~Intelligence~[TAG_INTELLIGENCE].
TAG_SENSE_MOTIVE:TAG_SKILL_DES:::2: Sense Motive is a dialogue skill that enables your character tell if an NPC is lying to your party. It is generally performed against the NPC's ~Bluff~[TAG_BLUFF] skill. Within the dialogue, some lines will have a DC that your Sense Motive skill level must equal or exceed in order to be successful.  In the event that your skill level does beat the DC, a line of dialogue will appear with an icon, acknowledging your superior ability in that skill.  For Sense Motive, if the line even appears at all, you automatically recognize that the NPC is lying.  If you choose to select that line and begin a dialogue exchange, this selection means that you call the NPC on his or her bluff attempt. Its key ability is ~Wisdom~[TAG_WISDOM].
TAG_SLEIGHT:TAG_SKILL_DES:::2: You can palm a tiny or small object. This skill is used for the basic purposes of pick pocketing.  When you use this skill under close observation, your skill check is opposed by the observer's ~Spot~[TAG_SPOT] check.  The observer's success doesn't prevent you from performing the action, just from doing it unnoticed. If you try to take something from another creature, you must make a DC 20 Sleight of Hand check to obtain it.  The opponent makes a Spot check to detect the attempt, opposed by the same Sleight of Hand check result you achieved when you tried to grab the item. Its key ability is ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY], though it can only be used if trained.  Armor check penalties also apply.
TAG_SPELLCRAFT:TAG_SKILL_DES:::2: This skill enables a spellcaster to recognize a spell cast by an enemy spellcaster. It is used by ~wizards~[TAG_WIZARDS] to copy a scroll into their ~spellbook~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_WIZARD_SPELLBOOK].  Spellcraft will also allow you to automatically ~counterspell~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU_READY_COUNTERSPELL] a specific spell that is known. Its key ability is ~Intelligence~[TAG_INTELLIGENCE], and it can only be used if trained.
TAG_SPOT:TAG_SKILL_DES:::2: Use this skill to spot unnoticed creatures. Spot is used solely as an opposing check against ~Hide~[TAG_HIDE] and is rolled automatically within the game to determine success or failure. Its key ability is ~Wisdom~[TAG_WISDOM].
TAG_SURVIVAL:TAG_SKILL_DES:::2: You are able to avoid ~random encounters~[TAG_HMU_RANDOM_ENCOUNTER_UI] while traveling on the ~World Map~[TAG_HMU_WORLDMAP_UI], if your Survival skill is high enough. You will have the choice of whether to avoid them or go ahead with them depending on what you detect with your skill.  For example, if the player's skill rank equals or exceeds the CR (challenge rating), they are shown an interface which presents the creatures involved in the random encounter.  The player is given the choice to enter the encounter or skip it entirely.  If the skill rank is less then the CR of the encounter, the player is not shown the interface and the encounter begins. Its key ability is ~Wisdom~[TAG_WISDOM].
TAG_TUMBLE:TAG_SKILL_DES:::2: You can use this skill to move through an enemy square or to move to avoid an ~attack of opportunity~[TAG_AOO]. The Tumble skill check will automatically be rolled when:  - movement draws an attack of opportunity  - the moving player has at least one point in Tumble  - the mover is not wearing medium or heavy armor If the Tumble check succeeds, no attack of opportunity is allowed. Its key ability is ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY] and it can only be used if trained.
TAG_UMD:TAG_SKILL_DES:::2: Use this skill to activate a magic device, including scrolls and wands, that you could not otherwise activate. A Use Magic Device check is automatically rolled when attempting to use such magic items, if the normal prerequisites for using the item are not met. Its key ability is ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA] and it can only be used if trained.
TAG_FEATS::::2: A feat is a special feature that either gives your character a new capability or improves one that he or she already has. Unlike skills, feats have no ranks. A character either has a feat or he does not.[CMD_CHILDREN]~Item Creation Feats~[TAG_ITEM_CREATION]~Metamagic Feats~[TAG_METAMAGIC]
TAG_ACQUIRE_FEATS:TAG_FEATS:::2: Each character gets one feat upon creation. At 3rd level and every three levels thereafter (6th, 9th, and such), he or she gains another feat. Additionally, ~fighters~[TAG_FIGHTERS] and ~wizards~[TAG_WIZARDS] get bonus class-related feats chosen from special lists. A ~human~[TAG_HUMANS] character also gets a bonus feat at 1st level, chosen by the player. Some feats have prerequisites as noted. A character cannot use a feat if he or she loses the prerequisite.
TAG_FEAT_TYPES:TAG_FEATS:::2: Some feats are general, meaning no special rules govern them as a group. Others fall into categories as below:1. Bonus feats: ~Fighters~[TAG_FIGHTERS] receive a ~bonus feat~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_FIGHTER_BONUS_FEATS] at every second level (2nd, 4th, 6th, 8th, 10th, 12th, 14th, 16th, 18th, and 20th). The feat they choose for this bonus feat, however, must come from the list of fighter bonus feats.    ~Wizards~[TAG_WIZARDS] receive a ~bonus feat~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_WIZARD_BONUS_FEATS] at every fifth level (5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th). The feat they choose for this bonus feat must come from the item creation or metamagic feats.2. Item Creation feats: Spellcasters can ~create items~[TAG_ITEM_CREATION] by spending their ~experience points~[TAG_EXPERIENCE_AND_LEVELS] (XP) to build ~magic items~[TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS]. In addition to the XP cost, there may also be a cost for material components.3. Metamagic feats: Wizards and divine casters can fill one of their slots with a ~metamagic~[TAG_METAMAGIC] spell, modified as per the feat they have and select. ~Sorcerers~[TAG_SORCERERS] and ~bards~[TAG_BARDS] can spontaneously cast a metamagic spell, if they have the appropriate feat, but this makes the casting a ~full-round action~[TAG_FULL_ROUND_ACTION].
TAG_ACROBATIC:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: You have excellent body awareness and coordination.     Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all ~Sleight of Hand~[TAG_SLEIGHT] and ~Tumble~[TAG_TUMBLE] checks.
TAG_ALERTNESS:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: You have finely tuned senses.     Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all ~Listen~[TAG_LISTEN] and ~Spot~[TAG_SPOT] checks.     Special: The master of a ~familiar~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_CALL_FAMILIAR] gains the benefit of the Alertness feat whenever the familiar is within arm's reach.
