TAG_ARMOR_PROF:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: You progress in your proficiency with ~light~[TAG_ARMOR_LIGHT], ~medium~[TAG_ARMOR_MEDIUM], and ~heavy~[TAG_ARMOR_HEAVY] armor, beginning first with the feat of light armor and then moving on to medium and heavy armor.For All Levels (Light, Medium, & Heavy)     Benefit: When you wear a type of armor with which you are proficient, the ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS] penalty for the armor applies only to ~Hide~[TAG_HIDE], ~Move Silently~[TAG_MOVE_SILENTLY], and ~Tumble~[TAG_TUMBLE] checks.     Normal: If you are wearing a type of armor with which you are not proficient, the AC penalty applies to ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] and to all ~skill checks~[TAG_USING_SKILLS] that involve moving.Armor Proficiency (Light)  You are proficient with light armor.     Special: All characters except ~wizards~[TAG_WIZARDS], ~sorcerers~[TAG_SORCERERS], and ~monks~[TAG_MONKS] automatically have Armor Proficiency (Light) as a bonus feat.  They need not select it.Armor Proficiency (Medium)  You are proficient with medium armor.     Prerequisite: Armor Proficiency (Light)     Special: ~Fighters~[TAG_FIGHTERS], ~barbarians~[TAG_BARBARIANS], ~paladins~[TAG_PALADINS], ~clerics~[TAG_CLERICS], and ~druids~[TAG_DRUIDS] automatically have Armor Proficiency (Medium) as a bonus feat.  They need not select it.Armor Proficiency (Heavy)  You are proficient with heavy armor.     Prerequisite: Armor Proficiency (Light) and Armor Proficiency (Medium)     Special: Fighters, paladins, and clerics automatically have Armor Proficiency (Heavy) as a bonus feat.  They need not select it.
TAG_AUGMENT_SUMMONING:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: Your summoned creatures are more powerful than normal.     Prerequisite: ~Spell Focus~[TAG_SPELL_FOCUS] ~(Conjuration)~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_CONJURATION]     Benefit: Each creature you conjure with any Summon spell gains a +4 ~enhancement~[TAG_ENHANCEMENT_BONUS] bonus to ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH] and ~Constitution~[TAG_CONSTITUTION] for the duration of the spell that summoned it.
TAG_BLIND_FIGHT:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLASS: You know how to fight in melee without being able to see your foes.     Benefit: In melee, if you miss because of ~concealment~[TAG_CONCEALMENT], you can reroll your miss chance percentile roll one time to see if you actually hit.     An ~invisible~[TAG_INVISIBLE] attacker gets no advantages related to hitting you in melee--you don't lose your ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY] bonus to ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS] and the attacker doesn't get the +2 bonus for being invisible.  However, the invisible attacker's bonuses do still apply for ~ranged attacks~[TAG_RANGED_ATTACKS].     You take only half the usual penalty to speed for being unable to see.  Darkness and poor visibility in general reduce your speed to three-quarters of what it would normally be, instead of one-half.     Normal: For invisible attackers trying to hit you, regular ~attack roll~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] modifiers apply, and you lose your Dexterity bonus to AC.  Speed reduction for darkness and poor visibility also applies.     Special: The Blind-Fight feat is of no use against a character who is the subject of a ~Blink~[TAG_SPELLS_BLINK] spell.     A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Blind-Fight as one of his bonus feats.
TAG_BREW_POTION:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_ITEM_: You can create potions which carry spells within them.     Prerequisite: ~Caster Level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] 3rd     Benefit: You can create a potion of a 3rd-level or lower spell that you know and that targets a creature.  Whoever drinks the potion is the target of the spell.     The base price of a potion is:                            its spell level  x  its caster level  x  50 gp     To brew a potion, you must spend 1/25 of this base price in ~XP~[TAG_EXPERIENCE_AND_LEVELS] and use up raw materials costing one half this base price.  Any potion that stores a spell with a costly material component or an XP cost also carries a commensurate cost.  In addition to the costs derived from the base price, you must expend the material component or pay the XP when creating the potion.Potion                                  @tSpell PrerequisitePoison                                @t~Poison~[TAG_SPELLS_POISON](Potions of)Aid                                      @t~Aid~[TAG_SPELLS_AID]Bull's Strength                   @t~Bull's Strength~[TAG_SPELLS_BULL'S_STRENGTH]Cure Light Wounds         @t~Cure Light Wounds~[TAG_SPELLS_CURE_LIGHT_WOUNDS]Cure Moderate Wounds  @t~Cure Moderate Wounds~[TAG_SPELLS_CURE_MODERATE_WOUNDS]Cure Serious Wounds     @t~Cure Serious Wounds~[TAG_SPELLS_CURE_SERIOUS_WOUNDS]Eagle's Splendor              @t~Eagle's Splendor~[TAG_SPELLS_EAGLE'S_SPLENDOR]Enlarge Person                  @t~Enlarge Person~[TAG_SPELLS_ENLARGE_PERSON]Glibness                             @t~Glibness~[TAG_SPELLS_GLIBNESS]Haste                                    @t~Haste~[TAG_SPELLS_HASTE]Heroism                              @t~Heroism~[TAG_SPELLS_HEROISM]Invisibility                          @t~Invisibility~[TAG_SPELLS_INVISIBILITY]Neutralize Poison             @t~Neutralize Poison~[TAG_SPELLS_NEUTRALIZE_POISON]Reduce Person                   @t~Reduce Person~[TAG_SPELLS_REDUCE_PERSON]
TAG_CLEAVE:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLASS_FEAT: You can follow through with powerful blows.     Prerequisite: ~Str~[TAG_STRENGTH] 13, ~Power Attack~[TAG_POWER_ATTACK]     Benefit: If you cause enough damage to a creature to make it drop below 0 ~hit points~[TAG_HIT_POINTS] or kill it, you get an immediate, extra ~melee attack~[TAG_MELEE_ATTACKS] against another creature within reach.  You cannot take a ~5-foot step~[TAG_5_FOOT_STEP] before making this extra attack.  The extra attack is with the same weapon and at the same bonus as the attack that dropped the previous creature.  You can use this ability once per round.     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Cleave as one of his fighter bonus feats.
TAG_COMBAT_CASTING:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: You are adept at casting spells in combat.     Benefit: You get a +4 bonus on ~Concentration~[TAG_CONCENTRATION] checks made to cast a spell or use a spell-like ability while on the ~defensive~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU_CAST_DEFENSIVELY] or while you are ~grappled~[TAG_GRAPPLING] or pinned.
TAG_COMBAT_EXPERTISE:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_: You are trained at using your combat skill for defense as well as offense.     Prerequisite: ~Int~[TAG_INTELLIGENCE] 13     Benefit: When you use the attack action or the ~full attack~[TAG_FULL_ATTACK] action in melee, you can take a penalty of as much as -5 on your ~attack roll~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] and add the same number (+5 or less) as a dodge bonus to your ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS].  This number may not exceed your ~base attack bonus~[TAG_LEVEL_BONUSES].  The changes to attack rolls and AC last until your next action.     Normal: A character without the Combat Expertise feat can ~fight defensively~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU_FIGHT_DEFENSIVELY] while using the attack or full attack action to take a -4 penalty on attack rolls and gain a +2 dodge bonus to AC.     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Combat Expertise as one of his fighter bonus feats.
TAG_COMBAT_REFLEXES:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_C: You can respond quickly and repeatedly to opponents who let their defenses down.     Benefit: When foes leave themselves open, you may make a number of additional ~attacks of opportunity~[TAG_AOO] equal to your ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY] bonus.  For example, a ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] with a Dex of 15 can make a total of three attacks of opportunity in 1 round--the one attack of opportunity any character is entitled to, plus two more because of the fighter's +2 Dex bonus.  Likewise, if 4 goblins move out of the fighter's threatened squares, he can make an attack of opportunity against three of them.  You can still only make one attack of opportunity per actual opportunity.     With this feat, you may also make attacks of opportunity while ~flat-footed~[TAG_FLAT_FOOTED].     Normal: A character without this feat can make only one attack of opportunity per round and can't make attacks of opportunity while flat-footed.     Special: The Combat Reflexes feat does not allow a ~rogue~[TAG_ROGUES] to use her ~Opportunist~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_OPPORTUNIST] ability more than once per round.     A ~monk~[TAG_MONKS] may select Combat Reflexes as a bonus feat at 2nd level.     A fighter may select Combat Reflexes as one of her fighter bonus feats.
TAG_CRAFT_MAA:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_ITEM_CR: You can create magic weapons, armor, and shields.     Prerequisite: ~Caster Level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] 5th     Benefit: You can create any magic weapon, armor, or shield whose prerequisites you meet, such as caster level (CL).  To enhance one of these items, you must spend 1/25 of its feature's total price in ~XP~[TAG_EXPERIENCE_AND_LEVELS] and use up raw materials costing one-half of this total price.     The weapon, armor, or shield to be enhanced must be a ~masterwork~[TAG_MASTERWORK] item that you provide.  Its cost is not included in the above cost.Weapon Enhancement+1+2+3Weapon Special Ability~Defending~[TAG_DEFENDING]~Flaming~[TAG_FLAMING]~Frost~[TAG_FROST]~Shock~[TAG_SHOCK]~Keen~[TAG_KEEN]~Mighty Cleaving~[TAG_MIGHTY_CLEAVING]~Flaming Burst~[TAG_FLAMING_BURST]~Icy Burst~[TAG_ICY_BURST]~Shocking Burst~[TAG_SHOCKING_BURST]~Holy~[TAG_HOLY]~Unholy~[TAG_UNHOLY]~Axiomatic~[TAG_AXIOMATIC]~Anarchic~[TAG_ANARCHIC]Armor Enhancement+1+2+3Armor Special Ability~Silent Moves~[TAG_SILENT_MOVES]~Spell Resistance (13)~[TAG_MAGIC_ARMOR_SPELL_RESISTANCE]
TAG_CRAFT_ROD:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_ITEM_CR: You can create magic rods, which have varied magical effects.     Prerequisite: ~Caster Level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] 9th     Benefits: You can create any rod whose prerequisites you meet, such as caster level (CL).  To craft a rod, you must spend 1/25 of its base price in ~XP~[TAG_EXPERIENCE_AND_LEVELS] and use up raw materials costing one-half of its base price.     Some rods incur extra costs in material components or XP, as noted in their descriptions.  These costs are in addition to those derived from the rod's base price.Rods~Black Rod~[TAG_WEAPONS_BLACK_ROD]~Black Rod, Minor~[TAG_WEAPONS_BLACK_ROD_MINOR]~Grey Rod~[TAG_WEAPONS_GREY_ROD]~Grey Rod, Minor~[TAG_WEAPONS_GREY_ROD_MINOR]~Mace of Smiting~[TAG_WEAPONS_MACE_OF_SMITING]~Rod of Alertness~[TAG_WEAPONS_ROD_OF_ALERTNESS]~Rod of Negation~[TAG_WEAPONS_ROD_OF_NEGATION]~Rod of the Python~[TAG_WEAPONS_ROD_OF_THE_PYTHON]~Rod of the Viper~[TAG_WEAPONS_ROD_OF_THE_VIPER]~Rod of Thunder and Lightning~[TAG_WEAPONS_ROD_OF_THUNDER_AND_LIGHTNING]~White Rod~[TAG_WEAPONS_WHITE_ROD]~White Rod, Minor~[TAG_WEAPONS_WHITE_ROD_MINOR]
TAG_CRAFT_STAFF:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_ITEM_: You can create magical staffs.     Prerequisite: ~Caster Level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] 12th     Benefit: You can create any staff whose prerequisites you meet, such as caster level (CL).  To craft a staff, you must spend 1/25 of its base price in ~XP~[TAG_EXPERIENCE_AND_LEVELS] and use up raw materials costing one-half of its base price.  A newly created staff has 50 charges.     Some staffs incur extra costs in material components or XP, as noted in their descriptions.  These costs are in addition to those derived from the staff's base price.Staffs~Staff of Elemental Control, Air~[TAG_WEAPONS_STAFF_OF_ELEMENTAL_CONTROL_AIR]~Staff of Elemental Control, Earth~[TAG_WEAPONS_STAFF_OF_ELEMENTAL_CONTROL_EARTH]~Staff of Elemental Control, Fire~[TAG_WEAPONS_STAFF_OF_ELEMENTAL_CONTROL_FIRE]~Staff of Elemental Control, Water~[TAG_WEAPONS_STAFF_OF_ELEMENTAL_CONTROL_WATER]~Staff of Charming~[TAG_WEAPONS_STAFF_OF_CHARMING]~Staff of Defense~[TAG_WEAPONS_STAFF_OF_DEFENSE]~Staff of Fire~[TAG_WEAPONS_STAFF_OF_FIRE]~Staff of Frost~[TAG_WEAPONS_STAFF_OF_FROST]~Staff of Healing~[TAG_WEAPONS_STAFF_OF_HEALING]~Staff of Life~[TAG_WEAPONS_STAFF_OF_LIFE]~Staff of Size Alteration~[TAG_WEAPONS_STAFF_OF_SIZE_ALTERATION]~Staff of Striking~[TAG_WEAPONS_STAFF_OF_STRIKING]~Staff of the Transmuter~[TAG_WEAPONS_STAFF_OF_THE_TRANSMUTER]~Staff of the Woodlands~[TAG_WEAPONS_STAFF_OF_THE_WOODLANDS]
TAG_CRAFT_WAND:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_ITEM_C: You can create wands, which hold spells.     Prerequisite: ~Caster Level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] 5th     Benefit: You can create a wand of any 4th-level or lower spell that you know.  You may also create a few special wands of higher level spells.     The base price of a wand is:                         its caster level  x  the spell level  x  750 gp     To craft a wand, you must spend 1/25 of this base price in ~XP~[TAG_EXPERIENCE_AND_LEVELS] and use up raw materials costing one-half of this base price.  A newly created wand has 20 charges.     Any wand that stores a spell with a costly material component or an XP cost also carries a commensurate cost.  In addition to the cost derived from the base price, you must expend fifty copies of the material component or pay fifty times the XP cost.
TAG_CRAFT_WONDROUS:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_IT: You can create a wide variety of magic items, such as Gauntlets of Dexterity or Dust of Disappearance.     Prerequisite: ~Caster Level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] 3rd     Benefit: You can create any wondrous item whose prerequisites you meet, such as caster level (CL).  To enchant a wondrous item, you must spend 1/25 of the item's price in ~XP~[TAG_EXPERIENCE_AND_LEVELS] and use up raw materials costing half of this price.     Some wondrous items incur extra costs in the material components or XP, as noted in their descriptions.  These costs are in addition to those derived from the item's base price.  You must pay such a cost to create an item.Wondrous Items~Amulet of Health~[TAG_AMULET_OF_HEALTH][CMD_CHILDREN_SORTED]
TAG_DEFLECT_ARROWS:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CL: You can deflect incoming ~arrows~[TAG_WEAPONS_ARROWS], as well as ~bolts~[TAG_WEAPONS_BOLTS], ~spears~[TAG_WEAPONS_SPEAR], and other projectile or ~thrown weapons~[TAG_THROW_WEAPON].     Prerequisite: ~Dex~[TAG_DEXTERITY] 13, ~Improved Unarmed Strike~[TAG_IMPROVED_UNARMED]     Benefit: You must have at least one hand free (holding nothing) to use this feat.  Once per round when you would normally be hit with a ranged weapon, you deflect the weapon so that you take no damage.  You must be aware of the attack and not ~flat-footed~[TAG_FLAT_FOOTED].  Unusual missiles, such as boulders hurled by giants and ~ranged attacks~[TAG_RANGED_ATTACKS] generated by spell effects, such as ~Melf's Acid Arrow~[TAG_SPELLS_MELF'S_ACID_ARROW], can't be deflected.     Special: A ~monk~[TAG_MONKS] may select Deflect Arrows as a bonus feat at 2nd level, even if she does not meet the prerequisites.     A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Deflect Arrows as one of his fighter bonus feats.
TAG_DIEHARD:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: You can remain conscious after attacks that would fell others.     Prerequisite: ~Great Fortitude~[TAG_GREAT_FORT]     Benefit: When reduced to between -1 and -9 ~hit points~[TAG_HIT_POINTS], you automatically stabilize.     When reduced to negative hit points, you may choose to act as if you were ~disabled~[TAG_DISABLED], rather than ~dying~[TAG_DYING].  You must make this decision as soon as you are reduced to negative hit points (even if it isn't your turn). If you do not choose to act as if you were disabled, you immediately fall ~unconscious~[TAG_UNCONSCIOUS].     When using this feat, you can take either a single ~move~[TAG_MOVEMENT_ACTION] or ~standard~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION] action each turn, but not both, and you cannot take a ~full-round action~[TAG_FULL_ROUND_ACTION]. You can take a move action without further injuring yourself, but if you perform any standard action, you take 1 point of damage after completing the act.  If you reach -10 hit points, you immediately die.     Normal: A character without this feat who is reduced to between -1 and -9 hit points is unconscious and dying.
TAG_DODGE:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLASS_FEATU: You are adept at dodging blows.     Prerequisite: ~Dex~[TAG_DEXTERITY] 13     Benefit: During your action, Dodge will give you a +1 dodge bonus to ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS] against the first monster that attacks you in a round.  A condition that makes you lose your Dexterity bonus to AC (if any) also makes you lose this Dodge bonus.     Also, dodge bonuses (such as this one, or a ~dwarf's~[TAG_DWARVES] racial bonus on dodge attempts against giants) stack with each other, unlike most other bonuses.     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Dodge as one of her fighter bonus feats.
TAG_EMPOWER_SPELL:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_MET: You can cast spells to greater effect.     Benefit: All variable, numeric effects of an empowered spell are increased by one-half.  An empowered spell deals half again as much damage as normal, cures half again as many hit points, affects half again as many targets, and so forth, as appropriate.  For example, an empowered ~Magic Missile~[TAG_SPELLS_MAGIC_MISSILE] deals 1 1/2 times its normal damage (roll 1d4+1 and multiply the result by 1 1/2 for each missile).  ~Saving throws~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] and opposed rolls (such as the one you make when you cast ~Dispel Magic~[TAG_SPELLS_DISPEL_MAGIC]) are not affected, nor are spells without random variables.  An empowered spell uses up a spell slot two levels higher than the spell's actual level.
TAG_ENLARGE_SPELL:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_MET: You can cast spells farther than normal.     Benefit: You can alter a spell with a range of close, medium, or long to double the range of the spell.  Spells whose ranges are not defined by distance, as well as spells whose ranges are not close, medium, or long, do not have increased ranges.  An enlarged spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.
TAG_EXOTIC_PROF:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLASS: Choose a type of exotic weapon, such as the ~bastard sword~[TAG_WEAPONS_SWORD_BASTARD] or ~shuriken~[TAG_WEAPONS_SHURIKEN].  You understand how to use that type of exotic weapon in combat.  Examples of an ~exotic weapon~[TAG_EXOTIC_WEAPONS].     Prerequisite: ~Base attack bonus~[TAG_LEVEL_BONUSES] +1 (plus ~Str~[TAG_STRENGTH] 13 for Bastard Sword or ~Dwarven Waraxe~[TAG_WEAPONS_WARAXE_DWARVEN])     Benefit: You make ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] with the weapon normally.     If the feat is selected for the Bastard Sword or Dwarven Waraxe, the weapon is wielded as a one-handed weapon.     Normal: A character who uses a weapon with which he or she is not proficient takes a -4 penalty on attack rolls.     The Bastard Sword and Dwarven Waraxe are wielded as two-handed weapons.     Special: You can gain Exotic Weapon Proficiency multiple times.  Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of exotic weapon.     A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Exotic Weapon Proficiency as one of his fighter bonus feats.
TAG_EXTEND_SPELL:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_META: You can cast spells that last longer than normal.     Benefit: An extended spell lasts twice as long as normal.  A spell with a duration of concentration, an instantaneous spell, or a permanent spell is not affected by this feat.  An extended spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.
TAG_EXTRA_TURNING:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: You can ~turn or rebuke~[TAG_TURN] creatures more often than normal.     Prerequisite: Ability to turn or rebuke creatures     Benefit: Each time you take this feat, you can use your ability to turn or rebuke creatures four more times per day than normal.     If you have the ability to turn or rebuke more than one kind of creature (such as a good-aligned ~cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] with access to the ~Fire domain~[TAG_FIRE_D], who can turn undead and water creatures and can also rebuke fire creatures), each of your turning or rebuking abilities gain four additional uses per day.     Normal: Without this feat, a character can typically turn or rebuke undead (or other creatures) a number of times per day equal to 3 + his or her ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA] modifier.     Special: You can gain Extra Turning multiple times.  Its effects stack.  Each time you take the feat, you can use each of your turning or rebuking abilities four additional times per day.
TAG_FAR_SHOT:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLASS_FE: Your ranged weapons have an extended range.     Prerequisite: ~Point Blank Shot~[TAG_POINT_BLANK]     Benefit: When you use a projectile weapon, such as a bow, its range increment increases by one-half (multiply by 1 1/2).  When you use a ~thrown weapon~[TAG_THROW_WEAPON], its range increment is doubled.     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Far Shot as one of his fighter bonus feats.
TAG_FORGE_RING:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_ITEM_C: You can create magical rings.     Prerequisite: ~Caster Level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] 12th     Benefit: You can create any ring whose prerequisites you meet, such as caster level (CL).  To craft a ring, you must spend 1/25 of its base price in ~XP~[TAG_EXPERIENCE_AND_LEVELS] and use up raw materials costing one-half of its base price.     Some magic rings incur extra costs in material components or XP, as noted in their descriptions.  You must pay such a cost to forge such a ring.Rings~Ring of Acid Resistance, Major~[TAG_RING_OF_ACID_RESISTANCE_MAJOR]~Ring of Acid Resistance, Minor~[TAG_RING_OF_ACID_RESISTANCE_MINOR]~Ring of Animal Summoning, Dog~[TAG_RING_OF_ANIMAL_SUMMONING_DOG]~Ring of Blinking~[TAG_RING_OF_BLINKING]~Ring of Chameleon Power~[TAG_RING_OF_CHAMELEON_POWER]~Ring of Cold Resistance, Major~[TAG_RING_OF_COLD_RESISTANCE_MAJOR]~Ring of Cold Resistance, Minor~[TAG_RING_OF_COLD_RESISTANCE_MINOR]~Ring of Electricity Resistance, Major~[TAG_RING_OF_ELECTRICITY_RESISTANCE_MAJOR]~Ring of Electricity Resistance, Minor~[TAG_RING_OF_ELECTRICITY_RESISTANCE_MINOR]~Ring of Fire Resistance, Major~[TAG_RING_OF_FIRE_RESISTANCE_MAJOR]~Ring of Fire Resistance, Minor~[TAG_RING_OF_FIRE_RESISTANCE_MINOR]~Ring of Freedom of Movement~[TAG_RING_OF_FREEDOM_OF_MOVEMENT]~Ring of Invisibility~[TAG_RING_OF_INVISIBILITY]~Ring of Protection +1~[TAG_RING_OF_PROTECTION_+1]~Ring of Protection +2~[TAG_RING_OF_PROTECTION_+2]~Ring of Protection +3~[TAG_RING_OF_PROTECTION_+3]~Ring of Protection +4~[TAG_RING_OF_PROTECTION_+4]~Ring of Protection +5~[TAG_RING_OF_PROTECTION_+5]~Ring of Sonic Resistance, Major~[TAG_RING_OF_SONIC_RESISTANCE_MAJOR]~Ring of Sonic Resistance, Minor~[TAG_RING_OF_SONIC_RESISTANCE_MINOR]~Ring of Warmth~[TAG_RING_OF_WARMTH]
TAG_GREAT_CLEAVE:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLAS: You can wield a melee weapon with such power that you can strike multiple times when you fell your foes.     Prerequisites: ~Str~[TAG_STRENGTH] 13, ~Cleave~[TAG_CLEAVE], ~Power Attack~[TAG_POWER_ATTACK], ~base attack bonus~[TAG_LEVEL_BONUSES] +4     Benefit: This feat works like Cleave, except that there is no limit to the number of times that you can use it per round.     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Great Cleave as one of her fighter bonus feats.
TAG_GREAT_FORT:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: You have tougher ~fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] than normal.     Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Fortitude ~saving throws~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC].
TAG_GREATER_SPELL_FOCUS:TAG_FEATS_DES:::: Choose a ~school~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS] of magic to which you have already applied the ~Spell Focus~[TAG_SPELL_FOCUS] feat.  Your spells of that schools are now even more potent than before.     Benefit: Add +1 to the Difficulty Class for all ~saving throws~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] against spells from the school of magic you select. This bonus stacks with the bonus from Spell Focus.     Special: You can gain this feat multiple times.  Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new school of magic to which you already have applied the Spell Focus feat.
TAG_GREATER_SPELL_PENETRATION:TAG_FEATS_: Your spells are remarkably potent, breaking through ~spell resistance~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_SPELL_RESISTANCE] more readily than normal.     Prerequisite: ~Spell Penetration~[TAG_SPELL_PENETRATION]     Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] checks made to overcome a creature's spell resistance.  This bonus stacks with the one from Spell Penetration.
TAG_GREATER_WEAPON_FOCUS:TAG_FEATS_DES::: Choose one type of weapon, such as ~greataxe~[TAG_WEAPONS_GREATAXE], for which you have already selected ~Weapon Focus~[TAG_WEAPON_FOCUS]. You can also choose ~unarmed strike~[TAG_WEAPONS_STRIKE_UNARMED] or ray (if you are also a spellcaster) as your weapon for the purpose of this feat. You are especially good at using this weapon.     Prerequisites: Proficiency with selected weapon, Weapon Focus with selected weapon, ~Fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] level 8th     Benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on all ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] you make using the selected weapon. This bonus stacks with other bonuses on attack rolls, including the one from Weapon Focus.     Special: You can gain Greater Weapon Focus multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.     A fighter may select Greater Weapon Focus as one of his fighter bonus feats.
TAG_HEIGHTEN_SPELL:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_ME: You can cast a spell as if it were a higher-level spell than it actually is.     Benefit: A heightened spell has a higher spell level than normal.  Unlike other metamagic feats, Heighten Spell actually increases the effective level of the spell that it modifies.  All effects dependent on spell level (such as ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] DCs and ability to penetrate a ~Lesser Globe of Invulnerability~[TAG_SPELLS_GLOBE_OF_INVULNERABILITY_LESSER]) are calculated according to the heightened level.  The heightened spell is as difficult to prepare and cast as a spell of its effective level.  For example, a ~cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] could prepare ~Hold Person~[TAG_SPELLS_HOLD_PERSON] as a 4th-level spell (instead of a 2nd-level spell), and it would in all ways be treated as 4th-level spell.
TAG_IMPROVED_COUNTERSPELL:TAG_FEATS_DES:: You understand the nuances of magic to such an extent that you can counter your opponent's spells with great efficiency.     Benefit: When ~counterspelling~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU_READY_COUNTERSPELL], you may use a spell of the same school that is one or more spell levels higher than the target spell.     Normal: Without this feat, you may counter a spell only with the same spell or with a spell specifically designated as countering the target spell.
TAG_IMPROVED_CRITICAL:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG: Choose one type of weapon, such as a ~longsword~[TAG_WEAPONS_LONGSWORD] or ~greataxe~[TAG_WEAPONS_GREATAXE].  With that chosen weapon, you know how to hit where it hurts.     Prerequisite: Proficiency with selected weapon, ~base attack bonus~[TAG_LEVEL_BONUSES] +8.     Benefit: When using the weapon you selected, your threat range is doubled.  For example, a longsword usually threatens a ~critical hit~[TAG_CRITICAL_HIT] on a roll of 19-20 (two numbers).  If a character using a longsword has Improved Critical (Longsword), the threat range becomes 17-20 (four numbers).     Special: You can gain Improved Critical multiple times.  The effects do not stack.  Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.     This effect doesn't stack with any other effect that expands the threat range of a weapon (such as the ~Keen Edge~[TAG_SPELLS_KEEN_EDGE] spell).     A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Improved Critical as one of her fighter bonus feats.
TAG_IMPROVED_FEINT:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CL: You are skilled at misdirecting your opponent's attention in combat.     Prerequisite: ~Int~[TAG_INTELLIGENCE] 13, ~Combat Expertise~[TAG_COMBAT_EXPERTISE]     Benefit: You can make a ~Bluff~[TAG_BLUFF] check to ~feint~[TAG_FEINT] in combat as a ~move action~[TAG_MOVEMENT_ACTION].     Normal: Feinting in combat is a ~full-round action~[TAG_FULL_ROUND_ACTION].     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Improved Feint as one of her fighter bonus feats.
TAG_IMPROVED_INIT:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLA: You can react more quickly than normal in a fight.     Benefit: You get a +4 bonus on ~initiative~[TAG_INITIATIVE] checks.     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Improved Initiative as one of his fighter bonus feats.
TAG_IMPROVED_TRIP:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLA: You are trained not only in ~tripping~[TAG_TRIP] opponents safely but also in following through with an attack.     Prerequisites: ~Int~[TAG_INTELLIGENCE] 13, ~Combat Expertise~[TAG_COMBAT_EXPERTISE]     Benefit: You do not provoke an ~attack of opportunity~[TAG_AOO] when you attempt to trip an opponent.  You also gain a +4 bonus on your ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH] check to trip your opponent.     If you trip an opponent in melee combat, you immediately get a ~melee attack~[TAG_MELEE_ATTACKS] against that opponent as if you hadn't used your attack for the trip attempt.     Normal: Without this feat, you provoke an attack of opportunity when you attempt to trip an opponent.     Special: At 6th level, a ~monk~[TAG_MONKS] gains Improved Trip as a bonus feat, even if she does not have the prerequisites.     A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Improved Trip as one of his fighter bonus feats.
TAG_IMPROVED_TURNING:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: Your ~turning or rebuking~[TAG_TURN] attempts are more powerful than normal.     Prerequisite: Ability to turn or rebuke creatures     Benefit: You turn or rebuke creatures as if you were one level higher than you are in the class that grants you the ability.
TAG_IMPROVED_TWO_WEAPON_FIGHTING:TAG_FEA: You are an expert in fighting two-handed.  Prerequisites: ~Dex~[TAG_DEXTERITY] 17, ~Two-Weapon Fighting~[TAG_TWO_FIGHTING], ~base attack bonus~[TAG_LEVEL_BONUSES] +6  Benefit: In addition to the standard single extra attack you get with an off-hand weapon, you get a second attack with it, albeit at a -5 penalty.     Normal: Without this feat, you can only get a single extra attack with an off-hand weapon.     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may selected Improved Two-Weapon Fighting as one of her fighter bonus feats.     A 6th-level ~ranger~[TAG_RANGERS] who has chosen the ~Two-Weapon Combat Style~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_RANGER_IMPROVED_COMBAT_STYLE] is treated as having Improved Two-Weapon Fighting, even if he does not have the prerequisites for it, but only when he is wearing light or no armor.
TAG_IMPROVED_UNARMED:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_: You are skilled at fighting while unarmed.     Benefit: You are considered to be armed even when unarmed--that is, you do not provoke ~attacks of opportunity~[TAG_AOO] from armed opponents when attacking them while unarmed.  However, you still get an attack of opportunity against any opponent who makes an unarmed attack on you.     Normal: Without this feat, you are considered unarmed when attacking with an unarmed strike, and you can deal only ~nonlethal damage~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU_NONLETHAL_DAMAGE] with such an attack.     Special: A ~monk~[TAG_MONKS] automatically gains Improved Unarmed Strike as a bonus feat at 1st level.  She need not select it.     A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Improved Unarmed Strike as one of her fighter bonus feats.
TAG_INVESTIGATOR:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: You have a knack for finding information.     Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all ~Gather Information~[TAG_GATHER_INFORMATION] and ~Search~[TAG_SEARCH] checks.
TAG_IRON_WILL:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: You have a stronger ~will~[TAG_WILL] than normal.     Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Will ~saving throws~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC].
TAG_LIGHTNING_REFLEXES:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: You have faster than normal ~reflexes~[TAG_REFLEX].     Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all Reflex ~saving throws~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC].
TAG_MAGICAL_AFFINITY:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: You have a knack for magical endeavors.     Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all ~Spellcraft~[TAG_SPELLCRAFT] and ~Use Magic Device~[TAG_UMD] checks.
TAG_MANYSHOT:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLASS_FE: You can fire multiple ~arrows~[TAG_WEAPONS_ARROWS] as a single attack against a nearby target.     Prerequisites: ~Dex~[TAG_DEXTERITY] 17, ~Point Blank Shot~[TAG_POINT_BLANK], ~Rapid Shot~[TAG_RAPID_SHOT], ~base attack bonus~[TAG_LEVEL_BONUSES] +6     Benefit: When making a ~standard attack~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION] with a bow against an opponent within 30 feet, you fire two arrows at once. Both arrows use the same ~attack roll~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] (with a -4 penalty) to determine success and deal damage normally.     Precision-based damage (such as ~sneak attack~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_ROGUE_SNEAK_ATTACK] damage) is applied only once. If you score a ~critical hit~[TAG_CRITICAL_HIT], only the first arrow fired deals critical damage; all others deal regular damage.     ~Damage reduction~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_DAMAGE_REDUCTION] and other resistances apply separately against each arrow fired.     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Manyshot as one of his fighter bonus feats.     A 6th-level ~ranger~[TAG_RANGERS] who has chosen the ~Archery Combat Style~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_RANGER_IMPROVED_COMBAT_STYLE] is treated as having Manyshot, even if he does not have the prerequisites for it, but only when he is wearing light or no armor.
TAG_MARTIAL_PROF:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: Choose a type of martial weapon, such as a ~longbow~[TAG_WEAPONS_LONGBOW].  You understand how to use that type of martial weapon in combat.     Use this feat to expand the list of weapons with which you are proficient beyond the basic list in your class description.  Examples of a ~martial weapon~[TAG_MARTIAL_WEAPONS].     Benefit: You make ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] with the selected weapon normally.     Normal: When using a weapon with which you are not proficient, you take a -4 penalty on attack rolls.     Special: You can gain Martial Weapon Proficiency multiple times.  Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.     ~Barbarians~[TAG_BARBARIANS], ~fighters~[TAG_FIGHTERS], ~paladins~[TAG_PALADINS], and ~rangers~[TAG_RANGERS] are proficient with all martial weapons.  They need not select this feat.     A ~cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] who chooses the ~War domain~[TAG_WAR_D] automatically gains the Martial Weapon Proficiency feat related to his ~deity's~[TAG_RELIGION] favored weapon as a bonus feat, if the weapon is a martial one.  He need not select it.
TAG_MAX_SPELL:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_METAMAG: You can cast spells to maximum effect.     Benefit: All variable, numeric effects of a spell modified by this feat are maximized.  A maximized spell deals maximum damage, cures the maximum number of ~hit points~[TAG_HIT_POINTS], affects the maximum number of targets, etc., as appropriate.  For example, a maximized ~Fireball~[TAG_SPELLS_FIREBALL] deals 6 points of damage per ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (up to a maximum of 60 points of damage at 10th caster level).  ~Saving throws~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] and opposed rolls (such as the one you make when you cast ~Dispel Magic~[TAG_SPELLS_DISPEL_MAGIC]) are not affected, nor are spells without random variables.  A maximized spell uses up a spell slot three levels higher than the spell's actual level.     Special: An ~empowered~[TAG_EMPOWER_SPELL], maximized spell gains the separate benefits of each feat: the maximum result plus one-half the normally rolled result     An empowered, maximized Fireball cast by a 10th-level ~wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] deals points of damage equal to 60 plus one-half of 10d6.
TAG_MOBILITY:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLASS_FE: You are skilled at dodging past opponents and avoiding blows.     Prerequisites: ~Dex~[TAG_DEXTERITY] 13, ~Dodge~[TAG_DODGE]     Benefit: You get a +4 dodge bonus to ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS] against ~attacks of opportunity~[TAG_AOO] caused when you move out of or within a threatened area.  A condition that makes you lose your Dexterity bonus to AC (if any) also makes you lose dodge bonuses.  Dodge bonuses (such as this one and a ~dwarf's~[TAG_DWARVES] racial bonus on dodge attempts against giants) stack with each other, unlike most types of bonuses.     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Mobility as one of his fighter bonus feats.
TAG_NATURAL_SPELL:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: You can cast spells while in a ~wild shape~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_DRUID_WILD_SHAPE].     Prerequisites: ~Wis~[TAG_WISDOM] 13, Wild Shape ability     Benefit: You can complete the verbal and somatic components of spells while in a wild shape. For example, while in the form of a hawk, you could substitute screeches and gestures with your talons for the normal verbal and somatic components of a spell. You can also use any material components or focuses you possess, even if such items are melded within your current form. This feat does not permit the use of ~magic items~[TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS] while you are in a form that could not ordinarily use them, and you do not gain the ability to speak while in a wild shape.
TAG_NEGOTIATOR:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: You are good at gauging and swaying attitudes.     Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all ~Diplomacy~[TAG_DIPLOMACY] and ~Sense Motive~[TAG_SENSE_MOTIVE] checks.
TAG_NIMBLE_FINGERS:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: You are adept at manipulating small, delicate objects.     Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all ~Disable Device~[TAG_DISABLE_DEVICE] and ~Open Lock~[TAG_OPEN_LOCK] checks.
TAG_PERSUASIVE:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: You have a way with words and body language.     Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all ~Bluff~[TAG_BLUFF] and ~Intimidate~[TAG_INTIMIDATE] checks.
TAG_POINT_BLANK:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLASS: You are skilled at making well-placed shots with ranged weapons at close range.     Benefit: You get a +1 bonus on ~attack~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] and damage rolls with ranged weapons at ranges of up to 30 feet.     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Point Blank Shot as one of his fighter bonus feats.
TAG_POWER_ATTACK:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLAS: You can make exceptionally powerful ~melee attacks~[TAG_MELEE_ATTACKS].     Prerequisite: ~Str~[TAG_STRENGTH] 13     Benefit: On your action, before making ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] for a round, you may choose to subtract a number from all melee attack rolls and add the same number to all melee damage rolls.  (If you attack with a two-handed weapon that isn't a double weapon, add twice this number instead.)  This number may not exceed your ~base attack bonus~[TAG_LEVEL_BONUSES].  The penalty on attacks and bonus on damage apply until your next turn.     You can't use Power Attack with a light weapon.     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Power Attack as one of her fighter bonus feats.
TAG_PRECISE_SHOT:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLAS: You are skilled at timing and aiming ~ranged attacks~[TAG_RANGED_ATTACKS].     Prerequisite: ~Point Blank Shot~[TAG_POINT_BLANK]     Benefit: You can shoot or throw ranged weapons at an opponent engaged in melee without taking the standard -4 penalty on your ~attack roll~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL].     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Precise Shot as one of his fighter bonus feats.
TAG_QUICK_DRAW:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLASS_: You can draw weapons with startling speed.     Prerequisite: ~Base attack bonus~[TAG_LEVEL_BONUSES] +1     Benefit: You can draw a weapon as a ~free action~[TAG_FREE_ACTION] instead of as a ~move action~[TAG_MOVEMENT_ACTION].  You can draw a hidden weapon as a move action.     A character who has selected this feat may throw weapons at her full normal rate of attacks (much like a character with a bow).     Normal: Without this feat, you may draw a weapon as a move action, or (if your base attack bonus is +1 or higher) as a free action as part of movement.  Without this feat, you can draw a hidden weapon as a ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION].     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Quick Draw as one of his fighter bonus feats.
TAG_QUICKEN_SPELL:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_MET: You can cast a spell with a moment's thought.     Benefit: Casting a quickened spell is a ~free action~[TAG_FREE_ACTION].  You can perform another action, even casting another spell, in the same round as you cast a quickened spell.  You may cast only one quickened spell per round.  A spell whose casting time is more than 1 ~full-round action~[TAG_FULL_ROUND_ACTION] cannot be quickened.  Casting a quickened spell doesn't provoke an ~attack of opportunity~[TAG_AOO].  A quickened spell uses up a spell slot four levels higher than the spell's actual level.     Special: This feat can't be applied to any spell cast spontaneously (including ~sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS] spells and ~bard~[TAG_BARDS] spells), since applying a metamagic feat to a spontaneously cast spell automatically increases the casting time to a full-round action.
TAG_RAPID_RELOAD:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLAS: You can reload a ~light~[TAG_WEAPONS_CROSSBOW_LIGHT] or ~heavy~[TAG_WEAPONS_CROSSBOW_HEAVY] crossbow more quickly than normal.     Prerequisite: Weapon Proficiency (Light or Heavy Crossbow)     Benefit: The time required for you to ~reload~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU_RELOAD] your chosen type of crossbow is reduced to a ~free action~[TAG_FREE_ACTION] (for a light crossbow) or a ~move action~[TAG_MOVEMENT_ACTION] (for a heavy crossbow). Reloading a crossbow still provokes an ~attack of opportunity~[TAG_AOO].     If you have selected this feat for a light crossbow, you may fire that weapon as many times in a ~full attack~[TAG_FULL_ATTACK] action as if you could attack if you were using a bow.     Normal: A character without this feat needs a move action to reload a light crossbow, or a ~full-round action~[TAG_FULL_ROUND_ACTION] to reload a heavy crossbow.     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Rapid Reload as one of her fighter bonus feats.
TAG_RAPID_SHOT:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLASS_: You can use ranged weapons with exceptional speed.     Prerequisites: ~Dex~[TAG_DEXTERITY] 13, ~Point Blank Shot~[TAG_POINT_BLANK]     Benefit: You can get one extra attack per round with a ranged weapon.  The attack is at your highest ~base attack bonus~[TAG_LEVEL_BONUSES], but each attack you make in that round (the extra one and any normal ones) takes a -2 penalty.  You must use the ~full attack~[TAG_FULL_ATTACK] action to use this feat.     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Rapid Shot as one of his fighter bonus feats.     A 2nd-level ~ranger~[TAG_RANGERS] who has chosen the ~Archery Combat Style~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_RANGER_COMBAT_STYLE] is treated as having Rapid Shot, even if he does not have the prerequisites for it, but only when he is wearing light or no armor.
TAG_SCRIBE_SCROLL:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_ITE: You can create scrolls, from which you or another spellcaster can cast the scribed spells.     Prerequisite: ~Caster Level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] 1st     Benefit: You can create a scroll of any spell that you know.     The base price of a scroll is:                             its spell level x its caster level x 25 gp     To scribe a scroll, you must spend 1/25 of this base price in ~XP~[TAG_EXPERIENCE_AND_LEVELS] and use raw materials costing one-half of this base price.     Any scroll that stores a spell with a costly material component or an XP cost also carries a commensurate cost.  In addition to the costs derived from the base price, you must expend the material component or pay the XP when scribing the scroll.
TAG_SELF_SUFFICIENT:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: You can take care of yourself in harsh environments and situations.     Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all ~Heal~[TAG_HEAL] and ~Survival~[TAG_SURVIVAL] checks.
TAG_SHIELD_PROF:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: You are proficient with ~bucklers~[TAG_BUCKLER], ~light or heavy shields~[TAG_WEAPONS_SHIELD_HEAVY_LIGHT], and ~tower shields~[TAG_TOWER_SHIELD].     Benefit: You can use a shield and take only the standard penalties.     Normal: When you are using a shield with which you are not proficient, you take the shield's ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS] penalty on ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] and on all ~skill checks~[TAG_USING_SKILLS] that involve moving.     Special: ~Barbarians~[TAG_BARBARIANS], ~bards~[TAG_BARDS], ~clerics~[TAG_CLERICS], ~druids~[TAG_DRUIDS], ~fighters~[TAG_FIGHTERS], ~paladins~[TAG_PALADINS], and ~rangers~[TAG_RANGERS] automatically have Shield Proficiency as a bonus feat.  They need not select it.
TAG_SHOT_ON_RUN:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLASS: You are highly trained in skirmish ranged weapon tactics.     Prerequisites: ~Dex~[TAG_DEXTERITY] 13, ~Dodge~[TAG_DODGE], ~Mobility~[TAG_MOBILITY], ~Point Blank Shot~[TAG_POINT_BLANK], ~base attack bonus~[TAG_LEVEL_BONUSES] +4     Benefit: When using the attack action with a ranged weapon, you can move both before and after the attack, provided that your total distance moved is not greater than your speed.     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Shot on the Run as one of her fighter bonus feats.Note: In the ~Options~[TAG_HMU_OPTIONS_UI] menu, under the Preferences tab, the "End Turn after Default Action" option must be deactivated, to allow your characters to use Shot on the Run.
TAG_SILENT_SPELL:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_META: You can cast spells silently.     Benefit: A silent spell can be cast with no verbal components.  Spells without verbal components are not affected.  A silent spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.     Special: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] spells cannot be enhanced by this metamagic feat.
TAG_SIMPLE_PROF:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: You understand how to use all types of simple weapons in combat.  Examples of a ~simple weapon~[TAG_SIMPLE_WEAPONS].     Benefit: You make ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] with simple weapons normally.     Normal: When using a weapon with which you are not proficient, you take a -4 penalty on attack rolls.     Special: All characters except for ~druids~[TAG_DRUIDS], ~monks~[TAG_MONKS], and ~wizards~[TAG_WIZARDS] are automatically proficient with all simple weapons.  They need not select this feat.
TAG_SKILL_FOCUS:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: Choose a ~skill~[TAG_SKILLS], such as ~Move Silently~[TAG_MOVE_SILENTLY], etc.  You have a special knack with that skill.     Benefit: You get a +3 bonus on all ~checks~[TAG_USING_SKILLS] involving that skill.     Special: You can gain this feat multiple times.  Its effects do not stack.  Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new skill.
TAG_SNATCH_ARROWS:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLA: You are adept at grabbing incoming ~arrows~[TAG_WEAPONS_ARROWS], as well as ~crossbow bolts~[TAG_WEAPONS_BOLTS], ~spears~[TAG_WEAPONS_SPEAR], and other projectile or ~thrown weapons~[TAG_THROW_WEAPON].     Prerequisites: ~Dex~[TAG_DEXTERITY] 15, ~Deflect Arrows~[TAG_DEFLECT_ARROWS], ~Improved Unarmed Strike~[TAG_IMPROVED_UNARMED]     Benefit: When using the Snatch Arrows feat, you catch the weapon instead of just deflecting it. Thrown weapons, such as spears, are immediately thrown back at the original attacker (even though it isn't your turn).     You must have at least one hand free (holding nothing) to use this feat.     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Snatch Arrows as one of his fighter bonus feats.
TAG_SPELL_FOCUS:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: Choose a ~school~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS] of magic, such as ~Illusion~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ILLUSION].  Your spells of that school are more potent than normal.     Benefit: Add +1 to the Difficulty Class for all ~saving throws~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] against spells from the school of magic you select.     Special: You can gain this feat multiple times.  Its effects do not stack.  Each time you take the feat, it apples to a new school of magic.
TAG_SPELL_PENETRATION:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: Your spells are especially potent, breaking through ~spell resistance~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_SPELL_RESISTANCE] more readily than normal.     Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] checks (1d20 + caster level) made to overcome a creature's spell resistance.
TAG_SPRING_ATTACK:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLA: You are trained in fast ~melee attacks~[TAG_MELEE_ATTACKS] and fancy footwork.     Prerequisites: ~Dex~[TAG_DEXTERITY] 13, ~Dodge~[TAG_DODGE], ~Mobility~[TAG_MOBILITY], ~base attack bonus~[TAG_LEVEL_BONUSES] +4     Benefit: When using the attack action with a melee weapon, you can move both before and after the attack, provided that your total distance moved is not greater than your speed.  Moving in this way does not provoke an ~attack of opportunity~[TAG_AOO] from the defender you attack, though it might provoke attacks of opportunity from other creatures, if appropriate.  You can't use this feat if you are wearing heavy armor.     You must move at least 5 feet both before and after you make your attack in order to utilize the benefits of Spring Attack.     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Spring Attack as one of his fighter bonus feats.Note: In the ~Options~[TAG_HMU_OPTIONS_UI] menu, under the Preferences tab, the "End Turn after Default Action" option must be deactivated, to allow your characters to use Spring Attack.
TAG_STEALTHY:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: You are particularly good at avoiding notice.     Benefit: You get a +2 bonus on all ~Hide~[TAG_HIDE] and ~Move Silently~[TAG_MOVE_SILENTLY] checks.
TAG_STILL_SPELL:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_METAM: You can cast spells without gestures.     Benefit: A stilled spell can be cast with no somatic components.  Spells without somatic components are not affected.  A stilled spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.
TAG_STUNNING_FIST:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLA: You know how to strike opponents in vulnerable areas.     Prerequisite: ~Dex~[TAG_DEXTERITY] 13, ~Wis~[TAG_WISDOM] 13, ~Improved Unarmed Strike~[TAG_IMPROVED_UNARMED], ~base attack bonus~[TAG_LEVEL_BONUSES] +8     Benefit: You must declare that you are using this feat before you make your ~attack roll~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] (thus, a failed attack roll ruins the attempt).  Stunning Fist forces a foe damaged by ~unarmed attack~[TAG_WEAPONS_STRIKE_UNARMED] to make a ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] (DC 10 + 1/2 your character level + your Wisdom modifier), in addition to dealing damage normally.  A defender who fails this saving throw is ~stunned~[TAG_STUNNED] for 1 round (until just before your next action).  A stunned character can't act, loses any Dexterity bonus to ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS], and takes a -2 penalty to AC.  You may attempt a stunning attack once per day for every four levels you have attained, and no more than once per round.  Constructs, oozes, plants, undead, incorporeal creatures, and creatures immune to ~critical hits~[TAG_CRITICAL_HIT] cannot be stunned.     Special: A ~monk~[TAG_MONKS] gains Stunning Fist as a bonus feat at 1st level, even if she does not meet the prerequisites.  A monk may attempt a stunning attack once per monk level per day.     A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Stunning Fist as one of her fighter bonus feats.
TAG_TOUGHNESS:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: You are tougher than normal.     Benefit: You gain +3 ~hit points~[TAG_HIT_POINTS].     Special: A character may gain this feat multiple times.  Its effects stack.
TAG_TRACK:TAG_FEATS_DES:::2: You can identify different types of creatures (e.g. ~elementals~[TAG_MONSTER_ELEMENTAL]) and the general direction in which they are traveling.     Benefit:  Your ability to find tracks or follow them is dependent upon your rank, or the number of ~skill points~[TAG_ACQUIRE_SKILLS] you have, in ~Survival~[TAG_SURVIVAL]. If your rank in Survival is greater than or equal to the creature's CR, you are able to see the direction and the creature type.  Tracks of repeated creature types are not visible to you; for example, if there are two sets of human tracks, you see only one of them.  The most creature or monster types you can identify is 5.     Normal: Without this feat, you will not be able to tell the general direction of a creature's path nor will you be able to identify its type.     Special: You can only gain this feat once.     A ~ranger~[TAG_RANGERS] automatically has Track as a bonus feat.
TAG_TWO_WEAPON_DEFENSE:TAG_FEATS_DES::TA: Your two-weapon fighting style bolsters your defense as well as your offense.     Prerequisite: ~Dex~[TAG_DEXTERITY] 15, ~Two-Weapon Fighting~[TAG_TWO_FIGHTING]     Benefit: When wielding two weapons (not including natural weapons or ~unarmed strikes~[TAG_WEAPONS_STRIKE_UNARMED]), you gain a +1 ~shield~[TAG_SHIELD_BONUS] bonus to your ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS].     When you are ~fighting defensively~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU_FIGHT_DEFENSIVELY] or using the ~total defense~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU_TOTAL_DEFENSE] action, this shield bonus increases to +2.     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Two-Weapon Defense as one of his fighter bonus feats.
TAG_TWO_FIGHTING:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLAS: You can fight with a weapon in each hand.  You can make one extra attack each round with the second weapon.     Prerequisite: ~Dex~[TAG_DEXTERITY] 15     Benefit: Your penalties on ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] for fighting with two weapons are reduced.  The penalty for your primary hand lessens by 2 and the one for your off hand lessens by 6.     Normal: See information about ~Attacking with Two Weapons~[TAG_TWO_WEAPONS].     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Two-Weapon Fighting as one of his fighter bonus feats.     A 2nd-level ~ranger~[TAG_RANGERS] who has chosen the ~Two-Weapon Combat Style~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_RANGER_COMBAT_STYLE] is treated as having Two-Weapon Fighting, even if he does not have the prerequisites for it, but only when he is wearing light or no armor.
TAG_WEAPON_FINESSE:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CL: You are especially skilled at using weapons that can benefit as much from ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY] as from ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH].     Prerequisite: ~base attack bonus~[TAG_LEVEL_BONUSES] +1     Benefit: With a light weapon or ~rapier~[TAG_WEAPONS_RAPIER] made for a creature of your ~size~[TAG_SIZE_MODIFIER] category, you may use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL].  If you carry a ~shield~[TAG_ARMOR_SHIELD], its armor check penalty applies to your attack rolls.     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Weapon Finesse as one of her fighter bonus feats.
TAG_WEAPON_FOCUS:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLAS: Choose one type of weapon, such as ~greataxe~[TAG_WEAPONS_GREATAXE].  You can also choose ~unarmed strike~[TAG_WEAPONS_STRIKE_UNARMED] or ray (if you are a spellcaster) as your weapon for the purpose of this feat.  You are especially good at using this weapon.  (If you have chosen ray, you are especially good with rays, such as the one produced by the ~Ray of Frost~[TAG_SPELLS_RAY_OF_FROST] spell.)     Prerequisite: Proficiency with selected weapon, ~base attack bonus~[TAG_LEVEL_BONUSES] +1     Benefit: You gain a +1 bonus on all ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] you make using the selected weapon.     Special: You can gain this feat multiple times.  Its effects do not stack.  Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.     A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Weapon Focus as one of his fighter bonus feats.  He must have Weapon Focus with a weapon to gain the ~Weapon Specialization~[TAG_WEAPON_SPEC] feat for that weapon.
TAG_WEAPON_SPEC:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_CLASS: Choose one type of weapon, such as a ~greataxe~[TAG_WEAPONS_GREATAXE], for which you have already selected the ~Weapon Focus~[TAG_WEAPON_FOCUS] feat.  You can also choose ~unarmed strike~[TAG_WEAPONS_STRIKE_UNARMED] or ray (if you are also a spellcaster) as your weapon for the purpose of this feat.  You deal extra damage when using this weapon.     Prerequisites: Proficiency with selected weapon, Weapon Focus with selected weapon, ~Fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] level 4th     Benefit: You gain a +2 bonus on all damage rolls you make using the selected weapon.     Special: You can gain this feat multiple times.  Its effects do not stack.  Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.     A fighter may select Weapon Specialization as one of his fighter bonus feats.
TAG_WHIRLWIND_ATTACK:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_: You can strike nearby opponents in an amazing spinning attack.     Prerequisites: ~Dex~[TAG_DEXTERITY] 13, ~Int~[TAG_INTELLIGENCE] 13, ~Combat Expertise~[TAG_COMBAT_EXPERTISE], ~Dodge~[TAG_DODGE], ~Mobility~[TAG_MOBILITY], ~Spring Attack~[TAG_SPRING_ATTACK], ~base attack bonus~[TAG_LEVEL_BONUSES] +4     Benefit: When you use the ~full attack~[TAG_FULL_ATTACK] action, you can give up your regular attacks and instead make one ~melee attack~[TAG_MELEE_ATTACKS] at your full base attack bonus against each opponent within reach.     When you use the Whirlwind Attack feat, you also forfeit any bonus or extra attacks granted by other feats or abilities (such as the ~Cleave~[TAG_CLEAVE] feat or the ~Haste~[TAG_SPELLS_HASTE] spell).     Special: A ~fighter~[TAG_FIGHTERS] may select Whirlwind Attack as one of his fighter bonus feats.
TAG_WIDEN_SPELL:TAG_FEATS_DES::TAG_METAM: You can increase the area of your spells.     Benefit: You can alter a burst, emanation, line, or spread-shaped spell to increase its area.  Any numeric measurements of the spell's area increase by 100%.  For example, a widened ~Fireball~[TAG_SPELLS_FIREBALL] spell (which normally produces a 20-ft. radius spread) now fills a 40-ft. radius spread.  Spells that do not have an area of one of these four sorts are not affected by this feat.  A widened spell uses up a spell slot three levels higher than the spell's actual level.
TAG_MAGIC::::2: Casting Spells: Your spellcaster will be able to cast spells through the use of the ~radial menu~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU] in the game.  By selecting the class and level of the spell, the spellcaster's available spells will be shown and available for casting.     Casting in ~combat~[TAG_COMBAT] usually requires a ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION], although some require a ~full-round action~[TAG_FULL_ROUND_ACTION].  In ToEE, a full-round spell occurs instantaneously and then the caster gets no further action.     ~Sorcerers~[TAG_SORCERERS] or ~bards~[TAG_BARDS] who are casting a ~metamagic~[TAG_METAMAGIC] version of a spell must take more time to do so.  If a spell's normal casting time is 1 standard action, then casting a metamagic version of the spell is a full-round action for a sorcerer or bard.     While casting in combat usually is a standard action, the occasional spell may require a casting time referred to as ~Out of Combat~[TAG_OUT_OF_COMBAT].     Sometimes distractions (often through combat) require a spellcaster to make a ~Concentration~[TAG_CONCENTRATION] check to see if the spell is successful.  Spell failure results in the loss of that spell.The majority of spells belong to one of eight ~schools~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS] of magic.Spells belong to one of two types:~Arcane Spells~[TAG_ARCANE_SPELLS]~Divine Spells~[TAG_DIVINE_SPELLS]Some magical creatures can create magical effects without being spellcasters, and certain ~magic items~[TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS] create magical effects.  These effects come in two types: spell-like and supernaturalAdditionally, members of certain ~classes~[TAG_CLASSES] and certain creatures can use special abilities that aren't magical.  These abilities are called: extraordinary or natural
TAG_ARCANE_SPELLS:TAG_MAGIC:::2: ~Wizards~[TAG_WIZARDS], ~sorcerers~[TAG_SORCERERS], and ~bards~[TAG_BARDS] can cast arcane spells, which involve the direct manipulation of mystic energies.  These manipulations require natural talent (in the case of sorcerers), long study (in the case of wizards), or both (in the case of bards).  Compared to ~divine spells~[TAG_DIVINE_SPELLS], arcane spells are more likely to produce dramatic results, such as flight, explosions, or transformations.     ~Intelligence~[TAG_INTELLIGENCE] is the key attribute for wizard spells, while ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA] is the key attribute for sorcerers and bards.     Wizards must rest each day to regain spells.  Spells must be prepared each day from their available list, filling each slot with a spell.  Spells intended to be used more than once must take a slot for each intended casting.     Sorcerers and bards also rest to regain spells.  However, they do not need to fill slots with particular spells.  They can cast any spell from their spell list, as long as they still have enough spell slots to cast.     Arcane spells may be subject to ~failure~[TAG_ARCANE_SPELL_FAILURE] if the caster is wearing ~armor~[TAG_ARMOR].
TAG_DIVINE_SPELLS:TAG_MAGIC:::2: ~Clerics~[TAG_CLERICS], ~druids~[TAG_DRUIDS], experienced ~paladins~[TAG_PALADINS], and experienced ~rangers~[TAG_RANGERS] can cast divine spells.  Unlike ~arcane spells~[TAG_ARCANE_SPELLS], divine spells draw power from a divine source.  Clerics gain spell power from ~deities~[TAG_RELIGION] or from divine forces.  The divine forces of nature power druids' and rangers' spells.  The divine powers of law and good power paladins' spells.  Divine spells tend to focus on healing and protection and are less flashy, destructive, and disruptive than arcane spells.     ~Wisdom~[TAG_WISDOM] is the key attribute for casting divine spells and controls the highest level of spells the character may have.     A divine caster is required to rest to regain spells.  They must prepare which spells they wish to cast for the next day by filling in available slots.  Clerics channeling positive energy can substitute a Cure spell for any spell in their list, while negative channeling clerics can substitute Inflict spells.  This is called ~spontaneous casting~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_CLERIC_SPONTANEOUS_CASTING].  Druids can substitute a Summon Nature's Ally spell for any spell in their list, also called ~spontaneous casting~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_DRUID_SPONTANEOUS_CASTING].
TAG_CASTER_LEVEL:TAG_MAGIC:::2: A spell's power often depends on its caster level, which for most spellcasting characters is equal to your class level in the class you're using to cast the spell.     You can cast a spell at a lower caster level than normal, but the caster level you choose must be high enough for you to cast the spell in question, and all level-dependent features must be based on the same caster level.     In the event that a ~class feature~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_DESC], ~domain~[TAG_DOMAINS] granted power, or other special ability provides an adjustment to your caster level, that adjustment applies not only to effects based on caster level (such as range, duration, and damage dealt) but also to your caster level check to overcome your target's ~spell resistance~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_SPELL_RESISTANCE] and to the caster level used in dispel checks (both the dispel check and the DC of the check).
TAG_ARCANE_SPELL_FAILURE:TAG_ARCANE_SPEL: ~Armor~[TAG_ARMOR] interferes with the gestures that a spellcaster must make to cast an ~arcane spell~[TAG_ARCANE_SPELLS] that has a somatic component.  Arcane spellcasters face the possibility of arcane spell failure if they're wearing armor, so ~wizards~[TAG_WIZARDS] and ~sorcerers~[TAG_SORCERERS] usually don't do so.  ~Bards~[TAG_BARDS] can wear light armor without incurring any arcane spell failure chance for their bard spells.
TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ABJURATION:TAG_MAGIC::: Abjurations are protective spells.  They create physical or magical barriers, negate magical or physical abilities, harm trespassers, or even banish the subject of the spell to another plane of existence.  Representative spells include  ~Protection from Evil~[TAG_SPELLS_PROTECTION_FROM_EVIL] and ~Dispel Magic~[TAG_SPELLS_DISPEL_MAGIC].     If an abjuration creates a barrier that keeps certain types of creatures at bay, that barrier cannot be used to push away those creatures.
TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_CONJURATION:TAG_MAGIC:: Each conjuration spell belongs to one of five subschools.Calling: Can transport creatures from another plane of existence to your plane.  The spell grants the creature the one-time ability to return to its plane of origin.  Creatures who are called actually die when they are killed; they don't just disappear and reform.  The duration of a calling spell is instantaneous.Creation: Can create objects or effects on the spot.  If the spell's duration is not instantaneous, magic will hold the creation together, and when the spell ends, the conjured creature or object vanishes without a trace.  If the spell's duration is instantaneous, the created object or creature is merely assembled through magic, and will last indefinitely, as it does not depend on magic for its existence.Healing: Certain divine conjurations heal creatures or even bring them back to life.  These include Cure spells (for example, ~Cure Minor Wounds~[TAG_SPELLS_CURE_MINOR_WOUNDS]), which good ~clerics~[TAG_CLERICS] can ~cast spontaneously~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_CLERIC_SPONTANEOUS_CASTING].Teleportation: Can transport one or more creatures or objects a great distance.  The most powerful of these spells can cross planar boundaries.  Teleportation is one-way and not dispellable.  It is instantaneous travel through the Astral Plane; therefore, anything that blocks astral travel also blocks teleportation.Summoning: Can bring manifestations of objects, creatures, or some form of energy to you.  When the spell ends or is dispelled, a summoned creature is instantly sent back, but only if the spell description indicates this.  A summoned creature also goes away if it is killed or if its ~hit points~[TAG_HIT_POINTS] drop to 0 or lower, but it is not really dead.  It will reform in 24 hours and can't be summoned again during this time.
TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_DIVINATION:TAG_MAGIC::: Divination spells enable you to learn secrets long forgotten, to predict the future, to find hidden things, and to foil deceptive spells.  Representative spells include ~Identify~[TAG_SPELLS_IDENTIFY], ~Clairaudience/Clairvoyance~[TAG_SPELLS_CLAIRAUDIENCE_CLAIRVOYANCE], and ~True Seeing~[TAG_SPELLS_TRUE_SEEING].Scrying: A scrying spell effect is an invisible magical sensor that sends you information.  Unless noted otherwise, the sensor has the same powers of any sensory acuity that you possess.  This level of acuity includes any spells or effects that target you (such as ~See Invisibility~[TAG_SPELLS_SEE_INVISIBILITY]), but not spells that emanate from you (such as ~Detect Evil~[TAG_SPELLS_DETECT_EVIL]).  However, the sensor functions as an independent organ, so it will continue to work even if you are ~blinded~[TAG_BLINDED], ~deafened~[TAG_DEAFENED], etc.
TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT:TAG_MAGIC:: Enchantment spells affect the minds of others, influencing or controlling their behavior.  Representative spells include ~Charm Person~[TAG_SPELLS_CHARM_PERSON].  All enchantments are mind-affecting spells.  Two types of enchantment spells grant you influence over a subject creature.Charm: A charm spell changes how the subject views you, typically in a positive manner, ensuring that they see you as a good friend.Compulsion: A compulsion spell forces the subject to act in some manner or changes the way his mind works.  Some compulsion spells determine the subject's actions or the effects on the subject, some allow you to determine the subject's actions when you cast the spell, and others give you ongoing control over the subject.
TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_EVOCATION:TAG_MAGIC:::: Evocation spells manipulate energy or tap an unseen source of power to produce a desired end.  In effect, they create something out of nothing.  Many of these spells produce spectacular effects, and evocation spells can deal large amounts of damage.  Representative spells include ~Magic Missile~[TAG_SPELLS_MAGIC_MISSILE], ~Fireball~[TAG_SPELLS_FIREBALL], and ~Lightning Bolt~[TAG_SPELLS_LIGHTNING_BOLT].
TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ILLUSION:TAG_MAGIC:::2: Illusion spells deceive the senses or minds of others.  They cause people to see things that are not there, not see things that are there, hear phantom noises, or remember things that never happened.  Representative illusions include ~Invisibility~[TAG_SPELLS_INVISIBILITY].  Illusions come in the following five types:Figments: These spells create a false sensation, one that is the same regardless of who experiences it.  Figments are unable to make something seem to be something else.  For example, a figment spell with audible effects cannot duplicate intelligible speech unless the spell specifically says it can.  Figments cannot produce real effects, and therefore, are useless for directly attacking foes.Glamer: A glamer spell changes a subject's sensory qualities, making it look, feel, taste, smell, or sound like something else, or even seem to disappear.Pattern: This creates an image that others can see and also affects the minds of those who see it or are caught in it.Phantasm: Creates a mental image that usually only the caster and the subjects of the spell can perceive.  This image is totally within the minds of the subjects and is a personalized mental impression.  Third parties don't notice the phantasm.Shadow: Creates something that is partially real.  The caster weaves it from extradimensional energies.  Such illusions can have real effects.  If a creature takes damage from a shadow illusion, that damage is real.Saving Throws and Illusions (Disbelief): Creatures encountering an illusion effect usually do not receive ~saving throws~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] to recognize it as illusory until they study it carefully or interact with it in some fashion.  A successful saving throw against an illusion reveals it to be false, but a figment or phantasm remains as a translucent outline.  A failed saving throw indicates that a character fails to notice something is amiss.
TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_NECROMANCY:TAG_MAGIC::: Necromancy spells manipulate the power of death, unlife, and the life force.  Spells involving undead creatures make up a large part of this school.  Representative spells include ~Cause Fear~[TAG_SPELLS_CAUSE_FEAR] and ~Animate Dead~[TAG_SPELLS_ANIMATE_DEAD].
TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_TRANSMUTATION:TAG_MAGI: Transmutation spells change the properties of some creature, thing, or condition.  Representative spells include ~Reduce Person~[TAG_SPELLS_REDUCE_PERSON].
TAG_SPELLS::::2: Spells are broken down by class and level as below:Bard:~Level 0~[TAG_BARD_0]~Level 1~[TAG_BARD_1]~Level 2~[TAG_BARD_2]~Level 3~[TAG_BARD_3]~Level 4~[TAG_BARD_4]~Level 5~[TAG_BARD_5]~Level 6~[TAG_BARD_6]Cleric:~Domain~[TAG_DOMAINS]~Level 0~[TAG_CLERIC_0]~Level 1~[TAG_CLERIC_1]~Level 2~[TAG_CLERIC_2]~Level 3~[TAG_CLERIC_3]~Level 4~[TAG_CLERIC_4]~Level 5~[TAG_CLERIC_5]~Level 6~[TAG_CLERIC_6]~Level 7~[TAG_CLERIC_7]~Level 8~[TAG_CLERIC_8]~Level 9~[TAG_CLERIC_9]Druid:~Level 0~[TAG_DRUID_0]~Level 1~[TAG_DRUID_1]~Level 2~[TAG_DRUID_2]~Level 3~[TAG_DRUID_3]~Level 4~[TAG_DRUID_4]~Level 5~[TAG_DRUID_5]~Level 6~[TAG_DRUID_6]~Level 7~[TAG_DRUID_7]~Level 8~[TAG_DRUID_8]~Level 9~[TAG_DRUID_9]Paladin:~Level 1~[TAG_PALADIN_1]~Level 2~[TAG_PALADIN_2]~Level 3~[TAG_PALADIN_3]~Level 4~[TAG_PALADIN_4]Ranger:~Level 1~[TAG_RANGER_1]~Level 2~[TAG_RANGER_2]~Level 3~[TAG_RANGER_3]~Level 4~[TAG_RANGER_4]Sorcerer:~Level 0~[TAG_SORCERER_0]~Level 1~[TAG_SORCERER_1]~Level 2~[TAG_SORCERER_2]~Level 3~[TAG_SORCERER_3]~Level 4~[TAG_SORCERER_4]~Level 5~[TAG_SORCERER_5]~Level 6~[TAG_SORCERER_6]~Level 7~[TAG_SORCERER_7]~Level 8~[TAG_SORCERER_8]~Level 9~[TAG_SORCERER_9]Wizard:~Level 0~[TAG_WIZARD_0]~Level 1~[TAG_WIZARD_1]~Level 2~[TAG_WIZARD_2]~Level 3~[TAG_WIZARD_3]~Level 4~[TAG_WIZARD_4]~Level 5~[TAG_WIZARD_5]~Level 6~[TAG_WIZARD_6]~Level 7~[TAG_WIZARD_7]~Level 8~[TAG_WIZARD_8]~Level 9~[TAG_WIZARD_9]
TAG_DOMAINS:TAG_SPELLS:::2: Depending on their ~deity~[TAG_RELIGION], ~clerics~[TAG_CLERICS] receive extra spells according to the domains their deity has access to, and the cleric chooses two domains.Possible cleric domains are:[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_AIR_D:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deities: ~Obad-Hai~[TAG_OBAD_HAI]Granted Power: Turn or destroy earth creatures as a good cleric turns undead.  Rebuke, command, or bolster air creatures as an evil cleric rebukes undead.  Use these abilities a total number of times per day equal to 3 + your ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA] modifier.  This granted power is a supernatural ability.Air Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_ANIMAL_D:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deities: ~Ehlonna~[TAG_EHLONNA], ~Obad-Hai~[TAG_OBAD_HAI]Granted Powers: You may use your ability to charm an animal, as per the ~Charm Animal~[TAG_SPELLS_CHARM_ANIMAL] spell, once per day.     Add Knowledge (Nature) to your list of cleric class skills.Note: In ToEE, the Knowledge (Nature) skill has not been implemented.Animal Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_CHAOS_D:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deities: ~Corellon Larethian~[TAG_CORELLON], ~Erythnul~[TAG_ERYTHNUL], ~Gruumsh~[TAG_GRUUMSH], ~Kord~[TAG_KORD], ~Olidammara~[TAG_OLIDAMMARA]Granted Power: You can cast chaos spells at +1 ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL].Chaos Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_DEATH_D:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deities: ~Nerull~[TAG_NERULL], ~Wee Jas~[TAG_WEE_JAS]Granted Power: You may use a Death Touch once per day.  Your Death Touch is a supernatural ability that produces a death effect.  You must succeed on a ~melee attack~[TAG_MELEE_ATTACKS] against a living creature (using the rules for ~touch~[TAG_TOUCH_ATTACK] spells).  When you touch, roll 1d6 per cleric level you possess.  If the total at least equals the creature's current ~hit points~[TAG_HIT_POINTS], it dies (no save).Death Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_DESTRUCTION_D:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deities: ~St. Cuthbert~[TAG_CUTHBERT], ~Hextor~[TAG_HEXTOR]Granted Power: You gain the Smite power, the supernatural ability to make a single ~melee attack~[TAG_MELEE_ATTACKS] with a +4 bonus on ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] and a bonus on damage rolls equal to your cleric level (if you hit).  You must declare the Smite before making the attack.  This ability is usable once per day.Destruction Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_EARTH_D:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deities: ~Moradin~[TAG_MORADIN], ~Obad-Hai~[TAG_OBAD_HAI]Granted Power: Turn or destroy air creatures as a good cleric turns undead.  Rebuke, command, or bolster earth creatures as an evil cleric rebukes undead.  Use these abilities a total number of times per day equal to 3 + your ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA] modifier.  This granted power is a supernatural ability.Earth Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_EVIL_D:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deities: ~Erythnul~[TAG_ERYTHNUL], ~Gruumsh~[TAG_GRUUMSH], ~Hextor~[TAG_HEXTOR], ~Nerull~[TAG_NERULL], ~Vecna~[TAG_VECNA]Granted Power: You cast evil spells at +1 ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL].Evil Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_FIRE_D:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deity: ~Obad-Hai~[TAG_OBAD_HAI]Granted Power: Turn or destroy water creatures as a good cleric turns undead.  Rebuke, command, or bolster fire creatures as an evil cleric rebukes undead.  Use these abilities a total number of times per day equal to 3 + your ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA] modifier.  This granted power is a supernatural ability.Fire Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_GOOD_DOMAIN:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deities: ~Corellon Larethian~[TAG_CORELLON], ~Ehlonna~[TAG_EHLONNA], ~Garl Glittergold~[TAG_GARL], ~Heironeous~[TAG_HEIRONEOUS], ~Kord~[TAG_KORD], ~Moradin~[TAG_MORADIN], ~Pelor~[TAG_PELOR], ~Yondalla~[TAG_YONDALLA]Granted Power: You cast good spells at +1 ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL].Good Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_HEALING_D:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deity: ~Pelor~[TAG_PELOR]Granted Power: You cast healing spells at +1 ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL].Healing Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_KNOWLEDGE_D:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deities: ~Boccob~[TAG_BOCCOB], ~Vecna~[TAG_VECNA]Granted Powers: You cast ~Divination~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_DIVINATION] spells at +1 ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL].     Add all Knowledge skills to your list of cleric class skills.Note: In ToEE, the Knowledge skills have not been implemented.Knowledge Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_LAW_D:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deities: ~St. Cuthbert~[TAG_CUTHBERT], ~Heironeous~[TAG_HEIRONEOUS], ~Hextor~[TAG_HEXTOR], ~Moradin~[TAG_MORADIN], ~Wee Jas~[TAG_WEE_JAS], ~Yondalla~[TAG_YONDALLA]Granted Power: You cast law spells at +1 ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL].Law Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_LUCK_D:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deities: ~Fharlanghn~[TAG_FHARLANGHN], ~Kord~[TAG_KORD], ~Olidammara~[TAG_OLIDAMMARA]Granted Power: You gain the power of Good Fortune, which is usable once per day.  This extraordinary ability allows you to reroll your next failed roll.  You have the option of re-rolling your next failed ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC], your next missed ~attack roll~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL], or your next unconfirmed ~critical hit~[TAG_CRITICAL_HIT].  In the game, a box will appear and you will check one of those three options.  In the event that you fail the next roll, the power of luck will give you another chance to succeed.Luck Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_MAGIC_D:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deities: ~Boccob~[TAG_BOCCOB], ~Vecna~[TAG_VECNA], ~Wee Jas~[TAG_WEE_JAS]Granted Power: Use scrolls, wands, and other devices with spell completion or spell trigger activation as a ~wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] of one-half your cleric level (at least 1st level).  For the purpose of using a scroll or other magic device, if you are also a wizard, actual wizard levels and these effective wizard levels stack.Magic Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_PLANT_D:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deities: ~Ehlonna~[TAG_EHLONNA], ~Obad-Hai~[TAG_OBAD_HAI]Granted Powers: Rebuke or command plant creatures as an evil cleric rebukes or commands undead.  Use this ability a total number of times per day equal to 3 + your ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA] modifier.  This granted power is a supernatural ability.     Add Knowledge (Nature) to your list of cleric class skills.Note: In ToEE, the Knowledge (Nature) skill has not been implemented.Plant Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_PROTECTION_D:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deities: ~Corellon Larethian~[TAG_CORELLON], ~St. Cuthbert~[TAG_CUTHBERT], ~Fharlanghn~[TAG_FHARLANGHN], ~Garl Glittergold~[TAG_GARL], ~Moradin~[TAG_MORADIN], ~Yondalla~[TAG_YONDALLA]Granted Power: You can generate a Protective Ward as a supernatural ability.  This grants someone you touch a resistance bonus equal to your cleric level on his or her next ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC].  Activating this power is a ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION].  The Protective Ward is an ~abjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ABJURATION] effect with a duration of 1 hour that is usable once per day.Protection Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_STRENGTH_D:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deities: ~St. Cuthbert~[TAG_CUTHBERT], ~Gruumsh~[TAG_GRUUMSH], ~Kord~[TAG_KORD], ~Pelor~[TAG_PELOR]Granted Power: You can perform a Feat of Strength as a supernatural ability.  You gain an ~enhancement~[TAG_ENHANCEMENT_BONUS] bonus to ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH] equal to your cleric level.  Activating the power is a ~free action~[TAG_FREE_ACTION], the power lasts 1 round, and it is usable once per day.Strength Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_SUN_D:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deities: ~Ehlonna~[TAG_EHLONNA], ~Pelor~[TAG_PELOR]Granted Power: Once per day, you can perform a Greater Turning against undead in place of a regular ~turning~[TAG_TURN].  The Greater Turning is like a normal turning except that the undead creatures that would be turned are destroyed instead.Sun Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
