TAG_TRAVEL_D:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deities: ~Fharlanghn~[TAG_FHARLANGHN]Granted Powers: For a total time per day of 1 round per cleric level you possess, you can act normally regardless of magical effects that impede movement as if you were affected by the ~Freedom of Movement~[TAG_SPELLS_FREEDOM_OF_MOVEMENT] spell.  This effect occurs automatically as soon as it applies, lasts until it runs out or is no longer needed, and can operate multiple times per day (up to the total daily limit of rounds).  This granted power is a supernatural ability.     Add ~Survival~[TAG_SURVIVAL] to your list of cleric class skills.Travel Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_TRICKERY_D:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deities: ~Boccob~[TAG_BOCCOB], ~Erythnul~[TAG_ERYTHNUL], ~Garl Glittergold~[TAG_GARL], ~Olidammara~[TAG_OLIDAMMARA], ~Nerull~[TAG_NERULL]Granted Power: Add ~Bluff~[TAG_BLUFF] and ~Hide~[TAG_HIDE] to your list of cleric class skills.Trickery Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_WAR_D:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deities: ~Corellon Larethian~[TAG_CORELLON], ~Erythnul~[TAG_ERYTHNUL], ~Gruumsh~[TAG_GRUUMSH], ~Heironeous~[TAG_HEIRONEOUS], ~Hextor~[TAG_HEXTOR]Granted Power: You gain the ~Martial Weapon Proficiency~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF] feat with your deity's favored weapon (if necessary) and the ~Weapon Focus~[TAG_WEAPON_FOCUS] feat with your deity's favored weapon.     The favored weapons of the war deities are as follows:          Corellon Larethian: @t~Longsword~[TAG_WEAPONS_LONGSWORD]          Erythnul:                    @t~Morningstar~[TAG_WEAPONS_MORNINGSTAR]          Gruumsh:                  @t~Longspear~[TAG_WEAPONS_LONGSPEAR]          Heironeous:               @t~Longsword~[TAG_WEAPONS_LONGSWORD]          Hextor:                      @t~Heavy Flail~[TAG_WEAPONS_FLAIL_HEAVY]War Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_WATER_D:TAG_DOMAINS:::2: Deity: ~Obad-Hai~[TAG_OBAD_HAI]Granted Power: Turn or destroy fire creatures as a good cleric turns undead.  Rebuke, command, or bolster water creatures as an evil cleric rebukes undead.  Use these abilities a total number of times per day equal to 3 + your ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA] modifier.  This granted power is a supernatural ability.Water Domain Spells[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_SPELLS_ACID_SPLASH:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_S: ~Conjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_CONJURATION] (Creation) AcidLevel: ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 0Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Effect: One missile of acidDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: NoneSpell Resistance: NoYou fire a small orb of acid at the target. You must succeed on a ranged ~touch attack~[TAG_TOUCH_ATTACK] to hit your target. The orb deals 1d3 points of acid damage.
TAG_SPELLS_AID:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_CLERIC_2: ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] (Compulsion) Mind-AffectingLevel: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 2, ~Domain: Good~[TAG_GOOD_DOMAIN] 2, ~Domain: Luck~[TAG_LUCK_D] 2Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: TouchTarget: Living creature touchedDuration: 1 min./levelSaving Throw: NoneSpell Resistance: Yes (harmless)Aid grants the target a +1 morale bonus on ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] and saves against ~fear~[TAG_FEAR] effects, plus ~temporary hit points~[TAG_TEMPORARY_HIT_POINTS] equal to 1d8 + ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (to a maximum of 1d8+10 temporary hit points at caster level 10th).
TAG_SPELLS_ANALYZE_DWEOMER:TAG_SPELLS::T: ~Divination~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_DIVINATION]Level: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 6, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 6Components: V, S, FCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Target: One object or creature per ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL]Duration: 1 round/level (D)Saving Throw: None or ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negates; see textSpell Resistance: NoYou discern all spells and magical properties present in a number of creatures or objects. Each round, you may examine a single creature or object that you can see as a ~free action~[TAG_FREE_ACTION]. In the case of a ~magic item~[TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS], you learn its functions, how to activate its functions (if appropriate), and how many charges are left (if it uses charges). In the case of an object or creature with active spells cast upon it, you learn each spell, its effect, and its caster level. An attended object may attempt a Will save to resist this effect if its holder so desires. If the save succeeds, you learn nothing about the object except what you can discern by looking at it. Co8 Note: When you cast Analyze Dweomer, you select up to 5 creatures and all items in the selected creature's ~inventory~[TAG_HMU_CHAR_INVENTORY_UI] will be identified. The spell's caster will also gain a +20 bonus on ~Spellcraft~[TAG_SPELLCRAFT] checks for the duration of the spell. Focus: A tiny lens of ruby or sapphire set in a small golden loop. The gemstone must be worth at least 1,500 gp.
TAG_SPELLS_ANIMAL_GROWTH :TAG_SPELLS::TA: ~Transmutation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_TRANSMUTATION]Level: ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 5, ~Ranger~[TAG_RANGERS] 4, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 5Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)Targets: Up to one animal (Gargantuan or smaller) per two levels, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apartDuration: 1 min./levelSaving Throw: ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] negatesSpell Resistance: YesA number of animals grow to twice their normal ~size~[TAG_SIZE_MODIFIER] and eight times their normal weight. This alteration changes each animal's size category to the next largest (from Large to Huge, for example), grants it a +8 size bonus to ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH] and a +4 size bonus to ~Constitution~[TAG_CONSTITUTION] (and thus an extra 2 ~hit points~[TAG_HIT_POINTS] per HD), and imposes a -2 size penalty to ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY]. The creature's existing natural armor bonus increases by 2. The size change also affects the animal's modifier to ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS], ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL], and its base damage. The animal's reach will change, but the animal's space and speed will not.     The spell also grants each subject ~damage reduction~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_DAMAGE_REDUCTION] 10/magic and a +4 resistance bonus on ~saving throws~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC]. All equipment worn or carried by an animal is similarly enlarged by the spell, though this change has no effect on the magical properties of any such equipment. Any enlarged item that leaves the enlarged creature's possession instantly returns to its normal size. The spell gives no means of command or influence over the enlarged animals. Multiple magical effects that increases size do not stack, which means that you can't use a second casting of this spell to further increase the size of an animal that's still under the effect of the first casting.
TAG_SPELLS_ANIMAL_TRANCE:TAG_SPELLS::TAG: ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] (Compulsion) Mind-Affecting, SonicLevel: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 2, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 2Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Targets: Animals or magical beasts with ~Intelligence~[TAG_INTELLIGENCE] 1 or 2Duration: ~Concentration~[TAG_CONCENTRATION]Saving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negates; see textSpell Resistance: YesYour swaying motions and music (or singing, or chanting) compels animals and magical beasts to do nothing but watch you. Only a creature with an Intelligence of 1 or 2 can be ~fascinated~[TAG_FASCINATED] by this spell. You fascinate 2d6 HD worth of creatures. The closest targets are selected first until no more targets within range can be affected. For example, if Vadania affects 7 HD worth of animals and there are several 2 HD ~wolves~[TAG_MONSTER_WOLF] within close range, only the three closest wolves are affected. A magical beast or a ~dire~[TAG_MONSTER_DIRE] animal is allowed a ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC]; other animals are not.
TAG_SPELLS_ANIMATE_DEAD:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_: ~Necromancy~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_NECROMANCY] (Evil)Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 3, ~Domain: Death~[TAG_DEATH_D] 3, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 4Components: V, S, MCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: TouchTargets: One corpse touchedDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: NoneSpell Resistance: NoThis spell turns the body of a dead creature into an undead skeleton or zombie that follows your spoken commands. The undead can follow you and it remains animated until it is destroyed. (A destroyed skeleton or zombie can't be animated again.) Material Component: You must place a black onyx gem worth at least 25 gp into the mouth or eye socket of the corpse you intend to animate. The magic of the spell turns this gem into a worthless, burned-out shell.
TAG_SPELLS_ATONEMENT:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_CLE: ~Abjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ABJURATION]Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 5, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 5Components: V, S, XPCasting Time: 1 hourRange: TouchTarget: Living creature touchedDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: NoneSpell Resistance: YesThis spell removes the burden of evil acts or misdeeds from the subject. The creature seeking atonement must be truly repentant and desirous of setting right its misdeeds. If the atoning creature committed the evil act unwittingly or under some form of compulsion, atonement operates normally at no cost to you. However, in the case of a creature atoning for deliberate misdeeds and acts of a knowing and willful nature, you must intercede with your deity (requiring you to expend 500 XP) in order to expunge the subject's burden. Atonement may be cast for one purpose. RESTORE CLASS   A paladin who has lost her class features due to committing an evil act may have her paladinhood restored to her by this spell.
TAG_SPELLS_BANE:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_CLERIC_1: ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] (Compulsion) Fear, Mind-AffectingLevel: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 1Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: 50 ft.Area: All enemies within 50 ft.Duration: 1 min./levelSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negatesSpell Resistance: YesBane fills your enemies with fear and doubt. Each affected creature takes a -1 penalty on ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] and a -1 penalty on ~saving throws~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] against ~fear~[TAG_FEAR] effects. Bane counters and dispels ~Bless~[TAG_SPELLS_BLESS].
TAG_SPELLS_BANISHMENT:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_CL: ~Abjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ABJURATION]Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 6, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 7Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Targets: One or more extraplanar creatures,  no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apartDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negatesSpell Resistance: YesA banishment spell is a more powerful version of the ~dismissal~[TAG_SPELLS_DISMISSAL] spell. It enables you to force extraplanar creatures out of your home plane. As many as 2 Hit Dice of creatures per caster level can be banished. You can improve the spell's chance of success by presenting at least one object or substance that the target hates, fears, or otherwise opposes. For each such object or substance, you gain a +1 bonus on your caster level check to overcome the target's spell resistance (if any), the saving throw DC increases by 2. Certain rare items might work twice as well as a normal item for the purpose of the bonuses (each providing a +2 bonus on the caster level check against spell resistance and increasing the save DC by 4).
TAG_SPELLS_BARKSKIN:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_DRUI: ~Transmutation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_TRANSMUTATION]Level: ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 2, ~Ranger~[TAG_RANGERS] 2, ~Domain: Plant~[TAG_PLANT_D] 2Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: TouchTarget: Living creature touchedDuration: 10 min./levelSaving Throw: NoneSpell Resistance: Yes (harmless)Barkskin toughens a creature's skin. The effect grants a +2 ~enhancement~[TAG_ENHANCEMENT_BONUS] bonus to the creature's existing natural armor bonus. This enhancement bonus increases by 1 for every three ~caster levels~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] above 3rd, to a maximum of +5 at caster level 12th. The enhancement bonus provided by Barkskin stacks with the target's natural armor bonus, but not with other enhancement bonuses to natural armor. A creature without natural armor has an effective natural armor bonus of +0.
TAG_SPELLS_BEAR'S_ENDURANCE:TAG_SPELLS::: ~Transmutation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_TRANSMUTATION]Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 2, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 2, ~Ranger~[TAG_RANGERS] 2, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 2Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: TouchTarget: Creature touchedDuration: 1 min./levelSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negates (harmless)Spell Resistance: YesThe affected creature gains greater vitality and stamina. The spell grants the subject a +4 ~enhancement~[TAG_ENHANCEMENT_BONUS] bonus to ~Constitution~[TAG_CONSTITUTION], which adds the usual benefits to ~hit points~[TAG_HIT_POINTS], ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] saves, Constitution checks, and so forth. Hit points gained by a temporary increase in Constitution score are not ~temporary hit points~[TAG_TEMPORARY_HIT_POINTS]. They go away when the subject's Constitution drops back to normal. They are not lost first as temporary hit points are.
TAG_SPELLS_BEAR'S_ENDURANCE_MASS:TAG_SPE: ~Transmutation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_TRANSMUTATION]Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 6, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 6, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 6Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Targets: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apartMass Bear's Endurance works like ~Bear's Endurance~[TAG_SPELLS_BEAR'S_ENDURANCE], except that it affects multiple creatures.
TAG_SPELLS_BESTOW_CURSE:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_: ~Necromancy~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_NECROMANCY]Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 3, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 4Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: TouchTarget: Creature touchedDuration: PermanentSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negatesSpell Resistance: YesYou place a curse on the subject.  Choose one of the following three effects.     -6 decrease to an ~ability score~[TAG_ABILITY_SCORES] (minimum 1)     -4 penalty on ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL], saves, ability checks, and ~skill checks~[TAG_USING_SKILLS].     Each turn, the target has a 50% chance to act normally; otherwise, it takes no action. The curse bestowed by this spell cannot be dispelled, but it can be removed with a ~Break Enchantment~[TAG_SPELLS_BREAK_ENCHANTMENT] or ~Remove Curse~[TAG_SPELLS_REMOVE_CURSE] spell. Bestow Curse counters Remove Curse.
TAG_SPELLS_BLASPHEMY:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_CLE: ~Evocation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_EVOCATION] (Evil, Sonic)Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 7, ~Domain: Evil~[TAG_EVIL_D] 7Components: VCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: 40 ft.Area: Nonevil creatures in a 40-ft.-radius spread centered on youDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: None or ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negates; see textSpell Resistance: YesAny nonevil creature within the area of a Blasphemy spell suffers the following ill effects.HD                                        EffectEqual to ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL]      @t~Dazed~[TAG_DAZED]Up to caster level - 1     @tWeakened, dazedUp to caster level - 5     @t~Paralyzed~[TAG_PARALYZED], weakened, dazedUp to caster level - 10 @tKilled, paralyzed, weakened, dazed The effects are cumulative and concurrent. No ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] is allowed against these effects. Dazed     The creature can take no actions for 1 round, though it defends itself normally. Weakened     The creature's ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH] score decreases by 2d6 points for 2d4 rounds. Paralyzed     The creature is paralyzed and ~helpless~[TAG_HELPLESS] for 1d10 minutes. Killed     Living creatures die. Undead creatures are destroyed. Furthermore, if you are on your home plane when you cast this spell, nonevil extraplanar creatures within the area are instantly banished back to their home planes. Creatures so banished cannot return for at least 24 hours. This effect takes place regardless of whether the creatures hear the Blasphemy. The banishment effect allows a Will save (at a -4 penalty) to negate. Creatures whose Hit Dice exceed your caster level are unaffected by Blasphemy.
TAG_SPELLS_BLESS:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_CLERIC_: ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] (Compulsion) Mind-AffectingLevel: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 1, ~Paladin~[TAG_PALADINS] 1Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: 50 ft.Area: The caster and all allies within a 50-ft. burst, centered on the casterDuration: 1 min./levelSaving Throw: NoneSpell Resistance: Yes (harmless)Bless fills your allies with courage. Each ally gains a +1 morale bonus on ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] and on ~saving throws~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] against ~fear~[TAG_FEAR] effects. Bless counters and dispels ~Bane~[TAG_SPELLS_BANE].
TAG_SPELLS_BLESS_WATER:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_C: ~Transmutation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_TRANSMUTATION] (Good)Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 1, ~Paladin~[TAG_PALADINS] 1Components: V, S, MCasting Time: 1 minuteRange: TouchTarget: Flask of water touchedDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negates (object)Spell Resistance: Yes (object)This transmutation imbues a flask (1 pint) of water with positive energy, turning it into ~holy water~[TAG_HOLY_WATER]. In ToEE, a flask of holy water is directly summoned into your ~inventory~[TAG_HMU_CHAR_INVENTORY_UI]. Material Component: 5 pounds of powdered silver (worth 25 gp)
TAG_SPELLS_BLIGHT:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_DRUID_: ~Necromancy~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_NECROMANCY]Level: ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 4, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 5Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: TouchDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] halfSpell Resistance: YesThis spell withers a single plant creature of any ~size~[TAG_SIZE_MODIFIER]. An affected plant creature takes 1d6 points of damage per level (maximum 15d6) and may attempt a Fortitude ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] for half damage. This spell has no effect on the soil or surrounding plant life.
TAG_SPELLS_BLINDNESS_DEAFNESS:TAG_SPELLS: ~Necromancy~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_NECROMANCY]Level: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 2, ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 3, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 2Components: VCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)Target: One living creatureDuration: Permanent (D)Saving Throw: ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] negatesSpell Resistance: YesYou call upon the powers of unlife to render the subject ~blinded~[TAG_BLINDED] or ~deafened~[TAG_DEAFENED], as you choose.
TAG_SPELLS_BLINK:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_BARD_3: ~Transmutation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_TRANSMUTATION]Level: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 3, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 3Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: PersonalTarget: YouDuration: 1 round/level (D)You "blink" back and forth between the Material Plane and the Ethereal Plane. You look as though you're winking in and out of reality very quickly and at random. Blinking has several effects, as follows:  - Physical attacks against you have a 50% miss chance, and the ~Blind-Fight~[TAG_BLIND_FIGHT] feat doesn't help opponents, since you're ethereal and not merely ~invisible~[TAG_INVISIBLE]. If the attacker can see invisible creatures, the miss chance is only 20%. Likewise, your own attacks have a 20% miss chance, since you sometimes go ethereal just as you are about to strike.  - Any individually targeted spell has a 50% chance to fail against you while you're blinking unless your attacker can target invisible, ethereal creatures. Your own spells have a 20% chance of activating just as you go ethereal, in which case they typically do not affect the Material Plane. Force effects (such as ~Magic Missile~[TAG_SPELLS_MAGIC_MISSILE]) and ~abjurations~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ABJURATION] affect you normally.  - While blinking, you take only half damage from area attacks. You strike as an invisible creature (with a +2 bonus on ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL]), denying your target any ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY] bonus to ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS].
TAG_SPELLS_BLUR:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_BARD_2 T: ~Illusion~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ILLUSION] (Glamer)Level: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 2, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 2Components: VCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: TouchTarget: Creature touchedDuration: 1 min./level (D)Saving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negates (harmless)Spell Resistance: Yes (harmless)The subject's outline appears blurred, shifting, and wavering. This distortion grants the subject ~concealment~[TAG_CONCEALMENT] (20% miss chance). A ~See Invisibility~[TAG_SPELLS_SEE_INVISIBILITY] does not counteract the Blur effect, but a ~True Seeing~[TAG_SPELLS_TRUE_SEEING] spell does. Opponents that cannot see the subject ignore the spell's effect (though fighting an unseen opponent carries penalties of its own).
TAG_SPELLS_BREAK_ENCHANTMENT:TAG_SPELLS:: ~Abjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ABJURATION]Level: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 4, ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 5, ~Domain: Luck~[TAG_LUCK_D] 5, ~Paladin~[TAG_PALADINS] 4, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 5Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 minuteRange: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Targets: Up to one creature per level, all within 30 ft. of each otherDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: See textSpell Resistance: NoThis spell frees victims from ~enchantments~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT], ~transmutations~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_TRANSMUTATION], and curses. Break Enchantment can reverse even an instantaneous effect. For each such effect, you make a ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] check (1d20 + caster level, maximum of +15) against a DC of 11 + caster level of the effect. Success means that the creature is free of the spell, curse, or effect. For a cursed magic item, the DC is 25. If the spell is one that cannot be dispelled by ~Dispel Magic~[TAG_SPELLS_DISPEL_MAGIC], Break Enchantment works only if that level is 5th level or lower. For instance, ~Bestow Curse~[TAG_SPELLS_BESTOW_CURSE] cannot be dispelled by Dispel Magic, but Break Enchantment can dispel it. If the effect comes from some permanent magic item, such as a cursed sword, Break Enchantment does not remove the curse from the item, but it does free the victim from the item's effects. For example, a cursed item can change the alignment of its user. Break Enchantment allows the victim to be rid of the item and negates the alignment change, but the item's curse is intact and affects the next creature to pick up the item--even if it's the recent recipient of the Break Enchantment spell.
TAG_SPELLS_BULL'S_STRENGTH:TAG_SPELLS::T: ~Transmutation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_TRANSMUTATION]Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 2, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 2, ~Paladin~[TAG_PALADINS] 2, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 2, ~Domain: Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH_D] 2Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: TouchTarget: Creature touchedDuration: 1 min./levelSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negates (harmless)Spell Resistance: Yes (harmless)The subject becomes stronger. The spell grants a +4 ~enhancement~[TAG_ENHANCEMENT_BONUS] bonus to ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH], adding the usual benefits to melee ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL], melee damage rolls, and other uses of the Strength modifier.
TAG_SPELLS_BULL'S_STRENGTH_MASS:TAG_SPEL: ~Transmutation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_TRANSMUTATION]Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 6, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 6, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 6Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Targets: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apartThis spell functions like ~Bull's Strength~[TAG_SPELLS_BULL'S_STRENGTH], except that it affects multiple creatures.
TAG_SPELLS_BURNING_HANDS:TAG_SPELLS::TAG: ~Evocation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_EVOCATION] (Fire)Level: ~Domain: Fire~[TAG_FIRE_D] 1, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 1Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: 15 ft.Area: Cone-shaped burstDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: ~Reflex~[TAG_REFLEX] halfSpell Resistance: YesA cone of searing flame shoots from your fingertips. Any creature in the area of the flames takes 1d4 points of fire damage per ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (maximum 5d4).
TAG_SPELLS_CALL_LIGHTNING:TAG_SPELLS::TA: ~Evocation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_EVOCATION] (Electricity)Level: ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 3Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 roundRange: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)Effect: One or more 30-ft.-long vertical lines of lightningDuration: 1 min./levelSaving Throw: ~Reflex~[TAG_REFLEX] halfSpell Resistance: YesImmediately upon completion of the spell, and once per round thereafter, you may call down a 5-foot-wide, 30-foot-long, vertical bolt of lightning that deals 3d6 points of electricity damage. The bolt of lightning flashes down in a vertical stroke at whatever target point you choose within the spell's range (measured from your position at the time). Any creature in the target square or in the path of the bolt is affected. You need not call a bolt of lightning immediately; other actions, even spellcasting, can be performed. However, each round after the first, you may use a standard action (concentrating on the spell) to call a bolt. You may call a total number of bolts equal to your ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (maximum of 10 bolts). If you are outdoors, each bolt deals 3d10 points of electricity damage instead of 3d6. This spell functions indoors or underground.
TAG_SPELLS_CALL_LIGHTNING_STORM:TAG_SPEL: ~Evocation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_EVOCATION] (Electricity)Level: ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 5Range: Long (400 ft. + 40 ft./level)This spell functions like ~Call Lightning~[TAG_SPELLS_CALL_LIGHTNING], except that each bolt deals 5d6 points of electricity damage (or 5d10 if created outdoors), and you may call a maximum of 15 bolts.
TAG_SPELLS_CALM_ANIMALS:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_: ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] (Compulsion) Mind-AffectingLevel: ~Domain: Animal~[TAG_ANIMAL_D] 1, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 1, ~Ranger~[TAG_RANGERS] 1Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Targets: Animals within 30 ft. of each otherDuration: 1 min./levelSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negates; see textSpell Resistance: YesThis spell soothes and quiets animals, rendering them docile and harmless. Only ordinary animals (those with ~Intelligence~[TAG_INTELLIGENCE] scores of 1 or 2) can be affected by this spell. In ToEE, the subjects can be different kinds of animals, but no two may be more than 30 feet apart. The maximum number of Hit Dice of animals you can affect is equal to 2d4 + ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL]. A ~dire~[TAG_MONSTER_DIRE] animal is allowed a ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC]; other animals are not. The affected creatures remain where they are and do not attack or flee. They are not ~helpless~[TAG_HELPLESS] and defend themselves normally if attacked. Any threat (such as fire, a hungry predator, or an imminent attack) breaks the spell on the threatened creatures.
TAG_SPELLS_CALM_EMOTIONS:TAG_SPELLS::TAG: ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] (Compulsion) Mind-AffectingLevel: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 2, ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 2, ~Domain: Law~[TAG_LAW_D] 2Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)Area: Creatures in a 20-ft.-radius spreadDuration: ~Concentration~[TAG_CONCENTRATION], up to 1 round/level (D)Saving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negatesSpell Resistance: YesThis spell calms agitated creatures. You have no control over the affected creatures, but Calm Emotions can stop raging creatures from fighting or joyous ones from reveling. Creatures so affected cannot take violent actions (although they can defend themselves) or do anything destructive. Any aggressive action against or damage dealt to a calmed creature immediately breaks the spell on all calmed creatures. This spell automatically suppresses (but does not dispel) any morale bonuses granted by spells such as ~Bless~[TAG_SPELLS_BLESS], ~Good Hope~[TAG_SPELLS_GOOD_HOPE], and ~Rage~[TAG_SPELLS_RAGE], as well as negating a bard's ability to ~inspire courage~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_BARD_INSPIRE_COURAGE] or a ~barbarian's rage~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_BARBARIAN_RAGE] ability. It also suppresses any ~fear~[TAG_FEAR] effects and removes the ~confused~[TAG_CONFUSED] condition from all targets. While the spell lasts, a suppressed spell or effect has no effect. When the Calm Emotions spell ends, the original spell or effect takes hold of the creature again, provided that its duration has not expired in the meantime.
TAG_SPELLS_CATS_GRACE:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_BA: ~Transmutation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_TRANSMUTATION]Level: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 2, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 2, ~Ranger~[TAG_RANGERS] 2, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 2Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: TouchTarget: Creature touchedDuration: 1 min./levelSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negates (harmless)Spell Resistance: YesThe transmuted creature becomes more graceful, agile, and coordinated. The spell grants a +4 ~enhancement~[TAG_ENHANCEMENT_BONUS] bonus to ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY], adding the usual benefits to ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS], ~Reflex~[TAG_REFLEX] saves, and other uses of the Dexterity modifier.
TAG_SPELLS_CATS_GRACE_MASS:TAG_SPELLS::T: ~Transmutation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_TRANSMUTATION]Level: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 6, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 6, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 6Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Targets: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apartThis spell functions like ~Cat's Grace~[TAG_SPELLS_CATS_GRACE], except that it affects multiple creatures.
TAG_SPELLS_CAUSE_FEAR:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_BA: ~Necromancy~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_NECROMANCY] Fear, Mind-AffectingLevel: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 1, ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 1, ~Domain: Death~[TAG_DEATH_D] 1, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 1Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Target: One living creature with 5 or fewer HDDuration: 1d4 rounds (if saving throw is failed) or 1 round (if saving throw is successful)Saving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] partialSpell Resistance: YesThe affected creature becomes ~frightened~[TAG_FRIGHTENED]. If the subject succeeds on a Will save, it is ~shaken~[TAG_SHAKEN] for 1 round.  Creatures with 6 or more HD are immune to this effect. Cause Fear counters and dispels ~Remove Fear~[TAG_SPELLS_REMOVE_FEAR].
TAG_SPELLS_CHAIN_LIGHTNING:TAG_SPELLS::T: ~Evocation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_EVOCATION] (Electricity)Level: ~Domain: Air~[TAG_AIR_D] 6, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 6Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Long (400 ft. + 40 ft./level)Targets: One primary target, plus one secondary target/level (each of which must be within 30 ft. of the primary target)Duration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: ~Reflex~[TAG_REFLEX] halfSpell Resistance: YesThis spell creates an electrical discharge that begins as a single stroke commencing from your fingertips. Unlike ~Lightning Bolt~[TAG_SPELLS_LIGHTNING_BOLT], Chain Lightning strikes one object or creature initially, then arcs to other targets. The bolt deals 1d6 points of electricity damage per ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (maximum 20d6) to the primary target. After it strikes, lightning can arc to a number of secondary targets equal to your caster level (maximum 20). The secondary bolts each strike one target and deal half as much damage as the primary one did (rounded down). Each target can attempt a Reflex ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] for half damage. You choose secondary targets as you like, but they must all be within 30 feet of the primary target, and no target can be struck more than once. You can choose to affect fewer secondary targets than the maximum (to avoid allies in the area, for example).
TAG_SPELLS_CHAOS_HAMMER:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_: ~Evocation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_EVOCATION] (Chaotic)Level: ~Domain: Chaos~[TAG_CHAOS_D] 4Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)Area: 20-ft. radius burstDuration: Instantaneous (1d6 rounds); see textSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] partial; see textSpell Resistance: YesYou unleash chaotic power to smite your enemies. The power takes the form of a multicolored explosion of leaping, ricocheting energy. Only lawful and neutral (not chaotic) creatures are harmed by the spell. The spell deals 1d8 points of damage per two ~caster levels~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (maximum 5d8) to lawful creatures (or 1d6 points of damage per caster level, maximum 10d6, to lawful outsiders) and slows them down for 1d6 rounds (see the ~Slow~[TAG_SPELLS_SLOW] spell). A successful Will save reduces the damage by half and negates the Slow effect. The spell deals only half damage against creatures who are neither lawful nor chaotic, and they are not slowed. Such a creature can reduce the damage by half again (down to one-quarter) with a successful Will save.
TAG_SPELLS_CHARM_ANIMAL:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_: ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] (Charm) Mind-AffectingLevel: ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 1, ~Ranger~[TAG_RANGERS] 1Target: One animalThis spell functions like ~Charm Person~[TAG_SPELLS_CHARM_PERSON], except that it only affects creatures of the animal type.
TAG_SPELLS_CHARM_MONSTER:TAG_SPELLS::TAG: ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] (Charm) Mind-AffectingLevel: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 3, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 4Target: One living creatureDuration: One day/levelThis spell functions like ~Charm Person~[TAG_SPELLS_CHARM_PERSON], except that the effect is not restricted by creature type or ~size~[TAG_SIZE_MODIFIER].
TAG_SPELLS_CHARM_MONSTER_MASS:TAG_SPELLS: ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] (Charm) Mind-AffectingLevel: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 6, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 8Target: One or more creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apartDuration: One day/levelThis spell functions like ~Charm Monster~[TAG_SPELLS_CHARM_MONSTER], except that Mass Charm Monster affects a number of creatures whose combined HD do not exceed twice your level, or at least one creature regardless of HD.
TAG_SPELLS_CHARM_PERSON:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_: ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] (Charm) Mind-AffectingLevel: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 1, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 1Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Target: One humanoid creatureDuration: 1 hour/levelSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negatesSpell Resistance: YesThis ~charm~[TAG_CHARMED] makes a humanoid creature regard you as its trusted friend and ally. It perceives your words and actions in the most favorable way. If the charmed creature is attacked while under the influence of Charm Person, the spell is immediately broken.
TAG_SPELLS_CHILL_METAL:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_D: ~Transmutation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_TRANSMUTATION] (Cold)Level: ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 2Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Target: Metal equipment of one creature per two levels, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apartDuration: 7 roundsSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negates (object)Spell Resistance: Yes (object)Chill Metal makes metal extremely cold. Unattended, nonmagical metal gets no saving throw. Magical metal is allowed a ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] against the spell. An item in the creature's possession uses the creature's saving throw bonus unless its own is higher. In ToEE, only a creature wearing metal armor is affected by this spell. A creature takes cold damage if its equipment is chilled. It takes full damage if its armor is affected. The creature takes minimum damage (1 point or 2 points) if it's not wearing metal armor. First round of the spell: The metal becomes chilly and uncomfortable to the touch but deals no damage. The same effect also occurs on the last round of the spell's duration. Second (and also the next-to-last) round: Icy coldness causes pain and damage (1d4 points of damage). Third, fourth, and fifth rounds: The metal is freezing cold, causing more damage (2d4 points of damage). Any heat intense enough to damage the creature negates cold damage from the spell (and vice versa) on a point-for-point basis. For example, if the damage roll from a Chill Metal spell indicates 5 points of cold damage and the subject plunges through a fire spell in the same round and takes 10 points of damage, it winds up taking no cold damage and only 5 points of fire damage. Chill Metal counters and dispels ~Heat Metal~[TAG_SPELLS_HEAT_METAL].
TAG_SPELLS_CHILL_TOUCH:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_S: ~Necromancy~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_NECROMANCY]Level: ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 1Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: TouchTargets: Creature or creatures touched (up to one/level)Duration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] partial or ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negates; see textSpell Resistance: YesA touch from your hand, which glows with blue energy, disrupts the life force of living creatures. Each touch channels negative energy that deals 1d6 points of damage. The touched creature also takes 1 point of ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH] damage unless it makes a successful Fortitude saving throw. You can use this melee ~touch attack~[TAG_TOUCH_ATTACK] up to one time per level. An undead creature you touch takes no damage of either sort, but it must make a successful Will ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] or flee as if ~panicked~[TAG_PANICKED] for 1d4 rounds +1 round per ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL].
TAG_SPELLS_CIRCLE_OF_DEATH:TAG_SPELLS::T: ~Necromancy~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_NECROMANCY] (Death)Level: ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 6Components: V, S, MCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)Area: Several living creatures within a 40-ft.-radius burstDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] negatesSpell Resistance: YesA Circle of Death snuffs out the life force of living creatures, killing them instantly. The spell slays 1d4 HD worth of living creatures per ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (maximum 20d4). Creatures with the fewest HD are affected first; among creatures with equal HD, those who are closest to the burst's point of origin are affected first. No creature of 9 or more HD can be affected, and Hit Dice that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted. Material Component: The powder of a crushed black pearl with a minimum value of 500 gp.
TAG_SPELLS_CLAIRAUDIENCE_CLAIRVOYANCE:TA: ~Divination~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_DIVINATION] (Scrying)Level: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 3, ~Domain: Knowledge~[TAG_KNOWLEDGE_D] 3, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 3Components: V, SCasting Time: 10 minutesRange: Long (400 ft. + 40 ft./level)Effect: Magical sensorDuration: 1 min./level (D)Saving Throw: NoneSpell Resistance: NoClairaudience/Clairvoyance creates an invisible magical sensor at a specific location that enables you to hear or see (your choice) almost as if you were there. You don't need line of sight or line of effect, but the locale must be known--a place familiar to you or an obvious one. Once you have selected the locale, the sensor doesn't move. Clairaudience/Clairvoyance functions only on the plane of existence you are currently occupying.
TAG_SPELLS_CLOUDKILL:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_SOR: ~Conjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_CONJURATION] (Creation)Level: ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 5Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)Effect: Cloud spreads in 20-ft. radius, 20 ft. highDuration: 1 min./levelSaving Throw: ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] partial; see textSpell Resistance: NoThis spell generates a bank of fog, similar to a ~Fog Cloud~[TAG_SPELLS_FOG_CLOUD], except that its vapors are yellowish green and poisonous. 3 or fewer HD creatures: Automatically killed (no save). 4 to 6 HD creatures: Are slain unless they succeed on making a Fortitude save (in which case they take 1d4 points of ~Constitution~[TAG_CONSTITUTION] damage on your turn each round while in the cloud). 6 or more HD creatures: Take 1d4 points of Constitution damage on their turn each round while in the cloud (a successful Fortitude save halves this damage). Holding one's breath doesn't help, but creatures immune to ~poison~[TAG_POISON] are unaffected by the spell.
TAG_SPELLS_COLOR_SPRAY:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_S: ~Illusion~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ILLUSION] (Pattern) Mind-AffectingLevel: ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 1Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: 15 ft.Area: Cone-shaped burstDuration: Instantaneous; see textSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negatesSpell Resistance: YesA vivid cone of clashing colors springs forth from your hand, causing creatures to become ~stunned~[TAG_STUNNED], perhaps also ~blinded~[TAG_BLINDED], and possibly knocking them ~unconscious~[TAG_UNCONSCIOUS]. Each creature within the cone is affected according to its Hit Dice.2 HD or less: The creature is unconscious, blinded, and stunned for 2d4 rounds, then blinded and stunned for 1d4 rounds, and then stunned for 1 round. (Only living creatures are knocked unconscious.)3 or 4 HD: The creature is blinded and stunned for 1d4 rounds, then stunned for 1 round.5 or more HD: The creature is stunned for 1 round. Sightless creatures are not affected by Color Spray.
TAG_SPELLS_COMMAND:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_CLERI: ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] (Compulsion) Language-Dependent, Mind-AffectingLevel: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 1Components: VCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Target: One living creatureDuration: 1 roundSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negatesSpell Resistance: YesYou give the subject a single command, which it obeys to the best of its ability at its earliest opportunity. You may select from the following options.Approach: On its turn, the subject moves toward you as quickly and directly as possible for 1 round. The creature may do nothing but move during its turn, and it provokes ~attacks of opportunity~[TAG_AOO] for this movement as usual.Fall: On its turn, the subject falls to the ground and remains ~prone~[TAG_PRONE] for 1 round. It may act normally while prone but takes any appropriate penalties.Flee: On its turn, the subject moves away from you as quickly as possible for 1 round. It may do nothing but move during its turn, and it provokes attacks of opportunity for this movement as normal.Halt: The subject stands in place for 1 round. It may not take any actions but it is not considered ~helpless~[TAG_HELPLESS].
TAG_SPELLS_COMMAND_GREATER:TAG_SPELLS::T: ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] (Compulsion) Language-Dependent, Mind-AffectingLevel: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 5Targets: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apartDuration: 1 round/levelThis spell functions like ~Command~[TAG_SPELLS_COMMAND], except that up to one creature per level may be affected, and the activities continue beyond 1 round. At the start of each commanded creature's action after the first, it gets another ~Will~[TAG_WILL] save to attempt to break free from the spell. Each creature must receive the same command.
TAG_SPELLS_CONE_OF_COLD:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_: ~Evocation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_EVOCATION] (Cold)Level: ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 5, ~Domain: Water~[TAG_WATER_D] 6Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: 60 ft.Area: Cone-shaped burstDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: ~Reflex~[TAG_REFLEX] halfSpell Resistance: YesCone of Cold creates an area of extreme cold, originating at your hand and extending outward in a cone. It drains heat, dealing 1d6 points of cold damage per ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (maximum 15d6).
TAG_SPELLS_CONFUSION:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_BAR: ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] (Compulsion) Mind-AffectingLevel: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 3, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 4, ~Domain: Trickery~[TAG_TRICKERY_D] 4Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)Targets: All creatures in a 15-ft. radius burstDuration: 1 round/levelSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negatesSpell Resistance: YesThis spell causes the targets to become ~confused~[TAG_CONFUSED], making them unable to independently determine what they will do. Roll on the following table at the beginning of each subject's turn each round to see what the subject does in that round.d%             Behavior01-10     @tAttack caster with melee or ranged weapons (or close                     with caster if attack is not possible).11-20     @tAct normally.21-50     @tDo nothing but babble incoherently.51-70     @tFlee away from caster at top possible speed.71-100     @tAttack nearest creature (for this purpose, a ~familiar~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_CALL_FAMILIAR]                     counts as part of the subject's self). A confused character who can't carry out the indicated action does nothing but babble incoherently. Attackers are not at any special advantage when attacking a confused character. Note that a confused character will not make ~attacks of opportunity~[TAG_AOO] against any creature that it is not already devoted to attacking (either because of its most recent action or because it has just been attacked).
TAG_SPELLS_CONFUSION_LESSER:TAG_SPELLS::: ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] (Compulsion) Mind-AffectingLevel: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 1Components: V, SRange: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Target: One living creatureDuration: 1 roundThis spell causes a single creature to become ~confused~[TAG_CONFUSED] for 1 round. See the ~Confusion~[TAG_SPELLS_CONFUSION] spell to determine the exact effect on the subject.
TAG_SPELLS_CONSECRATE:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_CL: ~Evocation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_EVOCATION] (Good)Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 2Components: V, S, MCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Area: 20-ft-radius emanationDuration: 2 hours/levelSaving Throw: NoneSpell Resistance: NoThis spell blesses an area with positive energy. Each ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA] check made to turn undead within this area gains a +3 sacred bonus. Every undead creature entering a consecrated area suffers minor disruption, giving it a -1 penalty on ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL], damage rolls, and saves. Undead cannot be created within or summoned into a consecrated area. If the consecrated area contains an altar, shrine, or other permanent fixture dedicated to your deity, pantheon, or aligned higher power, the modifiers given above are doubled (+6 sacred bonus on turning checks, -2 penalties for undead in the area). You cannot consecrate an area with a similar fixture of a deity other than your own patron. Consecrate counters and dispels ~Desecrate~[TAG_SPELLS_DESECRATE]. Material Component: A vial of holy water and 25 gp worth (5 pounds) of silver dust, all of which must be sprinkled around the area.
TAG_SPELLS_CONTAGION:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_CLE: ~Necromancy~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_NECROMANCY] (Evil)Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 3, ~Domain: Destruction~[TAG_DESTRUCTION_D] 3, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 3, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 4Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: TouchTarget: Living creature touchedDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] negatesSpell Resistance: YesThe subject contracts a ~disease~[TAG_DISEASED] selected from the table below, which strikes immediately (no incubation period). The DC noted is for the subsequent saves (use Contagion's normal save DC for the initial saving throw).Disease DCs, Damage, and DescriptionsDisease                    DC          DamageBlinding Sickness @t16        @t1d4 ~Str~[TAG_STRENGTH]Cackle fever          @t16        @t1d6 ~Wis~[TAG_WISDOM]Filth fever           @t12        @t1d3 ~Dex~[TAG_DEXTERITY] and 1d3 ~Con~[TAG_CONSTITUTION]Mindfire              @t12        @t1d4 ~Int~[TAG_INTELLIGENCE]Red ache              @t15        @t1d6 StrShakes                  @t13        @t1d8 DexSlimy doom            @t14        @t1d4 Con Blinding Sickness: Spread in tainted water. Cackle Fever: Symptoms include high fever, disorientation, and frequent bouts of hideous laugher. Also known as the "shrieks". Filth Fever: ~Dire Rats~[TAG_MONSTER_DIRE_RAT] and ~Otyughs~[TAG_MONSTER_OTYUGH] spread it. Those injured while in filthy surroundings might also catch it. Mindfire: Feels like your brain is burning. Causes stupor. Red Ache: Skin turns red, bloated, and warm to the touch. The Shakes: Causes involuntary twitches, tremors, and fits. Slimy Doom: Victim turns into infectious goo from the inside out. Can cause permanent ~ability drain~[TAG_ABILITY_DRAINED].
TAG_SPELLS_CONTROL_PLANTS:TAG_SPELLS::TA: ~Transmutation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_TRANSMUTATION]Level: ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 8, ~Domain: Plant~[TAG_PLANT_D] 8Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Targets: Up to 2 HD/level of plant creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apartDuration: 1 min./levelSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negatesSpell Resistance: NoThis spell enables you to ~charm~[TAG_CHARMED] one or more plant creatures for a short period of time. You can question the plants as to whether or not any creatures have passed through recently, and gain a ~tracking~[TAG_TRACK] bonus of +10. Non-plant enemies in the area of effect are subject to ~entanglement~[TAG_ENTANGLED], and since the plants are now friendly, you and your allies are not affected by this. At the end of the spell's duration, the charmed plants revert to their normal behavior.
TAG_SPELLS_CONTROL_UNDEAD:TAG_SPELLS::TA: ~Necromancy~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_NECROMANCY]Level: ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 7Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Targets: Up to 2 HD/level of undead creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apartDuration: 1 min/levelSaving Thow: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negatesSpell Resistance: YesThis spell enables you to command undead creatures for a short period of time. You command them by voice and they understand you, no matter what language you speak. Even if vocal communication is impossible the controlled undead do not attack you. At the end of the spell, the subjects revert to their normal behavior. Intelligent undead creatures remember that you controlled them.
TAG_SPELLS_CRUSHING_DESPAIR:TAG_SPELLS::: ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] (Compulsion) Mind-AffectingLevel: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 3, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 4Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: 30 ft.Area: Cone-shaped burstDuration: 1 min./levelSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negatesSpell Resistance: YesAn invisible cone of despair causes great sadness in the subjects. Each affected creatures takes a -2 penalty on ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL], ~saving throws~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC], ability checks, ~skill checks~[TAG_USING_SKILLS], and weapon damage rolls. Crushing Despair counters and dispels ~Good Hope~[TAG_SPELLS_GOOD_HOPE].
TAG_SPELLS_CURE_CRITICAL_WOUNDS:TAG_SPEL: ~Conjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_CONJURATION] (Healing)Level: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 4, ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 4, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 5, ~Domain: Healing~[TAG_HEALING_D] 4This spell functions like ~Cure Light Wounds~[TAG_SPELLS_CURE_LIGHT_WOUNDS], except that it cures 4d8 points of damage +1 point per ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (maximum +20).
TAG_SPELLS_CURE_CRITICAL_WOUNDS_MASS:TAG: ~Conjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_CONJURATION] (Healing)Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 8, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 9, ~Domain: Healing~[TAG_HEALING_D] 8This spell functions like ~Cure Light Wounds, Mass~[TAG_SPELLS_CURE_LIGHT_WOUNDS_MASS], except that it cures 4d8 points of damage +1 point per ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (maximum +40).
TAG_SPELLS_CURE_LIGHT_WOUNDS:TAG_SPELLS:: ~Conjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_CONJURATION] (Healing)Level: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 1, ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 1, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 1, ~Domain: Healing~[TAG_HEALING_D] 1, ~Paladin~[TAG_PALADINS] 1, ~Ranger~[TAG_RANGERS] 2Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: TouchTarget: Creature touchedDuration: Instantaneous Saving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] half (harmless); see textSpell Resistance: Yes (harmless); see textWhen laying your hand upon a living creature, you channel positive energy that cures 1d8 points of damage +1 point per ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (maximum +5). Since undead are powered by negative energy, this spell deals damage to them instead of curing their wounds. An undead creature can apply ~spell resistance~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_SPELL_RESISTANCE], and can attempt a Will save to take half damage.
TAG_SPELLS_CURE_LIGHT_WOUNDS_MASS:TAG_SP: ~Conjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_CONJURATION] (Healing)Level: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 5, ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 5, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 6, ~Domain: Healing~[TAG_HEALING_D] 5Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Target: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apartDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] half (harmless) or Will half; see textSpell Resistance: Yes (harmless) or Yes; see textYou channel positive energy to cure 1d8 points of damage +1 per ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (maximum +25) in each selected creature. Like other cure spells, Mass Cure Light Wounds deals damage to undead in its area rather than curing them. Each affected undead may attempt a Will save for half damage.
TAG_SPELLS_CURE_MINOR_WOUNDS:TAG_SPELLS:: ~Conjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_CONJURATION] (Healing)Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 0, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 0This spells functions like ~Cure Light Wounds~[TAG_SPELLS_CURE_LIGHT_WOUNDS], except that it cures only 1 point of damage.
TAG_SPELLS_CURE_MODERATE_WOUNDS:TAG_SPEL: ~Conjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_CONJURATION] (Healing)Level: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 2, ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 2, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 3, ~Domain: Healing~[TAG_HEALING_D] 2, ~Paladin~[TAG_PALADINS] 3, ~Ranger~[TAG_RANGERS] 3This spell functions like ~Cure Light Wounds~[TAG_SPELLS_CURE_LIGHT_WOUNDS], except that it cures 2d8 points of damage +1 point per ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (maximum +10).
TAG_SPELLS_CURE_MODERATE_WOUNDS_MASS:TAG: ~Conjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_CONJURATION] (Healing)Level: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 6, ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 6, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 7This spell functions like ~Cure Light Wounds, Mass~[TAG_SPELLS_CURE_LIGHT_WOUNDS_MASS], except that it cures 2d8 points of damage +1 point per ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (maximum +30).
TAG_SPELLS_CURE_SERIOUS_WOUNDS:TAG_SPELL: ~Conjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_CONJURATION] (Healing)Level: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 3, ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 3, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 4, ~Domain: Healing~[TAG_HEALING_D] 3, ~Paladin~[TAG_PALADINS] 4, ~Ranger~[TAG_RANGERS] 4This spell functions like ~Cure Light Wounds~[TAG_SPELLS_CURE_LIGHT_WOUNDS], except that it cures 3d8 points of damage +1 per ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (maximum +15).
TAG_SPELLS_CURE_SERIOUS_WOUNDS_MASS:TAG_: ~Conjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_CONJURATION] (Healing)Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 7, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 8This spell functions like ~Cure Light Wounds, Mass~[TAG_SPELLS_CURE_LIGHT_WOUNDS_MASS], except that it cures 3d8 points of damage +1 point per ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (maximum +35).
TAG_SPELLS_CURSE_WATER:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_C: ~Necromancy~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_NECROMANCY] (Evil)Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 1Components: V, S, MCasting Time: 1 minuteRange: TouchTarget: Flask of water touchedDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negates (object)Spell Resistance: Yes (object)This spell imbues a flask (1 pint) of water with negative energy, turning it into ~unholy water~[TAG_UNHOLY_WATER]. Unholy water damages good outsiders the way holy water damages undead and evil outsiders. In ToEE, a flask of unholy water is directly summoned into your ~inventory~[TAG_HMU_CHAR_INVENTORY_UI]. Material Component: 5 pounds of powdered silver (worth 25 gp)
TAG_SPELLS_DAZE:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_BARD_0 T: ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] (Compulsion) Mind-AffectingLevel: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 0, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 0Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Target: One humanoid creature of 4 HD or lessDuration: 1 roundSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negatesSpell Resistance: YesThis enchantment clouds the mind of a humanoid creature with 4 or fewer Hit Dice so that it takes no actions. Humanoids of 5 or more HD are not affected. A ~dazed~[TAG_DAZED] subject is not ~stunned~[TAG_STUNNED], so attackers get no special advantage against it.
TAG_SPELLS_DAZE_MONSTER:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_: ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] (Compulsion) Mind-AffectingLevel: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 2, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 2Range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)Target: One living creature of 6 HD or lessThis spell functions like ~Daze~[TAG_SPELLS_DAZE], but Daze Monster can affect any one living creature of any type. Creatures of 7 or more Hit Dice are not affected.
TAG_SPELLS_DEATH_KNELL:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_C: ~Necromancy~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_NECROMANCY] (Death, Evil)Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 2, ~Domain: Death~[TAG_DEATH_D] 2Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: TouchTarget: Living creature touchedDuration: Instantaneous/10 minutes per HD of subject; see textSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negatesSpell Resistance: YesYou draw forth the ebbing life force of a creature and use it to fuel your own power. Upon casting this spell you touch a living creature that has -1 or fewer ~hit points~[TAG_HIT_POINTS]. If the subject fails its ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC], it dies, and you gain 1d8 ~temporary hit points~[TAG_TEMPORARY_HIT_POINTS] and a +2 bonus to ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH]. Additionally, your effective ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] goes up by +1, improving spell effects dependent on caster level. (This increase in effective caster level does not grant you access to more spells.) These effects last for 10 minutes per HD of the subject creature.
TAG_SPELLS_DEATH_WARD:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_CL: ~Necromancy~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_NECROMANCY]Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 4, ~Domain: Death~[TAG_DEATH_D] 4, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 5, ~Paladin~[TAG_PALADINS] 4Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: TouchTarget: Living creature touchedDuration: 1 min./levelSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negates (harmless)Spell Resistance: Yes (harmless)The subject is immune to all death spells, magical death effects, energy drain, and any negative energy effects (such as from inflict spells or ~Chill Touch~[TAG_SPELLS_CHILL_TOUCH]). This spell doesn't remove ~negative levels~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_ENERGY_DRAIN_AND_NEGATIVE_LEVELS] that the subject has already gained, nor does it affect the ~saving throw~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] necessary 24 hours after gaining a negative level. Death Ward does not protect against other sorts of attacks, such as ~hit point~[TAG_HIT_POINTS] loss, ~poison~[TAG_POISON], or petrification, even if those attacks might be lethal.
TAG_SPELLS_DEEP_SLUMBER:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_: ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] (Compulsion) Mind-AffectingLevel: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 3, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 3Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)This spell functions like ~Sleep~[TAG_SPELLS_SLEEP], except that it affects 10 HD of creatures.
TAG_SPELLS_DELAY_POISON:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_: ~Conjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_CONJURATION] (Healing)Level: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 2, ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 2, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 2, ~Paladin~[TAG_PALADINS] 2, ~Ranger~[TAG_RANGERS] 1Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: TouchTarget: Creature touchedDuration: 1 hour/levelSaving Throw: ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] negates (harmless)Spell Resistance: Yes (harmless)The subject becomes temporarily immune to ~poison~[TAG_POISON]. Any poison in its system or any poison to which it is exposed during the spell's duration does not affect the subject until it has expired. Delay Poison does not cure any damage that poison may have already done.
TAG_SPELLS_DELAYED_BLAST_FIREBALL:TAG_SP: ~Evocation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_EVOCATION] (Fire)Level: ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 7Duration: 5 rounds or less; see textThis spell functions like ~Fireball~[TAG_SPELLS_FIREBALL], except that it is more powerful and can detonate up to 5 rounds after the spell is cast. The burst of flame deals 1d6 points of fire damage per ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (maximum 20d6). Delayed Blast Fireball can detonate immediately if you desire, or you can choose to delay the burst for as many as 5 rounds.  Co8 Note: The delay can only be set from outside the game via the front end utility, ToEE Front-End X (TFE-X). To set the number of rounds to delay, select "Delayed Blast Fireball Delay" from the Options menu and select a number from 0 to 5 turns. You can change this value as often as you like to suit your needs. The default is 1 turn.
TAG_SPELLS_DESECRATE:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_CLE: ~Evocation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_EVOCATION] (Evil)Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 2, ~Domain: Evil~[TAG_EVIL_D] 2Components: V, S, MCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Area: 20-ft.-radius emanationDuration: 2 hours/levelSaving Throw: NoneSpell Resistance: YesThis spell imbues an area with negative energy. Each ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA] check made to turn undead within this area takes a -3 profane penalty, and every undead creature entering a desecrated area gains a +1 profane bonus on ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL], damage rolls, and saving throws. An undead creature created within or summoned into such an area gains +1 ~hit point~[TAG_HIT_POINTS] per HD. If the desecrated area contains an altar, shrine, or other permanent fixture dedicated to your deity or aligned higher power, the modifiers given above are doubled (-6 profane penalty on turning checks, +2 profane bonus and +2 hit points per HD for undead in the area). Desecrate counters and dispels ~Consecrate~[TAG_SPELLS_CONSECRATE]. Material Component: A vial of unholy water and 25 gp worth (5 pounds) of silver dust, all of which must be sprinkled around the area.
TAG_SPELLS_DESTRUCTION:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_C: ~Necromancy~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_NECROMANCY] (Death)Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 7, ~Domain: Death~[TAG_DEATH_D] 7Components: V, S, FCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Target: One creatureDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] partialSpell Resistance: YesThis spell instantly slays the subject and consumes its remains (but not its equipment and possessions) utterly. If the target's Fortitude saving throw succeeds, it instead takes 10d6 points of damage. Focus: A special holy (or unholy) symbol of silver marked with verses of anathema (cost 500 gp).
TAG_SPELLS_DETECT_CHAOS:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_: ~Divination~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_DIVINATION]Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 1This spell functions like ~Detect Evil~[TAG_SPELLS_DETECT_EVIL], except that it detects the auras of chaotic creatures.
TAG_SPELLS_DETECT_EVIL:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_C: ~Divination~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_DIVINATION]Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 1Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: 60 ft.Area: Cone-shaped emanationDuration: Concentration, up to 10 min./level (D)Saving Throw: NoneSpell Resistance: NoYou can sense the presence of evil. This spell examines every creature within its radius and determines their ~alignment~[TAG_ALIGNMENT]. If a creature's alignment is evil, then the spellcaster is able to detect it and the creature will light up.
TAG_SPELLS_DETECT_GOOD:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_C: ~Divination~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_DIVINATION]Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 1This spell functions like ~Detect Evil~[TAG_SPELLS_DETECT_EVIL], except that it detects the auras of good creatures.
TAG_SPELLS_DETECT_LAW:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_CL: ~Divination~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_DIVINATION]Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 1This spell functions like ~Detect Evil~[TAG_SPELLS_DETECT_EVIL], except that it detects the auras of lawful creatures.
TAG_SPELLS_DETECT_MAGIC:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_: ~Divination~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_DIVINATION]Level: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 0, ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 0, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 0, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 0Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: 60 ft.Area: Cone-shaped emanationDuration: Concentration, up to 1 min./level (D)Saving Throw: NoneSpell Resistance: NoYou detect magical auras. The amount of information revealed depends upon how long you study a particular area or subject.
TAG_SPELLS_DETECT_SECRET_DOORS:TAG_SPELL: ~Divination~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_DIVINATION]Level: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 1, ~Domain: Knowledge~[TAG_KNOWLEDGE_D] 1, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 1Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: 60 ft.Area: Cone-shaped emanationDuration: Concentration, up to 1 min./level (D)Saving Throw: NoneSpell Resistance: NoYou can detect secret doors, compartments, caches, and so forth. Only passages, doors, or openings that have been specifically constructed to escape detection are detected by this spell--an ordinary trapdoor underneath a pile of crates would not be detected. The amount of information revealed depends upon how long you study a particular area or subject.
TAG_SPELLS_DETECT_UNDEAD:TAG_SPELLS::TAG: ~Divination~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_DIVINATION]Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 1, ~Paladin~[TAG_PALADINS] 1, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 1Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: 60 ft.Area: Cone-shaped emanationDuration: Concentration, up to 1 min./level (D)Saving Throw: NoneSpell Resistance: NoYou can detect the aura that surrounds undead creatures. The amount of information revealed depends upon how long you study a particular area.Aura Strength: The strength of an undead aura is determined by the HD of the undead creature, as given on the following table.HD                     Strength4 or lower      Moderate5-10                  Strong11 or higher    OverwhelmingLingering Aura: An undead aura lingers after its original source is destroyed. If detect undead is cast and directed at such a location, the spell indicates an aura strength of dim (even weaker than a faint aura). How long the aura lingers at this dim level depends upon its original power.
TAG_SPELLS_DICTUM:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_CLERIC: ~Evocation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_EVOCATION] (Lawful, Sonic)Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] ~7~[TAG_CLERIC_7], ~Domain: Law~[TAG_LAW_D] 7Components: VCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: 40 ft.Area: Nonlawful creatures in a 40-ft. radius spread centered on youDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: None or ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negates; see textSpell Resistance: YesAny nonlawful creature within the area that hears the dictum suffers the following ill effects. HD equal to caster level: DeafenedHD up to caster level - 1: Slowed, deafenedHD up to caster level -5: Paralyzed, slowed, deafenedHD up to caster level -10: Killed, paralyzed, slowed, deafenedThe effects are cumulative and concurrent. No saving throw is allowed against these effects.DeafenedThe creature is ~deafened~[TAG_DEAFENED] for 1d4 rounds.SlowedThe creature is slowed, as by the ~slow~[TAG_SPELLS_SLOW] spell, for 2d4 rounds.ParalyzedThe creature is ~paralyzed~[TAG_PARALYZED] and ~helpless~[TAG_HELPLESS] for 1d10 minutes.KilledLiving creatures die. Undead creatures are destroyed.Furthermore, if you are on your home plane when you cast this spell, nonlawful extraplanar creatures within the area are instantly banished back to their home planes. Creatures so banished cannot return for at least 24 hours. This effect takes place regardless of whether the creatures hear the dictum. The banishment effect allows a Will save (at a -4 penalty) to negate. Creatures whose HD exceed your caster level are unaffected by Dictum.
TAG_SPELLS_DIMENSION_DOOR:TAG_SPELLS::TA: ~Conjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_CONJURATION] (Teleportation)Level: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 4, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 4, ~Domain: Travel~[TAG_TRAVEL_D] 4Components: VCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Long (400 ft. + 40 ft./level)Target: You and touched objects or other touched willing creatures.Duration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: None and ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negates (object)Spell Resistance: No and Yes (object)You instantly transfer yourself from your current location to any other spot within range. You arrive at the spot you selected, provided you could have arrived there through nonmagical means, i.e., you can use Dimension Door to move into the next room but not into solid rock. After using this spell, you can't take any other actions until your next turn.
TAG_SPELLS_DIMENSIONAL_ANCHOR:TAG_SPELLS: ~Abjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ABJURATION]Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 4, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 4Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)Effect: RayDuration: 1 min./levelSaving Throw: NoneSpell Resistance: Yes (object)A green ray springs from your outstretched hand. You must make a ranged ~touch attack~[TAG_TOUCH_ATTACK] to hit the target. Any creature or object struck by the ray is covered with a shimmering emerald field that completely blocks bodily extradimensional travel. Forms of movement barred by a Dimensional Anchor include ~Blink~[TAG_SPELLS_BLINK], ~Dimension Door~[TAG_SPELLS_DIMENSION_DOOR], ~Teleport~[TAG_SPELLS_TELEPORT], and similar spell-like or psionic abilities. Dimensional Anchor does not prevent summoned creatures from disappearing at the end of a summoning spell.
TAG_SPELLS_DISCERN_LIES:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_: ~Divination~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_DIVINATION]Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 4, ~Paladin~[TAG_PALADINS] 3Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Target: One creature/level, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apartDuration: ~Concentration~[TAG_CONCENTRATION], up to 1 round/levelSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negatesSpell Resistance: NoIn ToEE, Discern Lies gives the recipient of the spell a +30 bonus to ~Sense Motive~[TAG_SENSE_MOTIVE] checks. This allows you to determine if the subject deliberately and knowingly speaks a lie.
TAG_SPELLS_DISINTEGRATE:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_: ~Transmutation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_TRANSMUTATION]Level: ~Domain: Destruction~[TAG_DESTRUCTION_D] 7, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 6Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)Effect: RayDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] partial (object)Spell Resistance: YesA thin, green ray springs from your pointing finger. You must make a successful ranged ~touch attack~[TAG_TOUCH_ATTACK] to hit. Any creature struck by the ray takes 2d6 points of damage per ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (to a maximum of 40d6). Any creature reduced to 0 or fewer ~hit points~[TAG_HIT_POINTS] by this spell is entirely disintegrated, leaving behind only a trace of fine dust. A disintegrated creature's equipment is unaffected. A creature or object that makes a successful Fortitude save is partially affected, taking only 5d6 points of damage. If this damage reduces the creature or object to 0 or fewer hit points, it is entirely disintegrated.
TAG_SPELLS_DISMISSAL:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_CLE: ~Abjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ABJURATION]Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 4, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 5Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Target: One extraplanar creatureDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negates; see textSpell Resistance: YesThis spell forces an extraplanar creature back to its proper plane if it fails a special Will save (DC = spell's save DC - creature's HD + your ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL]). If the spell is successful, the creature is instantly whisked away.
TAG_SPELLS_DISPEL_AIR:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_AI: ~Abjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ABJURATION]Level: ~Domain: Air~[TAG_AIR_D] 4, ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 5This spell functions like ~Dispel Evil~[TAG_SPELLS_DISPEL_EVIL], except that you are surrounded by a wispy white, elemental energy, and the spell affects air creatures and spells rather than evil ones.
TAG_SPELLS_DISPEL_CHAOS:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_: ~Abjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ABJURATION] (Lawful)Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 5, ~Domain: Law~[TAG_LAW_D] 5, ~Paladin~[TAG_PALADINS] 4This spell functions like ~Dispel Evil~[TAG_SPELLS_DISPEL_EVIL], except that you are surrounded by a constant blue, lawful energy, and the spell affects chaotic creatures and spells rather than evil ones.
TAG_SPELLS_DISPEL_EARTH:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_: ~Abjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ABJURATION]Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 5, ~Domain: Earth~[TAG_EARTH_D] 4This spell functions like ~Dispel Evil~[TAG_SPELLS_DISPEL_EVIL], except that you are surrounded by a dusty red, elemental energy, and the spell affects earth creatures and spells rather than evil ones.
TAG_SPELLS_DISPEL_EVIL:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_C: ~Abjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ABJURATION] (Good)Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 5, ~Domain: Good~[TAG_GOOD_DOMAIN] 5, ~Paladin~[TAG_PALADINS] 4Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: TouchTarget or Targets: You and a touched evil creature from another plane; or you and an enchantment or evil spell on a touched creature or objectDuration: 1 round/level or until discharged, whichever comes firstSaving Throw: See textSpell Resistance: See textShimmering, white, holy energy surrounds you. This power has three effects. First, you will gain a +4 ~deflection~[TAG_DEFLECTION_BONUS] bonus to ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS] attacks by evil creatures. Second, on making a successful melee ~touch attack~[TAG_TOUCH_ATTACK] against an evil creature from another plane, you will drive that creature back to its home plane. The creature can negate the effects with a successful ~Will~[TAG_WILL] save (~spell resistance~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_SPELL_RESISTANCE] applies). This use discharges and ends the spell. Third, sometimes with a touch you can automatically dispel any one enchantment spell cast by an evil creature or any one evil spell.     Exception:  Spells that can't be dispelled by ~Dispel Magic~[TAG_SPELLS_DISPEL_MAGIC] also can't be dispelled by Dispel Evil. ~Saving throws~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] and spell resistance do not apply to this effect. This use discharges and ends the spell.
TAG_SPELLS_DISPEL_FIRE:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_C: ~Abjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ABJURATION]Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 5, ~Domain: Fire~[TAG_FIRE_D] 4This spell functions like ~Dispel Evil~[TAG_SPELLS_DISPEL_EVIL], except that you are surrounded by a fiery orange, elemental energy, and the spell affects fire creatures and spells rather than evil ones.
TAG_SPELLS_DISPEL_GOOD:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_C: ~Abjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ABJURATION] (Evil)Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 5, ~Domain: Evil~[TAG_EVIL_D] 5This spell functions like ~Dispel Evil~[TAG_SPELLS_DISPEL_EVIL], except that you are surrounded by a dark, wavering, unholy energy, and the spell affects good creatures and spells rather than evil ones.
TAG_SPELLS_DISPEL_LAW:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_CH: ~Abjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ABJURATION] (Chaotic)Level: ~Domain: Chaos~[TAG_CHAOS_D] 5, ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 5This spell functions like ~Dispel Evil~[TAG_SPELLS_DISPEL_EVIL], except that you are surrounded by a flickering yellow, chaotic energy, and the spell affects lawful creatures and spells rather than evil ones.
TAG_SPELLS_DISPEL_MAGIC:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_: ~Abjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ABJURATION]Level: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 3, ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 3, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 4, ~Domain: Magic~[TAG_MAGIC_D] 3, ~Paladin~[TAG_PALADINS] 3, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 3Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)Target or Area: One spellcaster, creature, or object; or 20-ft. radius burstDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: NoneSpell Resistance: NoBecause magic is powerful, so too is the ability to dispel magic. You can use Dispel Magic to end ongoing spells that have been cast on a creature or object, to temporarily suppress the magical abilities of a magical item, to end ongoing spells (or at least their affects) within an area, or to counter another spellcaster's spell. A dispelled spell ends as if its duration had expired. Some spells, as detailed in their descriptions, can't be defeated by Dispel Magic. Dispel Magic can dispel (but not counter) the ongoing effects of supernatural abilities as well as spells , and it affects spell-like effects just as it does spells. Note: The effect of a spell with an instantaneous duration can't be dispelled, because the magical effect is already over before the Dispel Magic can take effect. Thus, you can't use Dispel Magic to repair fire damage caused by a ~Fireball~[TAG_SPELLS_FIREBALL] or to turn a petrified character back to flesh. In these cases, the magic has departed, leaving only burned flesh or perfectly normal stone in it's wake. You choose to use Dispel Magic in one of three ways: a targeted dispel, an area dispel, or a ~counterspell~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU_READY_COUNTERSPELL]  Targeted Dispel:  One object, creature, or spell is the target of the Dispel Magic spell. You can make a dispel check (1d20 + your ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL], maximum +10) against the spell or against the each ongoing spell currently in effect on the object or creature.
