For example, the weapon of ~Moradin~[TAG_MORADIN] is noted as being a ~warhammer~[TAG_WEAPONS_WARHAMMER], aptly named "Soulhammer".
TAG_SPELLS_STINKING_CLOUD:TAG_SPELLS::TA: ~Conjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_CONJURATION] (Creation)Level: ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 3Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)Effect: Cloud spreads in 20-ft. radius, 20 ft. highDuration: 1 round/levelSaving Throw: ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] negates; see textSpell Resistance: NoStinking Cloud creates a bank of fog like that created by ~Fog Cloud~[TAG_SPELLS_FOG_CLOUD], except that the vapors are nauseating. Living creatures in the cloud become ~nauseated~[TAG_NAUSEATED]. This condition lasts as long as the creature is in the cloud and for 1d4+1 rounds after it leaves. (Roll separately for each nauseated character.) Any creature that succeeds on its save but remains in the cloud must continue to save each round on its turn.
TAG_SPELLS_STONESKIN:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_DRU: ~Abjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ABJURATION]Level: ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 5, ~Domain: Earth~[TAG_EARTH_D] 6, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 4, ~Domain: Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH_D] 6Components: V, S, MCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: TouchTarget: Creature touchedDuration: 10 min./level or until dischargedSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negates (harmless)Spell Resistance: Yes (harmless)The warded creature gains resistance to blows, cuts, stabs, and slashes. The subject gains ~damage reduction~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_DAMAGE_REDUCTION] 10/~adamantine~[TAG_ADAMANTINE]. (It ignores the first 10 points of damage each time it takes damage from a weapon, though an adamantine weapon bypasses the reduction.) Once the spell has prevented a total of 10 points of damage per ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (maximum 150 points), it is discharged. Material Component: Granite and 250 gp worth of diamond dust sprinkled on the target's skin.
TAG_SPELLS_SUMMON_MONSTER_I:TAG_SPELLS::: ~Conjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_CONJURATION] (Summoning)Level: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 1, ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 1, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 1Components: V, SRange: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Effect: One summoned creatureDuration: 1 round/level (D)Saving Throw: NoneSpell Resistance: NoThis spell summons an extraplanar creature (typically an outsider, elemental, or magical beast native to another plane). It appears where you designate and acts immediately, on your turn. It attacks your opponents to the best of its ability. If you can communicate with the creature, you can direct it not to attack, to attack particular enemies, or to perform other actions. The spell conjures a creature from the monster list below. You choose which kind of creature to summon (within the game, this decision is limited to the options on the ~radial menu~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU]) and you can change that choice each time you cast the spell. A summoned monster cannot summon or otherwise conjure another creature, nor can it use any teleportation or planar travel abilities. Creatures cannot be summoned into an environment that cannot support them.The monsters you can choose from are:~Celestial Dog~[TAG_MONSTER_CELESTIAL_DOG]~Celestial Owl~[TAG_MONSTER_CELESTIAL_OWL]~Fiendish Dire Rat~[TAG_MONSTER_FIENDISH_DIRE_RAT]~Fiendish Hawk~[TAG_MONSTER_FIENDISH_HAWK]~Fiendish~[TAG_FIENDISH] ~Monstrous Spider, Small~[TAG_MONSTER_MONSTROUS_SPIDER_SMALL]~Fiendish Raven~[TAG_MONSTER_FIENDISH_RAVEN]~Fiendish Viper, Small~[TAG_MONSTER_FIENDISH_VIPER_SMALL]

Similar to Summon Monster I, you choose the monster from the ~radial menu~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU] within the game.The monsters you can choose from are:~Celestial War Dog~[TAG_MONSTER_CELESTIAL_WAR_DOG]~Fiendish Wolf~[TAG_MONSTER_FIENDISH_WOLF]~Fiendish~[TAG_FIENDISH] ~Monstrous Spider, Medium~[TAG_MONSTER_MONSTROUS_SPIDER_MEDIUM]~Fiendish Viper, Medium~[TAG_MONSTER_FIENDISH_VIPER_MEDIUM]

TAG_SPELLS_SUMMON_NATURE'S_ALLY_I:TAG_SP: ~Conjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_CONJURATION] (Summoning)Level: ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 1, ~Ranger~[TAG_RANGERS] 1Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 roundRange: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Effect: One summoned creatureDuration: 1 round/level (D)Saving Throw: NoneSpell Resistance: NoThis spell summons a natural creature. It appears where you designate and acts immediately on your turn. It attacks your opponents to the best of its ability. If you can communicate with the creature, you can direct it not to attack, to attack particular enemies, or to perform other actions. A summoned creature cannot summon or otherwise conjure another creature, nor can it use any teleportation or planar travel abilities. Creatures cannot be summoned into an environment that cannot support them. (For instance, a porpoise may only be summoned into an aquatic environment.) In ToEE, summoning a nature's ally creature involves the use of the ~radial menu~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU]. You must select from the monsters noted in the radial menu and that monster will then be summoned. A list of potential monsters to be summoned for Summon Nature's Ally I includes the following.The creatures you can choose from are:~Dire Rat~[TAG_MONSTER_DIRE_RAT]~Owl~[TAG_MONSTER_OWL]~Viper, Small~[TAG_MONSTER_VIPER_SMALL]~Wolf~[TAG_MONSTER_WOLF]

TAG_SPELLS_SUMMON_SWARM:TAG_DUMMY::#TAG_: ~Conjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_CONJURATION] (Summoning)Level: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 2, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 2, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 2Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 roundRange: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Effect: One swarm of bats, rats, or spidersDuration: Concentration + 2 roundsSaving Throw: NoneSpell Resistance: NoYou summon a swarm of animals, based on what you select from the radial menu within the game.  The swarm immediately attacks the nearest living creature and does not discriminate (meaning if you are the only creature in the area, you will be attacked as well).  The caster does not have control over the swarm and cannot provide direction or point out targets.
TAG_SPELLS_SUNBURST:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_DRUI: ~Evocation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_EVOCATION] (Light)Level: ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 8, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 8, ~Domain: Sun~[TAG_SUN_D] 8Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Long (400 ft. + 40 ft./level)Area: 80-ft. radius-spreadDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: ~Reflex~[TAG_REFLEX] partial; see textSpell Resistance: YesSunburst causes a globe of searing radiance to explode silently from a point you select. All creatures in the globe are ~blinded~[TAG_BLINDED] and take 6d6 points of damage. A creature to which sunlight is harmful or unnatural takes double damage. A successful Reflex save negates the blindness and reduces the damage by half. An undead creature caught within the globe takes 1d6 points of damage per ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (maximum 25d6), or half damage if a Reflex save is successful. In addition, the burst results in the destruction of any undead creature specifically harmed by bright light if it fail its save. The ultraviolet light generated by the spell deals damage to fungi, mold, oozes, and slimes just as if they were undead creatures.
TAG_SPELLS_TASHA'S_HIDEOUS_LAUGHTER:TAG_: ~Enchantment~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ENCHANTMENT] (Compulsion) Mind-AffectingLevel: ~Bard~[TAG_BARDS] 1, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 2Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Target: One creature; see textDuration: 1 round/levelSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negatesSpell Resistance: YesThis spell afflicts the subject with uncontrollable laughter. The subject collapses into gales of manic laughter, falling ~prone~[TAG_PRONE]. The subject can take no actions while laughing, but is not considered ~helpless~[TAG_HELPLESS]. After the spell ends, it can act normally. A creature with an ~Intelligence~[TAG_INTELLIGENCE] score of 2 or lower is not affected. A creature whose type (such as a humanoid or dragon) is different from the caster's receives a +4 bonus on its saving throw, because humor doesn't "translate" well.
TAG_SPELLS_TELEPORT:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_SORC: ~Conjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_CONJURATION] (Teleportation)Level: ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 5, ~Domain: Travel~[TAG_TRAVEL_D] 5Components: VCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Personal and TouchTarget: You and other touched willing creaturesDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: None and ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negates (object)Spell Resistance: No and Yes (object)In ToEE, casting Teleport brings up the ~World Map~[TAG_HMU_WORLDMAP_UI]. When you click on the desired location, your entire party will be teleported to that place in a manner that ensures there will be no ~random encounters~[TAG_HMU_RANDOM_ENCOUNTER_UI] and no error during travel.
TAG_SPELLS_TENSERS_TRANSFORMATION:TAG_SP: ~Transmutation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_TRANSMUTATION]Level: ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 6Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: PersonalTarget: YouDuration: 1 round/levelYou become a virtual fighting machine--stronger, tougher, faster, and more skilled in combat. Your mind-set changes so that you relish combat and you can't cast spells. You gain a +4 ~enhancement~[TAG_ENHANCEMENT_BONUS] bonus to ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH], ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY], and ~Constitution~[TAG_CONSTITUTION], a +4 natural armor bonus to ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS], a +5 competence bonus on ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] saves, and proficiency with the single weapon (simple, martial, or exotic) equipped on your primary hand, but not with the weapon's type. Your ~base attack bonus~[TAG_LEVEL_BONUSES] equals your character level (which may give you multiple attacks). You lose your spellcasting ability just as if the spells were no longer on your class list.
TAG_SPELLS_TREE_SHAPE:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_DR: ~Transmutation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_TRANSMUTATION]Level: ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 2, ~Ranger~[TAG_RANGERS] 3Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: PersonalTarget: YouDuration: 1 hour/level (D)By means of this spell you are able to assume the form of a large living tree or shrub or a large dead tree trunk with a number of limbs. The closest inspection cannot reveal that the tree in question is actually a magically ~concealed~[TAG_CONCEALMENT] creature. To all normal tests you are, in fact, a tree or shrub, although a ~Detect Magic~[TAG_SPELLS_DETECT_MAGIC] spell reveals a faint transmutation on the tree. While in tree form, you can observe all that transpires around you just as if you were in your normal form, and your ~hit points~[TAG_HIT_POINTS] and save bonuses remain unaffected. You gain a +10 natural armor bonus to ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS] but have an effective ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY] score of 0 and a speed of 0 feet. You are immune to ~critical hits~[TAG_CRITICAL_HIT] while in tree form. You can dismiss Tree Shape as a ~free action~[TAG_FREE_ACTION] (instead of a standard action).
TAG_SPELLS_TRUE_SEEING:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_C: ~Divination~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_DIVINATION]Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 5, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 7, ~Domain: Knowledge~[TAG_KNOWLEDGE_D] 5, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 6Components: V, S, MCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: TouchTarget: Creature touchedDuration: 1 min./levelSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negates (harmless)Spell Resistance: Yes (harmless)You confer on the subject the ability to see all things as they actually are. The subject sees through darkness, notices secret doors hidden by magic, sees the exact locations of creatures or objects under ~Blur~[TAG_SPELLS_BLUR] or ~Displacement~[TAG_SPELLS_DISPLACEMENT] effects, sees ~invisible~[TAG_INVISIBLE] creatures or objects normally, sees through illusions, and sees the true form of polymorphed, changed, or ~transmuted~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_TRANSMUTATION] things. The range of True Seeing conferred is 120 feet. Material Component: An ointment for the eyes that costs 250 gp and is made from mushroom powder, saffron, and fat.
TAG_SPELLS_TRUE_STRIKE:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_S: ~Divination~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_DIVINATION]Level: ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 1Components: VCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: PersonalTarget: YouDuration: See textYou gain temporary, intuitive insight into the immediate future during your next attack. Your next single ~attack roll~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] (if it is made before the end of the next round) gains a +20 insight bonus. Additionally, you are not affected by the miss chance that applies to attackers trying to strike a ~concealed~[TAG_CONCEALMENT] target.
TAG_SPELLS_UNDEATH_TO_DEATH:TAG_SPELLS::: ~Necromancy~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_NECROMANCY]Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 6, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 6Components: V, S, MArea: Several undead creatures within a 40-ft.-radius burstSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negatesThis spell functions like ~Circle of Death~[TAG_SPELLS_CIRCLE_OF_DEATH], except that it destroys undead creatures as noted above. Material Component: The powder of a crushed diamond worth at least 500 gp.
TAG_SPELLS_UNHOLY_BLIGHT:TAG_SPELLS::TAG: ~Evocation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_EVOCATION] (Evil)Level: ~Domain: Evil~[TAG_EVIL_D] 4Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)Area: 20-ft.-radius spreadDuration: Instantaneous (1d4 rounds); see textSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] partialSpell Resistance: YesYou call up unholy power to smite your enemies. The power takes the form of a cold, cloying miasma of greasy darkness. Only good or neutral (not evil) creatures are harmed by the spell. The spell deals 1d8 points of damage per two ~caster levels~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (maximum 5d8) to a good creature (or 1d6 per caster level, maximum 10d6, to a good outsider) and causes it to be ~sickened~[TAG_SICKENED] for 1d4 rounds. A successful Will save reduces damage to half and negates the sickened effect. The effects cannot be negated by ~Remove Disease~[TAG_SPELLS_REMOVE_DISEASE] or ~Heal~[TAG_SPELLS_HEAL], but ~Remove Curse~[TAG_SPELLS_REMOVE_CURSE] is effective. The spell deals only half damage to creatures who are neither evil nor good, and they are not sickened. Such a creature can reduce the damage in half again (down to one-quarter) with a successful Will save.
TAG_SPELLS_VAMPIRIC_TOUCH:TAG_SPELLS::TA: ~Necromancy~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_NECROMANCY]Level: ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 3Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: TouchTarget: Living creature touchedDuration: Instantaneous/1 hour; see textSaving Throw: NoneSpell Resistance: YesYou must succeed on a melee ~touch attack~[TAG_TOUCH_ATTACK]. Your touch deals 1d6 points of damage per two ~caster levels~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] (maximum 10d6). You gain ~temporary hit points~[TAG_TEMPORARY_HIT_POINTS] equal to the damage you deal. However, you can't gain more than the subject's current ~hit points~[TAG_HIT_POINTS] + 10, which is enough to kill the subject. The temporary hit points disappear 1 hour later.
TAG_SPELLS_VIRTUE:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_CLERIC: ~Transmutation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_TRANSMUTATION]Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 0, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 0, ~Paladin~[TAG_PALADINS] 1Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: TouchTarget: Creature touchedDuration: 1 min.Saving Throw: ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] negates (harmless)Spell Resistance: Yes (harmless)The subject gains 1 ~temporary hit point~[TAG_TEMPORARY_HIT_POINTS].
TAG_SPELLS_WAIL_OF_THE_BANSHEE:TAG_SPELL: ~Necromancy~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_NECROMANCY] (Death, Sonic)Level: ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 9, ~Domain: Death~[TAG_DEATH_D] 9Components: VCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Area: One living creature/level within a 40-ft.-radius spreadDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] negatesSpell Resistance: YesYou emit a terrible scream that kills creatures that hear it (except for yourself). Creatures closest to the point of origin are affected first.
TAG_SPELLS_WARP_WOOD:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_DRU: ~Transmutation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_TRANSMUTATION]Level: ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 2Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)Target: 1 wooden objectDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negates (object)Spell Resistance: Yes (object)You cause wood to bend and warp, permanently destroying its straightness, form, and strength. Warped ranged weapons are useless. A warped melee weapon causes a -4 penalty on ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL]. A warped door or chest will be able to be opened.
TAG_SPELLS_WEB:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_SORCERER_: ~Conjuration~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_CONJURATION] (Creation)Level: ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 2Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: Medium (100 ft. + 10 ft./level)Effect: Webs in a 20-ft.-radius spreadDuration: 10 min./level (D)Saving Throw: ~Reflex~[TAG_REFLEX] negates; see textSpell Resistance: NoWeb creates a many-layered mass of strong, sticky strands. These strands trap those caught in them. The strands are similar to spider webs but far larger and tougher. When casting the spell in ToEE, choose an area (20-ft.-radius) and the web will engulf that area. Creatures caught within a web or simply touching its strands become ~entangled~[TAG_ENTANGLED] among the gluey fibers. Anyone in the effect's area when the spell is cast must make a Reflex save. If this save succeeds, the creature is not entangled in the web and is free to act, though moving may be a problem. If the save fails, the creature is entangled. An entangled creature can break loose by spending 1 round and making a DC 20 ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH] check. Once loose (either by making the initial Reflex save or a later Strength check), a creature may progress through the web very slowly. Each round devoted to moving allows the creature to make a new Strength check. The creature moves 5 feet for each full 5 points by which the check result exceeds 10. If you have at least 5 feet of web between you and an opponent, it provides ~cover~[TAG_COVER]. If you have at least 20 feet of web between you, it provides total cover. The strands of a web spell are flammable. A magic flaming sword can slash them away as easily as a hand brushes away cobwebs. In ToEE, any fire damage dealt to creatures in the spell's area of effect will set the webs alight and burn them away. All creatures within flaming webs take 2d4 points of fire damage from the flames.
TAG_SPELLS_WEIRD:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_SORCERE: ~Illusion~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_ILLUSION] (Phantasm) Fear, Mind-AffectingLevel: ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 9Targets: Any number of creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apartThis spell functions like ~Phantasmal Killer~[TAG_SPELLS_PHANTASMAL_KILLER], except it can affect more than one creature. Only the affected creatures see the phantasmal creatures attacking them, though you see the attackers as shadowy shapes. If a subject's ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] save succeeds, it still takes 3d6 points of damage and is ~stunned~[TAG_STUNNED] for 1 round. The subject also takes 1d4 points of temporary ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH] damage.
TAG_SPELLS_WIND_WALL:TAG_SPELLS::TAG_AIR: ~Evocation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_EVOCATION] (Air)Level: ~Domain: Air~[TAG_AIR_D] 2, ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 3, ~Druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] 3, ~Ranger~[TAG_RANGERS] 2, ~Sorcerer~[TAG_SORCERERS]/~Wizard~[TAG_WIZARDS] 3Components: V, SCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: NoneArea: 3 ft./levelEffect: Wall up to 10 ft./level long and 5 ft./level highDuration: 1 round/levelSaving Throw: None; see textSpell Resistance: YesA great vertical cylinder of wind appears around you. It is 2 feet thick and of considerable strength. It is a roaring blast sufficient to blow away any bird smaller than an eagle or tear light materials from unsuspecting hands. (A ~Reflex~[TAG_REFLEX] save allows a creature to maintain its grasp on an object.) ~Arrows~[TAG_WEAPONS_ARROWS] and ~bolts~[TAG_WEAPONS_BOLTS] are deflected upward and miss, while any other normal ranged weapon passing through the wall has a 30% miss chance. In ToEE, the radius of Wind Wall is 3 feet/level (maximum 30 feet).
TAG_SPELLS_WORD_OF_CHAOS:TAG_SPELLS::TAG: ~Evocation~[TAG_MAGIC_SCHOOLS_EVOCATION] (Chaotic, Sonic)Level: ~Cleric~[TAG_CLERICS] 7, ~Domain: Chaos~[TAG_CHAOS_D] 7Components: VCasting Time: 1 ~standard action~[TAG_STANDARD_ACTION]Range: 40 ft.Area: Nonchaotic creatures in a 40-ft.-radius spread centered on youDuration: InstantaneousSaving Throw: None or ~Will~[TAG_WILL] negates; see textSpell Resistance: YesAny nonchaotic creature within the area of a word of chaos spell suffers the following ill effects:HD equal to caster level: ~deafened~[TAG_DEAFENED]HD up to caster level 1: ~stunned~[TAG_STUNNED], ~deafened~[TAG_DEAFENED]HD up to caster level 5: confused, ~stunned~[TAG_STUNNED], ~deafened~[TAG_DEAFENED]HD up to caster level 10: killed, confused, ~stunned~[TAG_STUNNED], ~deafened~[TAG_DEAFENED]The effects are cumulative and concurrent.No saving throw is allowed against these effects.Deafened: The creature is deafened for 1d4 rounds. Stunned: The creature is stunned for 1 round. Confused: The creature is confused, as by the ~confusion~[TAG_SPELLS_CONFUSION] spell, for 1d10 minutes. Killed: Living creatures die. Undead creatures are destroyed.Furthermore, if you are on your home plane when you cast this spell, nonchaotic extraplanar creatures within the area are instantly banished back to their home planes. Creatures so banished cannot return for at least 24 hours. This effect takes place regardless of whether the creatures hear the word of chaos. The banishment effect allows a Will save (at a 4 penalty) to negate.Creatures whose Hit Dice exceed your caster level are unaffected by word of chaos.
TAG_EQUIPMENT::::2: Your characters begin with a small amount of gold to purchase equipment before entering the game. You will be allowed to select from a list of available items and keep the remaining money.[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_MONEY:TAG_EQUIPMENT:::2: Characters gain wealth by receiving gifts from NPCs as rewards, looting creatures they have killed, or selling items they have in their inventory to NPCs who are willing to barter.Wealth in the game is measured in platinum pieces (pp), gold pieces (gp), silver pieces (sp), and copper pieces (cp), such that:                        1 platinum piece @t= @t10 gold pieces                               1 gold piece @t= @t10 silver pieces                              1 silver piece @t= @t10 copper pieces
TAG_WEAPONS:TAG_EQUIPMENT:::2: Weapons are categorized into the following types:~Simple Weapons~[TAG_SIMPLE_WEAPONS]~Martial Weapons~[TAG_MARTIAL_WEAPONS]~Exotic Weapons~[TAG_EXOTIC_WEAPONS]Within each of these categories, weapons are broken down into unarmed, light melee, one-handed melee, two-handed melee, and ranged weapons.Some weapons also have reach, such as the following:~Reach Weapons~[TAG_REACH_WEAPONS]Some special weapons are magical and may have unique abilities, such as the following:~Magic Weapons~[TAG_MAGIC_WEAPONS]Weapons may be rated as ~masterwork~[TAG_MASTERWORK].
TAG_ARMOR:TAG_EQUIPMENT:::2: Armor is categorized into the following types:~Light Armor~[TAG_ARMOR_LIGHT]~Medium Armor~[TAG_ARMOR_MEDIUM]~Heavy Armor~[TAG_ARMOR_HEAVY]~Shields~[TAG_ARMOR_SHIELD]Armor can be made out of special materials, such as the following:~Adamantium Armor~[TAG_ARMOR_ADAMANTIUM]~Darkwood Armor~[TAG_ARMOR_DARKWOOD]~Mithral Armor~[TAG_ARMOR_MITHRAL]~Nonmetallic Armor~[TAG_ARMOR_NONMETALLIC] (can be worn by ~druids~[TAG_DRUIDS])Armor may be rated as ~masterwork~[TAG_MASTERWORK].
TAG_TOOLS:TAG_EQUIPMENT:::2: A few of the pieces of adventuring gear are described below, along with any special benefits they confer on the user ("you").[CMD_CHILDREN_SORTED]
TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS:TAG_EQUIPMENT:::2: Some items found in the game may be magical in nature. Some creatures are resistant to all but magical weapons. The most common types of magic items give bonuses to hit and damage rolls, but there are a wide variety of magic items that can increase abilities, modifiers, etc.A spellcaster with any of the ~Item Creation Feats~[TAG_ITEM_CREATION] may be able to create her own magical items once she has achieved the appropriate caster level.The following list is an example of a few magical items:[CMD_CHILDREN_SORTED]
TAG_GOODS:TAG_EQUIPMENT:::2: Most good and services are maintained by the computer for you. However, some items may be bought and sold throughout the game world.In addition to the goods mentioned above, some items have specific uses in the game world such as ~Thieves' Tools~[TAG_THIEVES_TOOLS], ~musical instruments~[TAG_BARDIC_INSTRUMENT], ~Holy Water~[TAG_HOLY_WATER], etc.
TAG_MASTERWORK:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: A masterwork weapon is a finely crafted version of a normal weapon. Wielding it provides a +1 ~enhancement~[TAG_ENHANCEMENT_BONUS] bonus on ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL]. This is not a magical attack, nor is the weapon considered magical. However, all magic weapons are considered to be masterwork, although the +1 enhancement bonus does not stack with magical bonuses.Just as with weapons, armor can be crafted as masterwork. Masterwork armor reduces the armor check penalties by 1.~Thieves' Tools~[TAG_THIEVES_TOOLS] can also be rated as masterwork, giving bonuses to ~skill checks~[TAG_USING_SKILLS] requiring the use of Thieves' Tools.
TAG_SIMPLE_WEAPONS:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: Unarmed  ~Unarmed Strike~[TAG_WEAPONS_STRIKE_UNARMED]Light Melee  ~Dagger~[TAG_WEAPONS_DAGGER]  ~Katar~[TAG_WEAPONS_KATAR]  ~Light Mace~[TAG_WEAPONS_MACE_HEAVY_LIGHT]  ~Main Gauche~[TAG_WEAPONS_MAIN_GAUCHE]  ~Sickle~[TAG_WEAPONS_SICKLE]  ~Spiked Gauntlet~[TAG_WEAPONS_GAUNTLET_SPIKED]  ~Tanto~[TAG_WEAPONS_TANTO]One-Handed Melee  ~Club~[TAG_WEAPONS_CLUB]  ~Heavy Mace~[TAG_WEAPONS_MACE_HEAVY_LIGHT]  ~Morningstar~[TAG_WEAPONS_MORNINGSTAR]  ~Rolling Pin~[TAG_WEAPONS_ROLLING_PIN]  ~Shortspear~[TAG_WEAPONS_SHORTSPEAR]  ~Small Quarterstaff~[TAG_WEAPONS_QUARTERSTAFF]Two-Handed Melee  ~Broom~[TAG_WEAPONS_BROOM]  ~Great Mace~[TAG_WEAPONS_MACE_HEAVY_LIGHT]  ~Longspear~[TAG_WEAPONS_LONGSPEAR]  ~Quarterstaff~[TAG_WEAPONS_QUARTERSTAFF]  ~Rake~[TAG_WEAPONS_RAKE]  ~Spear~[TAG_WEAPONS_SPEAR]Ranged  ~Heavy Crossbow~[TAG_WEAPONS_CROSSBOW_HEAVY]  ~Light Crossbow~[TAG_WEAPONS_CROSSBOW_LIGHT]  ~Crossbow Bolts~[TAG_WEAPONS_BOLTS]  ~Dart~[TAG_WEAPONS_DART]  ~Javelin~[TAG_WEAPONS_JAVELIN]  ~Sling~[TAG_WEAPONS_SLING]  ~Sling Bullets~[TAG_WEAPONS_BULLETS_SLING]  ~Throwing Dagger~[TAG_WEAPONS_DAGGER_THROWING]
TAG_MARTIAL_WEAPONS:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: Light Melee  ~Cutlass~[TAG_WEAPONS_CUTLASS]  ~Light Hammer~[TAG_WEAPONS_HAMMER_LIGHT]  ~Gladius~[TAG_WEAPONS_GLADIUS]  ~Handaxe~[TAG_WEAPONS_HANDAXE]  ~Sap~[TAG_WEAPONS_SAP]  ~Short Sword~[TAG_WEAPONS_SWORD_SHORT]  ~Single Axe~[TAG_WEAPONS_AXE_SINGLE]  ~Tiny Rapier~[TAG_WEAPONS_RAPIER]  ~Wakizashi~[TAG_WEAPONS_WAKIZASHI]One-Handed Melee  ~Battleaxe~[TAG_WEAPONS_BATTLEAXE]  ~Cleaver~[TAG_WEAPONS_CLEAVER]  ~Flail~[TAG_WEAPONS_FLAIL]  ~Great Cleaver~[TAG_WEAPONS_CLEAVER]  ~Heavy Saber~[TAG_WEAPONS_SABER_HEAVY]  ~Longsword~[TAG_WEAPONS_LONGSWORD]  ~Heavy Pick~[TAG_WEAPONS_PICK_HEAVY_LIGHT]  ~Rapier~[TAG_WEAPONS_RAPIER]  ~Scimitar~[TAG_WEAPONS_SCIMITAR]  ~Trident~[TAG_WEAPONS_TRIDENT]  ~Warhammer~[TAG_WEAPONS_WARHAMMER]Two-Handed Melee  ~Bastard Sword~[TAG_WEAPONS_SWORD_BASTARD]  ~Dwarven Waraxe~[TAG_WEAPONS_WARAXE_DWARVEN]  ~Falchion~[TAG_WEAPONS_FALCHION]  ~Glaive~[TAG_WEAPONS_GLAIVE]  ~Greataxe~[TAG_WEAPONS_GREATAXE]  ~Greatclub~[TAG_WEAPONS_GREATCLUB]  ~Greathammer~[TAG_WEAPONS_GREATHAMMER]  ~Greatsword~[TAG_WEAPONS_GREATSWORD]  ~Guisarme~[TAG_WEAPONS_GUISARME]  ~Halberd~[TAG_WEAPONS_HALBERD]  ~Heavy Flail~[TAG_WEAPONS_FLAIL_HEAVY]  ~Katana~[TAG_WEAPONS_KATANA]  ~Large Axe~[TAG_WEAPONS_AXE_LARGE]  ~Maul~[TAG_WEAPONS_MAUL]  ~Military Fork~[TAG_WEAPONS_MILITARY_FORK]  ~Naginata~[TAG_WEAPONS_NAGINATA]  ~Ranseur~[TAG_WEAPONS_RANSEUR]  ~Shovel~[TAG_WEAPONS_SHOVEL]  ~Scythe~[TAG_WEAPONS_SCYTHE]  ~Tetsubo~[TAG_WEAPONS_TETSUBO]Ranged  ~Longbow~[TAG_WEAPONS_LONGBOW]  ~Composite Longbow~[TAG_WEAPONS_LONGBOW_COMPOSITE]  ~Shortbow~[TAG_WEAPONS_SHORTBOW]  ~Composite Shortbow~[TAG_WEAPONS_SHORTBOW_COMPOSITE]  ~Arrows~[TAG_WEAPONS_ARROWS]
TAG_EXOTIC_WEAPONS:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: Light Melee  ~Butterfly Sword~[TAG_WEAPONS_SWORD_BUTTERFLY]  ~Dao~[TAG_WEAPONS_DAO]  ~Halfling Siangham~[TAG_WEAPONS_SIANGHAM]  ~Kama~[TAG_WEAPONS_KAMA]  ~Kukri~[TAG_WEAPONS_KUKRI]  ~Sai~[TAG_WEAPONS_SAI]  ~Siangham~[TAG_WEAPONS_SIANGHAM]  ~Tonfa~[TAG_WEAPONS_TONFA]  ~War Fan~[TAG_WEAPONS_WAR_FAN]One-Handed Melee  ~Bastard Sword~[TAG_WEAPONS_SWORD_BASTARD]  ~Dwarven Waraxe~[TAG_WEAPONS_WARAXE_DWARVEN]  ~Gnome Hooked Hammer~[TAG_WEAPONS_HAMMER_GNOME_HOOKED]  ~Jian~[TAG_WEAPONS_JIAN]  ~Katana~[TAG_WEAPONS_KATANA]Two-Handed Melee  ~Orc Double Axe~[TAG_WEAPONS_AXE_ORC_DOUBLE]  ~Monk Spade~[TAG_WEAPONS_SPADE_MONK]  ~Spiked Chain~[TAG_WEAPONS_SPIKED_CHAIN]Ranged  ~Repeating Light Crossbow~[TAG_WEAPONS_CROSSBOW_REPEATING]  ~Shuriken~[TAG_WEAPONS_SHURIKEN]
TAG_REACH_WEAPONS:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: A reach weapon is a melee weapon that allows its wielder to strike at targets that aren't just adjacent to him or her.  Most reach weapons double the wielder's natural reach, meaning that a typical ~Medium~[TAG_SIZE_MODIFIER] wielder of such a weapon can attack a creature 10 feet away.  A typical ~Large~[TAG_SIZE_MODIFIER] character wielding a reach weapon of the appropriate size can attack a creature 15 feet away.[CMD_CHILDREN_SORTED]
TAG_WEAPONS_ABBATHOR'S_GREED_HAMMER:TAG_: Abbathor's Greed Hammer is a vile magic warhammer that is enchanted to be ~axiomatic~[TAG_AXIOMATIC], ~unholy~[TAG_UNHOLY], and ~defending~[TAG_DEFENDING].  It deals an extra 2d6 points of lawful damage against chaotic creatures and an extra 2d6 points of evil damage against good creatures.  As a defending weapon, Abbathor's Greed Hammer allows the wielder to transfer some or all of it's enhancement bonus to his/her ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS] as a bonus.Abbathor's Greed Hammer is currently wielded by "King" Battlehammer, a violent dwarf exiled from the Kron Hills with his clan.Two-Handed Melee Weapon~Enhancement~[TAG_ENHANCEMENT_BONUS] Bonus: @t+1To Hit Bonus:               @t+1Damage:                          @t1d12+1 (see above)Damage Type:               @tBludgeoningCritical Range:             @t20/x3Weapon Proficiency: @t~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Warhammer
TAG_WEAPONS_ARROWS:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: An arrow that hits it target is destroyed; one that misses has a 50% chance of being destroyed or lost.  They come in a leather quiver that holds 20 arrows.  Arrows can have an enhancement bonus on ~attack~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] and damage rolls or be made of ~silver~[TAG_SILVER].In ToEE, an arrow cannot be used as a melee weapon, but is used only as ammunition.
TAG_WEAPONS_AXE_LARGE:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: A large axe is a bigger and deadlier version of a battleaxe.  It is wielded in both hands.Two-Handed Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d12Damage Type:               @tSlashingCritical Range:             @t20/x3Weapon Proficiency: @t~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Greataxe
TAG_WEAPONS_AXE_ORC_DOUBLE:TAG_WEAPONS::: As its name suggests, an orc double axe is often found in the hands of powerful orc fighters.  Because of their orc blood, ~half-orcs~[TAG_HALF_ORCS] treat orc double axes as martial weapons and are proficient in their use.Two-Handed Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d8Damage Type:               @tSlashingCritical Range:             @t20/x3Weapon Proficiency: @t~Exotic~[TAG_EXOTIC_PROF], Orc Double Axe
TAG_WEAPONS_AXE_SINGLE:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: A single axe is a military variation of the handaxe, normally carried as a secondary weapon.  The single axe is a good, fast weapon which requires no great skill or strength to employ.Light Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d6Damage Type:               @tSlashingCritical Range:             @t20/x3Weapon Proficiency: @t~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Handaxe
TAG_WEAPONS_AXE_THROWING:TAG_DUMMY:::2: A throwing axe is lighter than a handaxe and balanced for throwing.  ~Gnome~[TAG_GNOMES] fighters often use throwing axes for both ~melee~[TAG_MELEE_ATTACKS] and ~ranged~[TAG_RANGED_ATTACKS] attacks.Light Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d6Damage Type:               @tSlashingCritical Range:             @t20/x2Range Increment:          @t10 feet (thrown)Weapon Proficiency: @t~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Throwing Axe
TAG_WEAPONS_BATTLEAXE:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: The battleaxe is the most common melee weapon among ~dwarves~[TAG_DWARVES].One-Handed Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d8Damage Type:               @tSlashingCritical Range:             @t20/x3Weapon Proficiency: @t~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Battleaxe
TAG_WEAPONS_BLACK_ROD:TAG_WEAPONS::TAG_M: This +2 light mace can be used to cast ~Inflict Serious Wounds~[TAG_SPELLS_INFLICT_SERIOUS_WOUNDS], ~Magic Circle against Good~[TAG_SPELLS_MAGIC_CIRCLE_AGAINST_GOOD], and ~Animate Dead~[TAG_SPELLS_ANIMATE_DEAD].  Each casting uses one charge.~Craft Rod~[TAG_CRAFT_ROD] Prerequisites:CL 9th; Craft Rod; ~Craft Magic Arms and Armor~[TAG_CRAFT_MAA]; creator must be evil.Light Melee Weapon~Enhancement~[TAG_ENHANCEMENT_BONUS] Bonus: @t+2To Hit Bonus:               @t+2Damage:                          @t1d6+2Damage Type:               @tBludgeoningCritical Range:             @t20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @t~Simple~[TAG_SIMPLE_PROF], Light Mace

TAG_ITEM_COMPOSITE_BOW:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: All composite bows are made with a particular ~strength~[TAG_STRENGTH] rating (that is, each requires a minimum Strength modifier to use with proficiency).  If your Strength bonus is lower than the strength rating of the composite bow, you take a -2 penalty on attacks with it.Composite bows allow you to add your Strength bonus to damage, up to the bow's strength rating.For example, Tordek has a 15 strength, which gives him a +2 strength modifier.  With a regular shortbow, he gets no damage modifier.  With a composite shortbow (+1 strength bonus) he gets a +1 on his damage rolls.  With a composite shortbow (+2 strength bonus) he gets to use his full +2 bonus on damage rolls.  If he were to use a composite shortbow (+3 strength bonus) he would still only get a +2 on damage rolls and would take a -2 penalty on his to hit rolls because his Strength is insufficient to use the weapon to it's best advantage.[CMD_CHILDREN]

If you have a bonus for high Strength, you can apply it to damage rolls when you use a composite longbow but not a regular longbow.Ranged WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d8Damage Type:               @tPiercingCritical Range:             @t20/x3Range Increment:          @t100 feetWeapon Proficiency: @t~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Longbow
TAG_WEAPONS_LONGBOW_COMPOSITE:TAG_WEAPON: You need at least two hands to use a bow, regardless of its size.  Composite longbows are made from two or more layers of horn, wood, or bone.  All composite bows are made with a particular ~strength~[TAG_STRENGTH] rating (that is, each requires a minimum Strength modifier to use with proficiency).  If your Strength bonus is less than the strength rating of the composite bow, you can't effectively use it, so you take a -2 penalty on attacks with it.  The default composite longbow requires a Strength modifier of +0 or higher to use with proficiency.  A composite longbow can be made with a high strength rating (representing an especially heavy pull) to take advantage of an above-average Strength score; this feature allows you to add your Strength bonus to damage, up to the maximum bonus indicated for the bow.  Each point of Strength bonus granted by the bow adds 100 gp to its cost.  For instance, a composite longbow (+1 Str bonus) costs 200 gp, while a composite longbow (+4 Str bonus) costs 500 gp.For example, Tordek has a +2 Strength bonus.  With a regular composite longbow, he gets no modifier on damage rolls.  For 200 gp, he can buy a composite longbow (+1 Str bonus), which lets him add +1 to his damage rolls.  For 300 gp, he can buy one that lets him add his entire +2 Str bonus.  Even if he paid 400 gp for a composite longbow (+3 Str bonus), he would still get only a +2 bonus on damage rolls and takes a -2 penalty on attacks with it because his Strength is insufficient to use the weapon to best advantage.  The bow can't grant him a higher bonus than he already has.For purposes of weapon proficiency and similar feats, a composite longbow is treated as if it were a longbow.  Thus, if you have ~Weapon Focus~[TAG_WEAPON_FOCUS] (Longbow), that feat applies both to longbows and composite longbows.Ranged WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0 (see above)Damage:                          @t1d8 (see above)Damage Type:               @tPiercingCritical Range:             @t20/x3Range Increment:          @t110 feetWeapon Proficiency: @t~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Longbow

TAG_WEAPONS_MACE_HEAVY_LIGHT:TAG_WEAPONS: A mace is made of metal, even the haft, which makes it quite heavy and hard to break.Light MaceLight Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d6Damage Type:               @tBludgeoningCritical Range:             @t20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @t~Simple~[TAG_SIMPLE_PROF], Light MaceHeavy MaceOne-Handed Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d8Damage Type:               @tBludgeoningCritical Range:             @t20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @tSimple, Heavy MaceGreat MaceTwo-Handed Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d12Damage Type:               @tBludgeoning and PiercingCritical Range:             @t19-20/x3Weapon Proficiency: @tSimple, Morningstar
TAG_WEAPONS_MACE_OF_SMITING:TAG_WEAPONS:: A mace is made up of an ornate metal head attached to a simple wooden or metal shaft.  The mace's head is usually flanged to cause more pain or damage.  Some more primitive maces are made with stone bound to a wooden haft with leather straps.  This +3 light mace will use one charge to add 2 to the critical multiplier upon a ~critical hit~[TAG_CRITICAL_HIT].~Craft Rod~[TAG_CRAFT_ROD] Prerequisites:Craft Rod; ~Craft Magic Arms and Armor~[TAG_CRAFT_MAA]; ~Greater Magic Weapon~[TAG_SPELLS_MAGIC_WEAPON_GREATER]; creator must be good.Light Melee Weapon~Enhancement~[TAG_ENHANCEMENT_BONUS] Bonus: @t+3To Hit Bonus:               @t+3Damage:                          @t1d6+3Damage Type:               @tBludgeoningCritical Range:             @t20/x2 (see above)Weapon Proficiency: @t~Simple~[TAG_SIMPLE_PROF], Light Mace
TAG_WEAPONS_MAIN_GAUCHE:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: A main gauche, or "left hand", is a parrying dagger known to be wielded in the off-hand while wielding a long blade, such as a rapier, in the primary hand.Light Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d4Damage Type:               @tPiercing and SlashingCritical Range:             @t20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @t~Simple~[TAG_SIMPLE_PROF], Dagger
TAG_WEAPONS_MAUL:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: Bigger than a sledgehammer, a maul is a two-handed wooden warhammer of enormous size.  ~Barbarians~[TAG_BARBARIANS] and giants favor it.Two-Handed Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d10Damage Type:               @tBludgeoningCritical Range:             @t20/x3Weapon Proficiency: @t~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Warhammer

TAG_WEAPONS_MORADIN'S_SOUL_HAMMER:TAG_WE: Moradin's Soul Hammer is a powerful magic warhammer that is enchanted to be ~axiomatic~[TAG_AXIOMATIC], ~holy~[TAG_HOLY], and ~defending~[TAG_DEFENDING]. As a defending weapon, Moradin's Soul Hammer allows the wielder to transfer some or all of it's enhancement bonus to his/her ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS] as a bonus.Two-Handed Melee Weapon~Enhancement~[TAG_ENHANCEMENT_BONUS] Bonus: @t+1To Hit Bonus:               @t+1Damage:                          @t1d12+1 (see above)Damage Type:               @tBludgeoningCritical Range:             @t20/x3Weapon Proficiency: @t~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Warhammer

You can strike opponents 10 feet away with it and you can use it against an adjacent foe.Two-Handed Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t+1Damage:                          @t1d10Damage Type:               @tSlashingCritical Range:             @t20/x3Weapon Proficiency: @t~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Glaive
TAG_WEAPONS_PICK_HEAVY_LIGHT:TAG_WEAPONS: A pick is designed to concentrate the force of its blow on a small area. TAG_WEAPONS_QUARTERSTAFF:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: The quarterstaff is the favorite weapon of many characters, from travelers, peasants, and merchants to ~monks~[TAG_MONKS], ~rangers~[TAG_RANGERS], and ~wizards~[TAG_WIZARDS]. TAG_WEAPONS_RAKE:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: A rake is essentially a broom for outside use.  It is a farming implement consisting of a toothed bar fixed to a handle and used to collect leaves, hay, or grass. TAG_WEAPONS_RAPIER:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: A rapier is a slender, sharply pointed sword, ideally used for thrusting attacks.You can use the ~Weapon Finesse~[TAG_WEAPON_FINESSE] feat to apply your ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY] modifier instead of your ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH] modifier to ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] with a rapier sized for you, even though it isn't a light weapon for you.  You can't wield a rapier in two hands in order to apply 1 1/2 times your Strength bonus to damage.One-Handed Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d6Damage Type:               @tPiercingCritical Range:             @t18-20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @t~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], RapierTiny RapierLight Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d3Damage Type:               @tPiercingCritical Range:             @t18-20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @tMartial, Rapier
TAG_WEAPONS_ROD_OF_ALERTNESS:TAG_WEAPONS: This light mace can be used to cast ~Detect Chaos~[TAG_SPELLS_DETECT_CHAOS], ~Detect Law~[TAG_SPELLS_DETECT_LAW], ~Detect Evil~[TAG_SPELLS_DETECT_EVIL], ~Detect Good~[TAG_SPELLS_DETECT_GOOD], ~Discern Lies~[TAG_SPELLS_DISCERN_LIES], and ~See Invisibility~[TAG_SPELLS_SEE_INVISIBILITY]. TAG_WEAPONS_SCATHER:TAG_WEAPONS::TAG_MAG: Scather is a magic bastard sword that is both ~anarchic~[TAG_ANARCHIC] and ~holy~[TAG_HOLY].  It deals an extra 2d6 points of chaotic damage against lawful creatures and an extra 2d6 points of good damage against evil creatures.  If the wielder is non-evil, Scather never misses and adds +4 to damage, which doubles to +8 if the target is evil and the wielder is ~Chaotic Neutral~[TAG_CHAOTIC_NEUTRAL], ~Chaotic Good~[TAG_CHAOTIC_GOOD], or ~Neutral Good~[TAG_NEUTRAL_GOOD].  Finally, for Chaotic Good wielders, Scather provides free unlimited ~attacks of opportunity~[TAG_AOO] against any opponent making a ~melee attack~[TAG_MELEE_ATTACKS] against the wielder, and Chaotic Neutral wielders get one such free attack of opportunity per round.Scather is currently wielded by Lord Grundwell, a Marshall of Furyondy.One or Two-Handed Melee Weapon~Enhancement~[TAG_ENHANCEMENT_BONUS] Bonus: @t+4 (see above)To Hit Bonus:               @t+4 (see above)Damage:                          @t1d10 (see above)Damage Type:               @tSlashingCritical Range:             @t19-20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @t~Exotic~[TAG_EXOTIC_PROF]/~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Bastard Sword
TAG_WEAPONS_SCIMITAR:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: A scimitar is a sabre or backsword with a curved blade.  The curve on this blade gives it the effect of a keener edge.  It is a weapon favored by ~druids~[TAG_DRUIDS].One-Handed Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d6Damage Type:               @tSlashingCritical Range:             @t18-20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @t~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Scimitar
TAG_WEAPONS_SCYTHE:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: While it resembles the standard farm implement of the same name, this scythe is balanced and strengthened for war.  The design of the scythe focuses tremendous force on the sharp point as well as allowing devastating slashes with the blade edge.Two-Handed Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t2d4Damage Type:               @tPiercing and SlashingCritical Range:             @t20/x4Weapon Proficiency: @t~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Scythe
TAG_WEAPONS_SHORTBOW:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: You need at least two hands to use a bow, regardless of its size.  If you have a penalty for low ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH], apply it to damage rolls when you use a shortbow.  If you have a bonus for high Strength, you can apply it to damage rolls when you use a composite shortbow but not a regular shortbow.Ranged WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d6Damage Type:               @tPiercingCritical Range:             @t20/x3Range Increment:          @t60 feetWeapon Proficiency: @t~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Shortbow
TAG_WEAPONS_SHORTBOW_COMPOSITE:TAG_WEAPO: You need at least two hands to use a bow, regardless of its size.  Composite bows are made from two or more layers of horn, wood, or bone.  All composite bows are made with a particular ~strength~[TAG_STRENGTH] rating (that is, each requires a minimum Strength modifier to use with proficiency).  If your Strength bonus is lower than the strength rating of the composite bow, you can't effectively use it, so you take a -2 penalty on attacks with it.  The default composite shortbow requires a Strength modifier of +0 or higher to use with proficiency.  A composite shortbow can be made with a high strength rating (representing an especially heavy pull) to take advantage of an above-average Strength score; this feature allows you to add your Strength bonus to damage, up to the maximum bonus granted by the bow. Each bonus to the strength of a shortbow adds 75 gp to its cost.  For instance, a composite shortbow (+1 Str bonus) costs 150 gp, while a composite shortbow (+4 Str bonus) costs 375 gp.For purposes of weapon proficiency and similar feats, a composite shortbow is treated as if it were a shortbow.  Thus, if you have ~Weapon Focus~[TAG_WEAPON_FOCUS] (Shortbow), that feat applies both to shortbows and composite shortbows.Ranged WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0 (see above)Damage:                          @t1d6 (see above)Damage Type:               @tPiercingCritical Range:             @t20/x3Range Increment:          @t70 feetWeapon Proficiency: @t~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Shortbow
TAG_WEAPONS_SHORTSPEAR:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: A shortspear is small enough to wield one-handed.  It may also be thrown.One-Handed Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d6Damage Type:               @tPiercingCritical Range:             @t20/x2Range Increment:          @t20 feet (thrown)Weapon Proficiency: @t~Simple~[TAG_SIMPLE_PROF], Shortspear
TAG_WEAPONS_SHOVEL:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: A shovel is a common tool for digging, lifting, and moving materials that is used extensively in farming and construction.  In knowledgeable hands, it can be a deadly weapon.Two-Handed Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d8Damage Type:               @tSlashingCritical Range:             @t20/x3Weapon Proficiency: @t~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Light Pick
TAG_WEAPONS_SHURIKEN:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: A shuriken is a special ~monk~[TAG_MONKS] weapon.  This designation gives a monk wielding a shuriken special options.  A shuriken can't be used as a melee weapon.Although they are ~thrown weapons~[TAG_THROW_WEAPON], shuriken are treated as ammunition for the purposes of drawing them, crafting ~masterwork~[TAG_MASTERWORK] or otherwise special versions of them, and in regard to what happens to them after they are thrown.Ranged WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d2Damage Type:               @tPiercingCritical Range:             @t20/x2Range Increment:          @t10 feet (thrown)Weapon Proficiency: @t~Exotic~[TAG_EXOTIC_PROF], Shuriken

This designation gives a monk wielding a siangham special options.Light Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d6Damage Type:               @tPiercingCritical Range:             @t20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @t~Exotic~[TAG_EXOTIC_PROF], SianghamHalfling SianghamLight Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d4Damage Type:               @tPiercingCritical Range:             @t20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @tExotic, Siangham
TAG_WEAPONS_SICKLE:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: This weapon is like a farmer's sickle, but it is strengthened for use as a weapon.  It is favored by ~druids~[TAG_DRUIDS] and by anyone who wants a weapon that might be overlooked by guards.Light Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d6Damage Type:               @tSlashingCritical Range:             @t20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @t~Simple~[TAG_SIMPLE_PROF], Sickle
TAG_WEAPONS_SILVER_SWORD_OF_CHAOS:TAG_WE: The Silver Sword of Chaos is a +1 ~anarchic~[TAG_ANARCHIC], ~silver~[TAG_SILVER] bastard sword.  It deals an extra 2d6 points of chaotic damage against lawful creatures and bypasses the ~damage reduction~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_DAMAGE_REDUCTION] of creatures, such as werewolves and other lycanthropes.  The sword allows the wielder to act as if continually under the effect of a ~Freedom of Movement~[TAG_SPELLS_FREEDOM_OF_MOVEMENT] spell.One or Two-Handed Melee Weapon~Enhancement~[TAG_ENHANCEMENT_BONUS] Bonus: @t+1To Hit Bonus:               @t+1Damage:                          @t1d10+1 (see above)Damage Type:               @tSlashingCritical Range:             @t19-20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @t~Exotic~[TAG_EXOTIC_PROF]/~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Bastard Sword
TAG_WEAPONS_SLING:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: A sling hurls lead bullets.  It doesn't shoot as far as a crossbow, nor is it as powerful as a bow, but it's cheap and easy to improvise from common materials.  ~Druids~[TAG_DRUIDS] and ~halflings~[TAG_HALFLINGS] favor slings.  Your ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH] modifier applies to damage rolls when you use a sling, just as it does for thrown weapons.  You can fire, but not load, a sling with one hand.  Loading a sling is a ~move action~[TAG_MOVEMENT_ACTION] that requires two hands and provokes ~attacks of opportunity~[TAG_AOO].Ranged WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d4Damage Type:               @tBludgeoningCritical Range:             @t20/x2Range Increment:          @t50 feetWeapon Proficiency: @t~Simple~[TAG_SIMPLE_PROF], Sling
TAG_WEAPONS_SPADE_MONK:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: A monk spade is a pole weapon consisting of a long pole with a flat spade-like blade on one end and a smaller crescent shaped blade on the other.Two-Handed Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d10Damage Type:               @tBludgeoning and SlashingCritical Range:             @t18-20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @t~Exotic~[TAG_EXOTIC_PROF], Monk Spade
TAG_WEAPONS_SPEAR:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: One of the simplest weapons in existence, the spear is favored by ~druids~[TAG_DRUIDS] and ~sorcerers~[TAG_SORCERERS].  It can be thrown.  If you use a ~ready~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU_READY] action to set a spear against a ~charge~[TAG_CHARGE], you deal double damage on a successful hit against a charging character.Two-Handed Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d8Damage Type:               @tPiercingCritical Range:             @t20/x3Range Increment:          @t20 feet (thrown)Weapon Proficiency: @t~Simple~[TAG_SIMPLE_PROF], Spear
TAG_WEAPONS_SPIKED_CHAIN:TAG_WEAPONS::TA: A spiked chain has reach, so you can strike opponents 10 feet away with it.  In addition, it can be used against an adjacent foe.  Because the chain can wrap around an enemy's leg or other limb, it can be used to trip a foe.You can use the ~Weapon Finesse~[TAG_WEAPON_FINESSE] feat to apply your ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY] modifier instead of your ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH] modifier to ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] with a spiked chain sized for you, even though it isn't a light weapon for you.Two-Handed Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t2d4Damage Type:               @tPiercingCritical Range:             @t20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @t~Exotic~[TAG_EXOTIC_PROF], Spiked Chain
TAG_RADIAL_MENU_STAFF_OF_STRIKING:TAG_IN: Some weapons, including the ~Staff of Striking~[TAG_WEAPONS_STAFF_OF_STRIKING], can expend charges when dealing damage.  If 2 charges are expended, bonus damage is doubled; if 3 charges are expended, bonus damage is tripled.  No more than 3 charges can be expended per strike.  In the ~radial menu~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU], you will be able to select or "set" how many charges you would like the weapon to expend.
TAG_WEAPONS_STAFF_OF_CHARMING:TAG_WEAPON: This staff can be used to cast ~Charm Person~[TAG_SPELLS_CHARM_PERSON] and ~Charm Monster~[TAG_SPELLS_CHARM_MONSTER]. TAG_WEAPONS_STRIKE_UNARMED:TAG_WEAPONS::: A Medium character deals 1d3 points of ~nonlethal damage~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU_NONLETHAL_DAMAGE] with an unarmed strike, which may be a punch, kick, head butt, or other type of attack.  A Small character deals 1d2 points of nonlethal damage.  A ~monk~[TAG_MONKS] or any character with the ~Improved Unarmed Strike~[TAG_IMPROVED_UNARMED] feat can deal lethal or nonlethal damage with unarmed strikes, at her option.  The damage from an unarmed strike is considered weapon damage for the purposes of effects that give you a bonus on weapon damage rolls.An unarmed strike is always considered a light weapon.  Therefore, you can use the ~Weapon Finesse~[TAG_WEAPON_FINESSE] feat to apply your ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY] modifier instead of your ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH] modifier to ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] with an unarmed strike.Medium CreatureUnarmed AttackTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d3 (see above)Damage Type:               @tBludgeoningCritical Range:             @t20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @t~Simple~[TAG_SIMPLE_PROF], Unarmed strikeSmall CreatureUnarmed AttackTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d2 (see above)Damage Type:               @tBludgeoningCritical Range:             @t20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @tSimple, Unarmed strike - small being
TAG_WEAPONS_SWORD_BASTARD:TAG_WEAPONS:::: Bastard swords are also known as hand-and-a-half swords.  A bastard sword is too large to use in one hand without special training; thus, it is an exotic weapon.  A character can use a bastard sword two-handed as a martial weapon.One or Two-Handed Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d10Damage Type:               @tSlashingCritical Range:             @t19-20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @t~Exotic~[TAG_EXOTIC_PROF]/~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Bastard Sword
TAG_WEAPONS_SWORD_BUTTERFLY:TAG_WEAPONS:: A butterfly sword is usually wielded in pairs and they are usually held side by side within the same scabbard so as to give the appearance of a single weapon.  The butterfly sword blade length is approximately that of the forearm, for easy concealment within the sleeves or inside boots and for greater maneuverability to spin and rotate in close-quarters fighting.Light Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d6Damage Type:               @tSlashingCritical Range:             @t19-20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @t~Exotic~[TAG_EXOTIC_PROF], Butterfly Sword
TAG_WEAPONS_SWORD_SHORT:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: A short sword is typically about 2 feet in length.  This sword is popular as an off-hand weapon for ~two weapon fighting~[TAG_TWO_WEAPONS].Light Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d6Damage Type:               @tPiercingCritical Range:             @t19-20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @t~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Shortsword
TAG_WEAPONS_SWORDS_OF_ANSWERING:TAG_WEAP: The following information about the Swords of Answering has been gathered and compiled from bardic stories, old wives tales, and many such yarns.~Fragarach~[TAG_WEAPONS_FRAGARACH]     This hefty steel sword bears a mighty enchantment.  It was originally fashioned for a demigod of elsewhen, and eventually passed onto the Oerth.  It served well for a short time, all too soon falling into the hands of the minions of ~Chaotic Evil~[TAG_CHAOTIC_EVIL].  It has been in their grasp for over half a decade, resting in hiding in the Temple of Elemental Evil, guarded by the worst of elemental grues.  Fragarach means "The Answerer".     The sword is of ~Chaotic Good~[TAG_CHAOTIC_GOOD] alignment.  The sword functions perfectly only for a non-evil user.  In such hands, its +4 bonus always operates, and it will strike as many opponents as its possessor has the power to do so.  Fragarach always hits all such targets, the +4 pertaining to additional damage only.  Against evil opponents, the bonus doubles (to +8) if the wielder is ~Chaotic Neutral~[TAG_CHAOTIC_NEUTRAL], Chaotic Good, or ~Neutral Good~[TAG_NEUTRAL_GOOD].     The sword has a hilt of silver and gold wire, most cunningly wrought.  Its guard and pommel are set with 7 perfect emeralds.  Its scabbard is likewise trimmed with precious metal and decorated with many gems of green and golden hue.Other Swords of Answering     When Fragarach first came to this world, it received immediate attention and quick renown; so much so, in fact, that six other swords like it were forged and enchanted.  These are lesser weapons, of course, and their alignments vary.  These lesser swords are identified by the differing gems set in guard and pommel.  They are reported to be amethyst, aquamarine, garnet, peridot, topaz, and tourmaline stones.  These weapons are named Rebutter, ~Scather~[TAG_WEAPONS_SCATHER], Replier, Retorter, Squelcher, and Back-Talker, in honor of Fragarach.
TAG_WEAPONS_TANTO:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: A tanto is a long dagger, sometimes seen with a double-edged blade, typically utilized as a slashing weapon.  Most tanto are between 6 and 12 inches with short handles and matching sheaths.Light Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d4Damage Type:               @tSlashingCritical Range:             @t19-20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @t~Simple~[TAG_SIMPLE_PROF], Dagger
TAG_WEAPONS_TETSUBO:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: A tetsubo is a greatclub, made of heavy wood, and is covered with some form of metal from the end to the middle, with studs or spikes along it.  It is usually a heavy weapon wielded by ~barbarians~[TAG_BARBARIANS] and giants.Two-Handed Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t2d6Damage Type:               @tBludgeoningCritical Range:             @t19-20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @t~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Greatclub
TAG_WEAPONS_TONFA:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: A tonfa is a shaft of wood that lies along the hand and forearm with a perpendicular handle and knob.  Often the shaft has rounded off ends which may be grooved for a better grip.Light Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d6Damage Type:               @tBludgeoningCritical Range:             @t20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @t~Exotic~[TAG_EXOTIC_PROF], Tonfa
TAG_WEAPONS_TRIDENT:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: This three-tined piercing weapon can be thrown just a shortspear or spear can be, but its range increment is shorter because it's not as aerodynamic as those other weapons.  If you use a ~ready~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU_READY] action to set a trident against a ~charge~[TAG_CHARGE], you deal double damage on a successful hit against a charging character.One-Handed Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d8Damage Type:               @tPiercingCritical Range:             @t20/x2Range Increment:          @t10 feet (thrown)Weapon Proficiency: @t~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Trident
TAG_WEAPONS_TWINKLE:TAG_WEAPONS::TAG_MAG: Twinkle is a +3 ~defending~[TAG_DEFENDING] scimitar that glows blue when the wielder speaks its name.  It is so lightweight and well balanced that it is considered to be a light weapon, suitable as an off-hand weapon for ~two weapon fighting~[TAG_TWO_WEAPONS].  As a defending weapon, Twinkle allows the wielder to transfer some or all of it's enhancement bonus to his/her ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS] as a bonus.Twinkle is currently wielded by a mysterious drow ranger, of which, nothing is known.Light Melee Weapon~Enhancement~[TAG_ENHANCEMENT_BONUS] Bonus: @t+3To Hit Bonus:               @t+3Damage:                          @t1d6+3Damage Type:               @tSlashingCritical Range:             @t18-20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @t~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Scimitar
TAG_WEAPONS_WAKIZASHI:TAG_WEAPONS:::2: This short, slender blade is between 1 to 2 feet long.  It is primarily used as a back-up weapon, to decapitate defeated enemies, or to commit ritual suicide as a matter of honor.  The blade is usually worn by samurai, but assassins have also been known to use it.  A wakizashi can be used as an effective off-hand weapon in ~two weapon fighting~[TAG_TWO_WEAPONS].Light Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d6Damage Type:               @tSlashingCritical Range:             @t19-20/x2Weapon Proficiency: @t~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Shortsword

A ~dwarf~[TAG_DWARVES] treats a dwarven waraxe as a martial weapon even when using it in one hand.One or Two-Handed Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d10Damage Type:               @tSlashingCritical Range:             @t20/x3Weapon Proficiency: @t~Exotic~[TAG_EXOTIC_PROF]/~Martial~[TAG_MARTIAL_PROF], Dwarven WaraxeExotic Dwarven War AxeOne or Two-Handed Melee WeaponTo Hit Bonus:               @t0Damage:                          @t1d10Damage Type:               @tPiercing and SlashingCritical Range:             @t20/x3Weapon Proficiency: @tExotic/Martial, Dwarven Waraxe

TAG_BOOTS_OF_ELVENKIND:TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS::: These soft boots enable the wearer to move quietly in virtually any surroundings, granting a +5 competence bonus on ~Move Silently~[TAG_MOVE_SILENTLY] checks.~Craft Wondrous Item~[TAG_CRAFT_WONDROUS] Prerequisites:CL 5th; Craft Wondrous Item; ~Silence~[TAG_SPELLS_SILENCE]; creator must be an ~elf~[TAG_ELVES].

TAG_BOOTS_OF_THE_WINTERLANDS:TAG_MAGIC_I: These warm boots grant the wearer elemental resistance +5 against cold.~Craft Wondrous Item~[TAG_CRAFT_WONDROUS] Prerequisites:CL 5th; Craft Wondrous Item; ~Endure Elements~[TAG_SPELLS_ENDURE_ELEMENTS]; ~Cat's Grace~[TAG_SPELLS_CATS_GRACE].
TAG_BRACERS_OF_ARCHERY_GREATER:TAG_MAGIC: These wristbands look like normal protective wear. TAG_BRACERS_OF_ARMOR:TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS::TA: These items appear to be wrist or arm guards. TAG_CLOAK_OF_ARACHNIDA:TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS::: This garment, which can be embroidered with a weblike or spiral pattern in silk, allows the wearer to act as if continually under the effect of a ~Freedom of Movement~[TAG_SPELLS_FREEDOM_OF_MOVEMENT] spell. TAG_CLOAK_OF_ELVENKIND:TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS::: This cloak of neutral gray, black, or green cloth or fur is indistinguishable from an ordinary cloak of the same color or make. TAG_CLOAK_OF_RESISTANCE:TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS:: These black, blue, fur, green, light blue, orange, red, violet, or white garments offer magic protection in the form of a resistance bonus on all ~saving throws~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] (~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE], ~Reflex~[TAG_REFLEX], and ~Will~[TAG_WILL]). TAG_DRUID'S_VESTMENTS:TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS::T: A ~druid~[TAG_DRUIDS] of 5th level or higher that wears these robes gains the ~wild shape~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_DRUID_WILD_SHAPE] form of a ~Hill Giant~[TAG_MONSTER_GIANT_HILL].~Craft Wondrous Item~[TAG_CRAFT_WONDROUS] Prerequisites:Craft Wondrous Item; Wild Shape ability.

TAG_DUST_OF_DISAPPEARANCE:TAG_MAGIC_ITEM: The Dust of Disappearance makes the user ~invisible~[TAG_INVISIBLE] for 2d6 rounds, as if under the effect of the spell ~Greater Invisibility~[TAG_SPELLS_INVISIBILITY_GREATER]. TAG_GLOVES_OF_DEXTERITY:TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS:: These thin leather gloves are very flexible and allow for delicate manipulation. Enhancement Bonus: +2, +4, or +6~Craft Wondrous Item~[TAG_CRAFT_WONDROUS] Prerequisites:Craft Wondrous Item; ~Cat's Grace~[TAG_SPELLS_CATS_GRACE].
TAG_GOGGLES_OF_MINUTE_SEEING:TAG_MAGIC_I: The Goggles of Minute Seeing give the wearer a +5 competence bonus to the ~Search~[TAG_SEARCH] skill.~Craft Wondrous Item~[TAG_CRAFT_WONDROUS] Prerequisites:CL 3rd; Craft Wondrous Item; ~True Seeing~[TAG_SPELLS_TRUE_SEEING].
TAG_HANDS_OF_DEATH:TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS::TAG_: The Hands of Death grant the wearer a +1 resistance bonus to ~Will~[TAG_WILL] saves and the ability to cast ~Inflict Light Wounds~[TAG_SPELLS_INFLICT_LIGHT_WOUNDS] once per day.~Craft Wondrous Item~[TAG_CRAFT_WONDROUS] Prerequisites:CL 3rd; Craft Wondrous Item; Inflict Light Wounds.
TAG_HANDS_OF_ELECTRICITY:TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS: The Hands of Electricity grant the wearer elemental resistance 5 against electricity and the ability to cast ~Shocking Grasp~[TAG_SPELLS_SHOCKING_GRASP] once per day.~Craft Wondrous Item~[TAG_CRAFT_WONDROUS] Prerequisites:CL 3rd; Craft Wondrous Item; Shocking Grasp.
TAG_HANDS_OF_FIRE:TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS::TAG_C: The Hands of Fire grant the wearer elemental resistance 5 against fire and the ability to cast ~Burning Hands~[TAG_SPELLS_BURNING_HANDS] once per day.~Craft Wondrous Item~[TAG_CRAFT_WONDROUS] Prerequisites:CL 3rd; Craft Wondrous Item; Burning Hands.

TAG_HANDS_OF_LIFE:TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS::TAG_C: The Hands of Life grant the wearer a +1 resistance bonus to ~Fortitude~[TAG_FORTITUDE] saves and the ability to cast ~Cure Light Wounds~[TAG_SPELLS_CURE_LIGHT_WOUNDS] once per day.~Craft Wondrous Item~[TAG_CRAFT_WONDROUS] Prerequisites:CL 3rd; Craft Wondrous Item; Cure Light Wounds.
TAG_HEADBAND_OF_INTELLECT:TAG_MAGIC_ITEM: This device is a light cord with a small gem set so that it rests upon the forehead of the wearer. TAG_HELM_OF_BRILLIANCE:TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS::: A Helm of Brilliance absorbs the first 30 points of fire damage from any attack against its wielder and grants the ability to cast ~Flame Strike~[TAG_SPELLS_FLAME_STRIKE], ~Detect Undead~[TAG_SPELLS_DETECT_UNDEAD], and ~Consecrate~[TAG_SPELLS_CONSECRATE]. TAG_HORN_OF_BLASTING:TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS::TA: A Horn of Blasting adds a circumstance bonus of +3 to the ~Perform~[TAG_PERFORM] skill when used to perform any ~bardic music~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_BARD_BARDIC_MUSIC]. TAG_HORN_OF_EVIL:TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS::TAG_CR: A Horn of Evil adds a circumstance bonus of +3 to the ~Perform~[TAG_PERFORM] skill when used to perform any ~bardic music~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_BARD_BARDIC_MUSIC]. TAG_HORN_OF_FOG:TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS::TAG_CRA: A Horn of Fog adds a circumstance bonus of +3 to the ~Perform~[TAG_PERFORM] skill when used to perform any ~bardic music~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_BARD_BARDIC_MUSIC]. TAG_HORN_OF_GOODNESS:TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS::TA: A Horn of Goodness adds a circumstance bonus of +3 to the ~Perform~[TAG_PERFORM] skill when used to perform any ~bardic music~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_BARD_BARDIC_MUSIC].  The horn may be used once a day to cast ~Magic Circle against Evil~[TAG_SPELLS_MAGIC_CIRCLE_AGAINST_EVIL].~Craft Wondrous Item~[TAG_CRAFT_WONDROUS] Prerequisites:CL 6th; Craft Wondrous Item; Magic Circle against Evil; creator must be good.
TAG_IOUN_STONE:TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS::TAG_CRAF: These crystalline stones always float in the air, but must be their owner's inventory to be of any use.Ioun Stone,               @t+2 ~enhancement~[TAG_ENHANCEMENT_BONUS] bonus to ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY]  Deep RedIoun Stone,              @t+1 ~deflection~[TAG_DEFLECTION_BONUS] bonus to ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS]  Dusty RoseIoun Stone,             @t+2 enhancement bonus to ~Wisdom~[TAG_WISDOM]  Incandescent BlueIoun Stone,              @t+2 enhancement bonus to ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH]  Pale BlueIoun Stone, Pink     @t+2 enhancement bonus to ~Constitution~[TAG_CONSTITUTION]Ioun Stone,              @t+2 enhancement bonus to ~Charisma~[TAG_CHARISMA]  Pink and GreenIoun Stone,               @t+2 enhancement bonus to ~Intelligence~[TAG_INTELLIGENCE]  Scarlet and Red~Craft Wondrous Item~[TAG_CRAFT_WONDROUS] Prerequisites:CL 10th; Craft Wondrous Item.
TAG_MANDOLIN_OF_CHARMING:TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS: A Mandolin of Charming adds a circumstance bonus of +2 to the ~Perform~[TAG_PERFORM] skill when used to perform any ~bardic music~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_BARD_BARDIC_MUSIC].  The mandolin may be used once a day to cast ~Calm Emotions~[TAG_SPELLS_CALM_EMOTIONS].~Craft Wondrous Item~[TAG_CRAFT_WONDROUS] Prerequisites:CL 5th; Craft Wondrous Item; Calm Emotions.
TAG_MANTLE_OF_SPELL_RESISTANCE:TAG_MAGIC: This garment, worn over normal clothing or armor, grants the wearer ~spell resistance~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_SPELL_RESISTANCE] +21.  Its color can be black, blue, stars, violet, or standard.~Craft Wondrous Item~[TAG_CRAFT_WONDROUS] Prerequisites:CL 9th; Craft Wondrous Item; ~Spell Resistance~[TAG_SPELLS_SPELL_RESISTANCE].
TAG_MONK'S_BELT:TAG_MAGIC_ITEMS::TAG_CRA: This simple rope belt confers great ability in unarmed combat when wrapped around a character's waist.  The wearer's ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS] and unarmed damage are treated as a ~monk~[TAG_MONKS] of five levels higher.  If donned by a character with the ~Stunning Fist~[TAG_STUNNING_FIST] feat, the belt lets him make one additional stunning attack per day.  If the character is not a monk, he gains the unarmed damage of a 5th-level monk.~Craft Wondrous Item~[TAG_CRAFT_WONDROUS] Prerequisites:CL 10th; Craft Wondrous Item; ~Righteous Might~[TAG_SPELLS_RIGHTEOUS_MIGHT] or ~Tenser's Transformation~[TAG_SPELLS_TENSERS_TRANSFORMATION].
TAG_NECKLACE_OF_ADAPTATION:TAG_MAGIC_ITE: The magic of this necklace wraps the wearer in a shell of fresh air, making him immune to the harmful vapors and gases of the ~Cloudkill~[TAG_SPELLS_CLOUDKILL] spell and allowing him to breathe.  The necklace works for one instance only and then becomes mundane.~Craft Wondrous Item~[TAG_CRAFT_WONDROUS] Prerequisites:None.
TAG_NECKLACE_OF_DETECTION:TAG_MAGIC_ITEM: A Necklace of Detection grants the wearer a circumstance bonus of +5 to ~Search~[TAG_SEARCH] and ~Survival~[TAG_SURVIVAL] skills.~Craft Wondrous Item~[TAG_CRAFT_WONDROUS] Prerequisites:Craft Wondrous Item; ~True Seeing~[TAG_SPELLS_TRUE_SEEING].

TAG_ANTITOXIN:TAG_TOOLS:::2: If you drink antitoxin, you get a +5 luck bonus on ~saving throws~[TAG_SAVING_THROW_DESC] against ~poison~[TAG_POISON] for 1 hour.
TAG_ARMOUR_OIL:TAG_TOOLS:::2: Armour oil is an alchemical lubricant for metal armor that allows plates, rings, etc. to move across each other more smoothly and quietly.  It reduces the armor check penalty of the ~armor~[TAG_ARMOR] by 1.  Armour oil can only be used once on a piece of metal armor.
TAG_BARDIC_INSTRUMENT:TAG_TOOLS:::2: This item is used to improve use of the ~Perform~[TAG_PERFORM] skill.  Like the Perform skill itself, bardic instruments are only of use to ~bards~[TAG_BARDS].  The instruments can be used to play music to improve the effect of all ~bardic music~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_BARD_BARDIC_MUSIC] abilities.  Without these instruments, you must improvise sounds, and you take a -2 circumstance penalty on Perform checks.
TAG_BARDIC_INSTRUMENT_MAGICAL:TAG_TOOLS:: This instrument contains fine materials and components of better make, which grant a +2 or +3 circumstance bonus on ~Perform~[TAG_PERFORM] checks.Magical Instruments[CMD_CHILDREN_SORTED]
TAG_BOTTLES_OF_ACID:TAG_TOOLS:::2: There are several types of bottles of acid.  Each can be thrown as a ~dart~[TAG_WEAPONS_DART] weapon.Bottle                        DamageAcid                     @t1d6 acidDistilled Acid        @t1d6+6 acidEruptive Acid        @t1d6 acid and 1d6 firePurified Acid        @t2d6+6 acid
TAG_EYEGLASSES:TAG_TOOLS:::2: A pair of eyeglasses grants the wearer a +2 circumstance bonus on ~Appraise~[TAG_APPRAISE] checks.Note: You don't want to forget to be careful when using them to keep an eye on unscrupulous shopkeepers.
TAG_FLASK_OF_OIL:TAG_TOOLS:::2: This is a flask of combustable oil.  It can be thrown as a ~dart~[TAG_WEAPONS_DART] weapon, doing 1d6 fire damage on impact.
TAG_HEALER'S_KIT:TAG_TOOLS:::2: A healer's kit is the perfect tool for healing and provides the owner a +2 circumstance bonus on ~Heal~[TAG_HEAL] checks.
TAG_HOLY_WATER:TAG_TOOLS:::2: Holy water damages undead creatures and evil outsiders almost as if it were acid.  A flask of holy water can be thrown as a ~dagger~[TAG_WEAPONS_DAGGER] weapon.
TAG_LOCKSLIP_GREASE:TAG_TOOLS:::2: Lockslip grease lubricates locks and reduces the DC by 1 to ~pick~[TAG_OPEN_LOCK] the lock.  At its price, you would want it to work twice, so it does, but not on the same lock.
TAG_MERCHANT'S_SCALE:TAG_TOOLS:::2: A merchant's scale grants the owner a +2 circumstance bonus on ~Appraise~[TAG_APPRAISE] checks.
TAG_SCHOLAR'S_KIT:TAG_TOOLS:::2: A scholar's kit assists in the scribing of scrolls and provides the owner a +2 circumstance bonus on ~Spellcraft~[TAG_SPELLCRAFT] checks.
TAG_SMOKESTICK:TAG_TOOLS:::2: This alchemically treated wooden stick instantly creates thick, opaque smoke when ignited.  The smoke fills the area (treat the effect as a ~Fog Cloud~[TAG_SPELLS_FOG_CLOUD] spell).  The stick is consumed after ignition and the smoke dissipates as the Fog Cloud spell ends.
TAG_SPYGLASS:TAG_TOOLS:::2: Objects viewed through a spyglass are magnified to twice their size.  A spyglass allows the owner to have twice the chance of spotting a ~random encounter~[TAG_HMU_RANDOM_ENCOUNTER_UI].
TAG_THIEVES_TOOLS:TAG_TOOLS:::2: This kit contains the tools you need to use the ~Disable Device~[TAG_DISABLE_DEVICE] and ~Open Lock~[TAG_OPEN_LOCK] skills.  The kit includes one or more skeleton keys, long metal picks and pries, a long-nosed clamp, a small hand saw and a small wedge and hammer.  Without these tools, you must improvise tools, and you take a -2 circumstance penalty on Disable Device and Open Lock checks.
TAG_THIEVES_TOOLS_MASTERWORK:TAG_TOOLS::: This kit contains extra tools and tools of better make, which grant a +2 circumstance bonus on ~Disable Device~[TAG_DISABLE_DEVICE] and ~Open Lock~[TAG_OPEN_LOCK] checks.
TAG_UNHOLY_WATER:TAG_TOOLS:::2: Unholy water damages good outsiders the way ~holy water~[TAG_HOLY_WATER] damages undead and evil outsiders.  A flask of unholy water can be thrown as a ~dart~[TAG_WEAPONS_DART] weapon.
TAG_GOLDEN_SKULL:TAG_DUMMY:::2: The Orb of Golden Death, or the golden skull, grants the wielder the ability to cast the ~Discern Lies~[TAG_SPELLS_DISCERN_LIES] and ~Poison~[TAG_SPELLS_POISON] spells.  For each placed elemental gem, it will allow him to cast air, earth, fire, or water spells and to summon monsters.
TAG_ADVENTURING::::2: Carrying Capacity: Each item in your character's ~inventory~[TAG_HMU_CHAR_INVENTORY_UI] or equipment has an associated weight to it. The carrying capacity of your character is based on the character's ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH], modified by 3/4 if the character is a ~gnome~[TAG_GNOMES] or ~halfling~[TAG_HALFLINGS].     Characters suffer penalties if carrying Medium or Heavy loads. These penalties include:  1. Limitations to the character's ~Dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY] bonus because of ~Encumbrance~[TAG_ADVENTURING_ENCUMBRANCE]  2. A check penalty on some ~skills~[TAG_SKILLS]  3. Reduction in the character's speed  4. Reduction in the distance a character can run in a roundMovement: Characters can move at the rate of a ~move~[TAG_ADVENTURING_MOVE] or ~run~[TAG_RUN].Exploration: All characters have a vision range dependant upon their character's ~class~[TAG_CLASSES]. In the game, this is represented by the fog, which hides any creature outside of the sight range. Characters should be put into a Marching Order or Formation, through the use of the ~in-game interface~[TAG_INGAME].Treasure and Other Rewards: Treasure is generally split up evenly between party members, and player characters can transfer items freely between themselves. However, some NPC's in the game require more or less treasure, or perhaps just particular items. Additionally, your character's actions are monitored in the game, and the party may pick up a reputation, which can be good or bad depending on the circumstances. Being coined the "Butcher of Hommlet" certainly wouldn't win you any friends in Hommlet, but might earn you some respect in the Temple.
TAG_ADVENTURING_MOVE:TAG_ADVENTURING:::2: ~Humans~[TAG_HUMANS], ~Elves~[TAG_ELVES], ~Half-Elves~[TAG_HALF_ELVES], and ~Half-Orcs~[TAG_HALF_ORCS] move at a base speed of 30 feet, while ~Gnomes~[TAG_GNOMES], ~Dwarves~[TAG_DWARVES], and ~Halflings~[TAG_HALFLINGS] move at a base speed of 20 feet. A single move for a character means that the character will move this amount.[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_ADVENTURING_DOUBLE_MOVE:TAG_DUMMY:::: A double move is fairly self-explanatory; your character is allowed to move twice the distance than he or she normally would.
TAG_ADVENTURING_ENCUMBRANCE:TAG_ADVENTUR: Encumbrance rules determine how much a character's armor and equipment slow him or her down. There are three general weight categories for encumbrance: light, medium, and heavy     The computer will calculate your character's carrying capacity based on his or her ~Strength~[TAG_STRENGTH] score and the amount of weight being carried.The chart below can be used as a basic guideline for encumbrance.                   Max     Check           Speed            SpeedLoad         Dex      Penalty         (30 ft.)          (20 ft.)           RunMedium     +3           -3                20 ft.              15 ft.              x4Heavy         +1            -6                20 ft.              15 ft.              x3In ToEE, if a character's encumbrance level does exceed a heavy load, they will still be allowed to accrue more items. However, their movement will drop to a rate of 5.A ~dwarf~[TAG_DWARVES] is immune to encumbrance penalties until he or she begins carrying a heavy load. So, a dwarf will continue having a ~movement rate~[TAG_MOVEMENT_RATE] of 20 ft. until they reach this level. However, once they begin carrying a heavy load, dwarves will only be allowed the usual movement rate of 5 for those encumbered at that level.
