DexSecondary Damage: 1d2 DexSpider venomType: Injury DC 14Initial Damage: 1d4 StrSecondary Damage 1d4 StrUngol dustType: Inhaled DC 15Initial Damage: 1 ~Cha~[TAG_CHARISMA]Secondary Damage: 1d6 Cha + 1 ChaViolet FungiType: Contact DC 14Initial Damage: 1d4 Str + 1d4 ConSecondary Damage: 1d4 Str + 1d4 ConYellow moldType: Contact DC 15Initial Damage: 1d6 ConSecondary Damage: 2d6 Con
TAG_REGENERATION:TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES::: Creatures with this extraordinary ability recover from wounds quickly and can even regrow or reattach severed limbs.     Damage dealt to this creature is treated as ~nonlethal damage~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU_NONLETHAL_DAMAGE] and the creature automatically cures itself of nonlethal damage at a fixed rate (for example, 5 points per round for a ~troll~[TAG_MONSTER_TROLL]).     Certain attack forms, typically fire and acid, deal damage to the creature normally; that sort of damage doesn't convert to nonlethal damage and so doesn't go away.     Delivering a ~coup de grace~[TAG_RADIAL_MENU_COUP_DE_GRACE] has a chance of severing the creature's head, killing the creature instantly.
TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_RESISTANCE_TO_ENER: A creature with resistance to energy has the ability (usually extraordinary) to ignore some damage of a certain type (such as cold, electricity, or fire) each round, but it does not have total immunity.     Each resistance ability is defined by what energy type it resists and how many points of damage are resisted.  For example, a ~Janni~[TAG_MONSTER_JANNI] has resistance to fire 10.  A Janni can ignore the first 10 points of fire damage it takes each attack.  It doesn't matter whether the damage has a mundane or magical source.     When resistance completely negates the damage from an energy attack, the attack does not disrupt a spell.     This resistance does not stack with the resistance that a spell, such as ~Endure Elements~[TAG_SPELLS_ENDURE_ELEMENTS], might provide.
TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_SPELL_RESISTANCE:T: Spell resistance is the extraordinary ability to avoid being affected by spells.  (Some ~spells~[TAG_SPELLS_SPELL_RESISTANCE] also grant spell resistance.)     To affect a creature that has spell resistance, a spellcaster must make a ~caster level~[TAG_CASTER_LEVEL] check at least equal to the creature's spell resistance.  If the caster fails the check, the spell doesn't affect the creature.     Only spells and spell-like abilities are subject to spell resistance.  Extraordinary and supernatural abilities (including ~enhancement~[TAG_ENHANCEMENT_BONUS] bonuses on magic weapons) are not.  A ~cleric's~[TAG_CLERICS] spells are subject to spell resistance, but his use of positive or negative energy is not.
TAG_CELESTIAL:TAG_DUMMY:::2: Celestial creatures dwell on the upper planes, the realms of good, although they resemble beings found on the Material Plane. They are more regal and more beautiful than their earthly counterparts.     "Celestial" is an inherited template that can be added to any corporeal aberration, animal, dragon, fey, giant, humanoid, magical beast, monstrous humanoid, plant, or vermin of good or neutral alignment (referred to hereafter as the base creature).     A celestial creature uses all the base creature's statistics and abilities except as noted here. Do not recalculate the creature's Hit Dice, base attack bonus, saves, or skill points if its type changes.Size and Type     Animals or vermin with this template become magical beasts, but otherwise the creature type is unchanged. Size is unchanged. Celestial creatures encountered on the Material Plane have the extraplanar subtype.Special Attacks     A celestial creature retains all the special attacks of the base creature and also gains the following special attack.  Smite Evil (Su)     Once per day the creature can make a normal melee attack to deal extra damage equal to its HD total (maximum of +20) against an evil foe. (not available in ToEE)Special Qualities     A celestial creature retains all the special qualities of the base creature and also gains the following:     *Darkvision out to 60 feet. (not implemented in ToEE)     *~Damage reduction~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_DAMAGE_REDUCTION]:          1-3 HD: 0          4-11 HD: 5/magic          12 or more HD: 10/magic     *Resistance to acid, cold and electricity:          1-7 HD: 5          8 or more HD: 10     *~Spell resistance~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_SPELL_RESISTANCE] equal to the creature's HD + 5 (maximum 25).     If the base creature already has one or more of these special qualities, use the better value.Abilities     Same as the base creature, but ~Intelligence~[TAG_INTELLIGENCE] is at least 3.Challenge Rating     HD 3 or less, as base creature     HD 4 to 7, as base creature +1     HD 8 or more, as base creature +2Alignment     Always good (any).
TAG_FIENDISH:TAG_DUMMY:::2: Fiendish creatures dwell on the lower planes, the realms of evil, although they resemble beings found on the Material Plane. They are more fearsome in appearance than their earthly counterparts.     "Fiendish" is an inherited template that can be added to any corporeal aberration, animal, dragon, fey, giant, humanoid, magical beast, monstrous humanoid, ooze, plant, or vermin of nongood alignment (referred to hereafter as the base creature).     A fiendish creature uses all the base creature's statistics and abilities except as noted here. Do not recalculate the creature's Hit Dice, base attack bonus, saves, or skill points if its type changes.Size and Type     Animals or vermin with this template become magical beasts, but otherwise the creature type is unchanged. Size is unchanged. Fiendish creatures encountered on the Material Plane have the extraplanar subtype.Special Attacks     A fiendish creature retains all the special attacks of the base creature and also gains the following special attack.  Smite Good (Su)     Once per day the creature can make a normal melee attack to deal extra damage equal to its HD total (maximum of +20) against a good foe. (not implemented in ToEE)Special Qualities     A fiendish creature retains all the special qualities of the base creature and also gains the following:     *Darkvision out to 60 feet. (not implemented in ToEE)     *~Damage reduction~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_DAMAGE_REDUCTION]:          1-3 HD: 0          4-11 HD: 5/magic          12 or more HD: 10/magic     *Resistance to cold and fire:          1-7 HD: 5          8 or more HD: 10     *~Spell resistance~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_SPELL_RESISTANCE] equal to the creature's HD + 5 (maximum 25).     If the base creature already has one or more of these special qualities, use the better value.Abilities     Same as the base creature, but ~Intelligence~[TAG_INTELLIGENCE] is at least 3.Challenge Rating     HD 3 or less, as base creature     HD 4 to 7, as base creature +1     HD 8 or more, as base creature +2Alignment     Always evil (any).
TAG_MONSTER_ATTACK_DOG:TAG_MONSTERS:::2: Size/Type: Medium Animal~Hit Dice~[TAG_HIT_DICE]:     2d8+4 (13 hp)Initiative: +2~Armor Class~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS]: 16 (+2 Dex, +4 natural), touch 12, ~flat-footed~[TAG_FLAT_FOOTED] 14Base Attack/Grapple: +1/+3Attack:         ~Bite~[TAG_BITE] +3 melee (1d6+3)Full Attack: ~Bite~[TAG_BITE] +3 melee (1d6+3)Space/Reach: 5 ft./5 ft.Special Attacks: -Special Qualities: Low-light vision, scent (not implemented in ToEE)Saves: Fort +5, Ref +5, Will +1Abilities: Str 15, Dex 15, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6Feats: ~Alertness~[TAG_ALERTNESS], ~Track~[TAG_TRACK]Challenge Rating: 1

The save DCs are Charisma-based.Fear Aura (Su)Once per day an avoral can create an aura of fear that is otherwise identical with the ~Fear~[TAG_SPELLS_FEAR] spell from an 8th-level caster (save DC 17). The save DC is Charisma-based.Lay on Hands (Su)As the paladin class ~feature~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_PALADIN_LAY_ON_HANDS], except that each day, an avoral can heal an amount of damage equal to its full normal hit points.
TAG_MONSTER_BEARDED_DEVIL:TAG_MONSTERS::: Size/Type: Medium Outsider (Evil, Extraplanar, Lawful)~Hit Dice~[TAG_HIT_DICE]:     6d8+15 (45 hp)Initiative: +6~Armor Class~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS]: 19 (+2 Dex, +7 natural), touch 12, ~flat-footed~[TAG_FLAT_FOOTED] 17Base Attack/Grapple: +6/+8Attack:         ~Glaive~[TAG_WEAPONS_GLAIVE] +9 melee (1d10+3 plus infernal wound) or ~claw~[TAG_CLAW] +8 melee (1d6+2)Full Attack: Glaive +9/+4 melee (1d10+3 plus infernal wound) or 2 ~claws~[TAG_CLAW] +8 melee (1d6+2)Space/Reach: 5 ft./5 ft. (10 ft. with glaive)Special Attacks: Infernal Wound, Beard, Battle Frenzy, summon devil (not implemented in ToEE)Special Qualities: ~DR~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_DAMAGE_REDUCTION] 5/~silver~[TAG_SILVER] or good, immunity to fire and poison, resistance to acid 10 and cold 10, ~SR~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_SPELL_RESISTANCE] 17, darkvision 60 ft., see in darkness, telepathy 100 ft. (last 3 not implemented in ToEE)Saves: Fort +8, Ref +7, Will +5Abilities: Str 15, Dex 15, Con 17, Int 6, Wis 10, Cha 10Feats: ~Improved Initiative~[TAG_IMPROVED_INIT], ~Power Attack~[TAG_POWER_ATTACK], ~Weapon Focus~[TAG_WEAPON_FOCUS](Glaive)Challenge Rating: 5A bearded devil stands 6 feet tall and weighs about 225 pounds.Every bearded devil carries a sawtoothed glaive.Infernal Wound (Su)In ToEE, its glaive is ~unholy~[TAG_UNHOLY] for purposes of damage calculation (+2d6 vs. good).Beard (Ex)If a bearded devil hits a single opponent with both claw attacks, it automatically hits with its beard. The affected creature takes 1d8+2 points of damage and must succeed on a DC 16 Fortitude save or be infected with a vile ~disease~[TAG_DISEASED] known as Devil Chills (incubation period 1d4 days, damage 1d4 Str). Damage is dealt each day until the afflicted creature succeeds on three consecutive Fortitude saves, the disease is cured magically, or the creature dies. The save DC is Constitution-based.Battle Frenzy (Ex)Twice per day, a bearded devil can work itself into a battle frenzy similar to the ~barbarian's rage~[TAG_CLASS_FEATURES_BARBARIAN_RAGE] (+4 Strength, +4 Constitution, +2 morale bonus on Will saves, -2 AC penalty). The frenzy lasts for 6 rounds, and the bearded devil suffers no ill effects afterward.
TAG_MONSTER_BEBILITH:TAG_MONSTERS:::2: Size/Type: Huge Outsider (Chaotic, Extraplanar, Evil)~Hit Dice~[TAG_HIT_DICE]:     12d8+96 (150 hp)Initiative: +5~Armor Class~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS]: 22 (-2 size, +1 Dex, +13 natural), touch 9, ~flat-footed~[TAG_FLAT_FOOTED] 21Base Attack/Grapple: +12/+29Attack:         ~Bite~[TAG_BITE] +19 melee (2d6+9 plus ~poison~[TAG_POISON])Full Attack: ~Bite~[TAG_BITE] +19 melee (2d6+9 plus poison) and 2 ~claws~[TAG_CLAW] +14 melee (2d4+4)Space/Reach: 15 ft./10 ft.Special Attacks: Poison, WebSpecial Qualities: ~DR~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_DAMAGE_REDUCTION] 10/good, darkvision 60 ft., plane shift, scent, telepathy 100 ft. (last 4 not implemented in ToEE)Saves: Fort +16, Ref +9, Will +9Abilities: Str 28, Dex 12, Con 26, Int 11, Wis 13, Cha 13Feats: ~Cleave~[TAG_CLEAVE], ~Improved Initiative~[TAG_IMPROVED_INIT], ~Power Attack~[TAG_POWER_ATTACK], ~Track~[TAG_TRACK]Challenge Rating: 10Bebiliths are enormous, predatory, arachnid demons that hunt other demons. A bebilith has a body the size of a plow horse, with legs spanning more than 14 feet. It weighs more than two tons.Poison (Ex)In ToEE, Deathblade - Injury, Fortitude DC 20, initial damage 1d6 Con, secondary damage 2d6 Con. The save DC is Constitution-based.Web (Ex)A bebilith can throw a web up to four times per day. This is similar to the ~Web~[TAG_SPELLS_WEB] spell and the web anchors any target in place, allowing no movement. An ~entangled~[TAG_ENTANGLED] creature can escape with a DC 24 Strength check. The check DC is Constitution-based.

The weasel loses its Dexterity bonus to AC, but holds on with great tenacity.Blood Drain (Ex)A weasel drains blood, dealing 1d4 points of Constitution damage in any round when it begins its turn attached to a victim. If its victim dies before the weasel's appetite has been sated, the weasel detaches and seeks a new target.

(last 2 not implemented in ToEE)Saves: Fort +16, Ref +7, Will +9Abilities: Str 21, Dex 10, Con 29, Int 14, Wis 14, Cha 18Feats: ~Blind-Fight~[TAG_BLIND_FIGHT], ~Cleave~[TAG_CLEAVE], ~Power Attack~[TAG_POWER_ATTACK], ~Toughness~[TAG_TOUGHNESS]Challenge Rating: 11Spell-Like AbilitiesAt will - ~Chaos Hammer~[TAG_SPELLS_CHAOS_HAMMER] (DC 18), ~Unholy Blight~[TAG_SPELLS_UNHOLY_BLIGHT] (DC 18)3/day - ~Gaseous Form~[TAG_SPELLS_GASEOUS_FORM]Caster level 13th. The save DCs are Charisma-based.Stench (Ex)A hezrou's skin produces a foul-smelling, toxic liquid whenever it fights. Any living creature (except other demons) within 10 feet must succeed on a DC 24 Fortitude save or be ~nauseated~[TAG_NAUSEATED] for as long as it remains within the affected area and for 1d4 rounds afterward. Creatures that successfully save are ~sickened~[TAG_SICKENED] for as long as they remain in the area. A creature that successfully saves cannot be affected again by the same hezrou's stench for 24 hours. A ~Delay Poison~[TAG_SPELLS_DELAY_POISON] or ~Neutralize Poison~[TAG_SPELLS_NEUTRALIZE_POISON] spell removes either condition from one creature. Creatures that have immunity to ~poison~[TAG_POISON] are unaffected, and creatures resistant to poison receive their normal bonus on their saving throws. The save DC is Constitution-based.

TAG_MONSTER_LANTERN_ARCHON:TAG_MONSTERS:: Size/Type: Small Outsider (Archon, Extraplanar, Good, Lawful)~Hit Dice~[TAG_HIT_DICE]:     1d8 (4 hp)Initiative: +4~Armor Class~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS]: 15 (+1 Size, +0 Dex, +4 natural), touch 11, ~flat-footed~[TAG_FLAT_FOOTED] 15Base Attack/Grapple: +1/-8Attack:         Light Ray +2 ranged touch (1d6)Full Attack: 2 Light Rays +2 ranged touch (1d6)Space/Reach: 5 ft./5 ft.Special Attacks: Spell-like abilitiesSpecial Qualities: ~DR~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_DAMAGE_REDUCTION] 10/magic, immunity to electricity, Magic Circle against Evil, teleport (not available in ToEE), aura of menace, darkvision 60 ft., immunity to petrification, tongues (last 4 not implemented in ToEE)Saves: Fort +2 (+6 against ~poison~[TAG_POISON]), Ref +2, Will +2Abilities: Str 1, Dex 11, Con 10, Int 6, Wis 11, Cha 10Feats: ~Improved Initiative~[TAG_IMPROVED_INIT]Challenge Rating: 2Lantern archons appear as floating balls of light that glow about as brightly as a torch. Only their destruction can extinguish the glow, though they can try to hide it.Light Ray (Ex)In ToEE, a lantern archon's light rays are identical to a ~Searing Light~[TAG_SPELLS_SEARING_LIGHT] spell and have a range of 30 feet. This attack overcomes damage reduction of any type.Magic Circle against Evil (Su)A ~Magic Circle against Evil~[TAG_SPELLS_MAGIC_CIRCLE_AGAINST_EVIL] effect always surrounds an archon (caster level equals the archon's Hit Dice). (The defensive benefits from the circle are not included in an archon's statistics block.)

This is similar to the ~Web~[TAG_SPELLS_WEB] spell, but has a maximum range of 50 feet, with a range increment of 10 feet, and is effective against targets up to one size category larger than the spider. An ~entangled~[TAG_ENTANGLED] creature can escape with a Strength check. This is a standard action with a DC 14. The check DC is Constitution-based, and the Strength check DC also includes a +4 racial bonus. A monstrous spider can move across any web at its normal speed.

TAG_MONSTER_VROCK:TAG_MONSTERS:::2: Size/Type: Large Outsider (Chaotic, Extraplanar, Evil)~Hit Dice~[TAG_HIT_DICE]:     10d8+70 (115 hp)Initiative: +2~Armor Class~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS]: 22 (-1 size, +2 Dex, +11 natural), touch 11, ~flat-footed~[TAG_FLAT_FOOTED] 20Base Attack/Grapple: +10/+20Attack:         Claw +15 melee (2d6+6)Full Attack: 2 claws +15 melee (2d6+6) and bite +13 melee (1d8+3) and 2 talons +13 melee (1d6+3)Space/Reach: 10 ft./10 ft.Special Attacks: Spell-like abilities, Stunning Screech, Spores, dance of ruin, summon demon (last 2 not implemented in ToEE)Special Qualities: ~DR~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_DAMAGE_REDUCTION] 10/good, immunity to electricity and poison, resistance to acid 10, cold 10, and fire 10, ~SR~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_SPELL_RESISTANCE] 17, darkvision 60 ft., telepathy 100 ft. (last 2 not implemented in ToEE)Saves: Fort +14, Ref +9, Will +10Abilities: Str 23, Dex 15, Con 25, Int 14, Wis 16, Cha 16Feats: ~Cleave~[TAG_SPELLS_CLEAVE], ~Combat Reflexes~[TAG_COMBAT_REFLEXES], ~Power Attack~[TAG_POWER_ATTACK]Challenge Rating: 9Spell-Like AbilitiesAt will - ~Mirror Image~[TAG_SPELLS_MIRROR_IMAGE]1/day - ~Heroism~[TAG_SPELLS_HEROISM]Caster level 12th.Stunning Screech (Su)Once per hour a vrock can emit a piercing screech. All creatures except for demons within a 30-foot radius must succeed on a DC 22 Fortitude save or be ~stunned~[TAG_STUNNED] for 1 round. The save DC is Constitution-based.Spores (Ex)A vrock can release masses of spores from its body once every 3 rounds as a free action. The spores automatically deal 1d8 points of damage to all creatures adjacent to the vrock. They then penetrate the skin and grow, dealing an additional 1d4 points of damage each round for 10 rounds. A ~Delay Poison~[TAG_SPELLS_DELAY_POISON] spell stops the spores' growth for its duration. ~Bless~[TAG_SPELLS_BLESS], ~Neutralize Poison~[TAG_SPELLS_NEUTRALIZE_POISON], or ~Remove Disease~[TAG_SPELLS_REMOVE_DISEASE] kills the spores.
TAG_MONSTER_WOLF:TAG_MONSTERS:::2: Size/Type: Medium Animal~Hit Dice~[TAG_HIT_DICE]:     2d8+4 (13 hp)Initiative: +2~Armor Class~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS]: 14 (+2 Dex, +2 natural), touch 12, ~flat-footed~[TAG_FLAT_FOOTED] 12Base Attack/Grapple: +1/+3Attack:         ~Bite~[TAG_BITE] +3 melee (1d6+1)Full Attack: ~Bite~[TAG_BITE] +3 melee (1d6+1)Space/Reach: 5 ft./5 ft.Special Attacks: TripSpecial Qualities: Low-light vision, scent (not implemented in ToEE)Saves: Fort +5, Ref +5, Will +1Abilities: Str 13, Dex 15, Con 15, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 6Feats: ~Track~[TAG_TRACK], ~Weapon Focus~[TAG_WEAPON_FOCUS]~(Unarmed Strike)~[TAG_WEAPONS_STRIKE_UNARMED]Challenge Rating: 1Trip (Ex)In ToEE, a wolf that hits with a bite attack can attempt to ~trip~[TAG_TRIP] its opponent.
TAG_MONSTER_YETH_HOUND:TAG_MONSTERS:::2: Size/Type: Medium Magical Beast~Hit Dice~[TAG_HIT_DICE]:     3d8+6 (19 hp)Initiative: +6~Armor Class~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS]: 20 (+2 Dex, +8 natural), touch 12, ~flat-footed~[TAG_FLAT_FOOTED] 18Base Attack/Grapple: +3/+6Attack:         ~Bite~[TAG_BITE] +6 melee (1d8+4)Full Attack: ~Bite~[TAG_BITE] +6 melee (1d8+4)Space/Reach: 5 ft./5 ft.Special Attacks: Bay (not implemented in ToEE), TripSpecial Qualities: ~DR~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_DAMAGE_REDUCTION] 10/~silver~[TAG_SILVER], darkvision 60 ft., flight, scent (last 3 not implemented in ToEE)Saves: Fort +6, Ref +5, Will +5Abilities: Str 17, Dex 15, Con 15, Int 6, Wis 14, Cha 10Feats: ~Improved Initiative~[TAG_IMPROVED_INIT], ~Improved Trip~[TAG_IMPROVED_TRIP] (in ToEE), ~Track~[TAG_TRACK]Challenge Rating: 3Trip (Ex)In ToEE, a yeth hound that hits with its bite attack can attempt to ~trip~[TAG_TRIP] the opponent (+4 check modifier) without provoking an attack of opportunity.
TAG_TUT_ROOT:TAG_ROOT:::2: This is the information viewed in the tutorial.[CMD_CHILDREN]
TAG_TUT_REST_CAMP:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: You need to rest now so that Ariel has time to memorize her spells. Look at the utility bar in the lower right hand corner of the game screen. There is an icon that looks like a tent.  This is the Rest Icon.  Pressing this will bring up the rest interface.  Resting will allow you to regain your health, memorize spells, or just let time pass.  You can choose to rest for any amount of time.The rest icon changes colors to indicate if resting is possible or not.  Red means you cannot rest here.  Yellow means you may rest here, but it is dangerous and you might get attacked while you are sleeping.  Green means that this is a safe place and you may rest for any amount of time.Sometimes the rest icon will change from a tent to a stop-watch.  The stop-watch icon indicates that you can only pass-time here.  While passing time you will not regain spells or health, but you will not get attacked either.Spellcasters like Ariel need 8 hours of rest in order to regain their spells.  The rest icon is green, indicating we are in a safe area, so let's rest.  Here is how to accomplish this:-Left-Click the rest icon.-It is automatically set to 8 hours, so click "rest" to begin.  After clicking "rest", 8 hours will elapse instantly.
TAG_TUT_PORTRAITS:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: In the bottom left corner of the game screen, there will be a row of portraits, which represent each member of your party. Left-clicking on a portrait will center the game on that character and select him/her. Right-clicking on a portrait will bring up that character's Inventory interface, which contains their stats, and a 3D model of the character, as well as information about their skills, feats, and spells (if applicable).Each portrait displays that character's health as a red bar that decreases as that character takes damage. If the red bar ever reaches zero and disappears, your character is staggered.
TAG_TUT_OPEN_DOOR:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: To open a locked door using a key, having the correct key in your party's Logbook is all that is necessary.If you have looted the key, you can just click on the door and it will open.
TAG_TUT_OPEN_CHEST:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: With your character selected, left-click on the chest and you will walk over and try to open it.
TAG_TUT_DIALOGUE:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: You have discovered another adventurer in the dungeon.  This particular one wants to talk to you immediately, so the dialogue interface will come up right away.  Normally, you would have to select a party member, and then left-click on the person/creature you wish to talk to.This interface has two windows.  The top is what the other person is saying, and the bottom is your list of potential responses.  Left-click on a line of dialogue to respond.
TAG_TUT_MOVEMENT:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: In combat, movement is color-coded. When you click to move different places, you will see these colors, which will help you understand what you can and cannot do.Green: You can still move and perform an action.Yellow: Moving is your action and you are unable to do any other actions. Once you can move no further, your character will stop, regardless of where you try to click.
TAG_TUT_COMBAT_ACTION_BAR:TAG_TUT_ROOT::: Tutorial: Combat and the Action Bar

The Action Bar, on the left side of the game screen, shows how much time you have to perform actions during your turn.  Every action costs a certain amount of "time".If you move your cursor along the ground, you can see how much time that move will cost if you choose to left-click and walk there.  If you hover over an enemy, your cursor will change to an attack cursor and the action bar will display how much time it would it take to left-click and attack them.In general, if you keep the bar in the green (above the middle line) you will be able to attack or cast a spell.  If you go into the yellow (below the middle line) you are choosing to do nothing but move the rest of your turn.If the bar is red, it means that this action would take more time than you currently have available.If you use all of your time up, your turn will end automatically.  If you still have some time left and wish to end your turn, you can click on the "end turn button" beneath the action bar or just hit the "enter" key on your keyboard.
TAG_TUT_SELECT_CHARACTER:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::: You can have up to 8 adventurers in your party.  In this tutorial, you only have one... for now.  When a character is selected, you will see a blue selection ring around him and his portrait beneath.  To select a character within your party, you can:-Press numbers 1-8. Each number corresponds with a specific character in the party.-Left-click and drag to form a square around the character or characters.-Left-click on the character.To move your character:-Left-click anywhere on the ground and your character will move there.  If you have clicked on a location that he cannot find a path to, you will see a flashing circle where you have clicked.
TAG_TUT_CAST_SPELLS:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: You don't have to wait for a creature to see you in order for combat to begin.  Sometimes it is best to draw first blood!  If Ariel has memorized her Magic Missile, now would be a perfect time to cast it.  Make sure Ariel has a clear line of site to the zombies and then do the following: -Left-click on Ariel once to make sure she alone is selected. -Right-click to open her radial menu, and then hover over the spell icon that looks like a glowing ball of light. -Hover over the class "wiz" and then spell level, which in this case is level "1".-Left-click on Magic Missile.If you don't have any spells memorized you can charge in and hope for the best, but I would recommend trying to memorize her Magic Missile spell.
TAG_TUT_COMBAT_INITIATIVE_BAR:TAG_TUT_RO: Combat with a giant rat has begun!  Combat is based on turns and the first thing that needs to be determined is who goes first.  This is called "initiative".  A higher initiative score means you will go before someone with a lower score.  At the top of the game screen during combat, there will be a row of portraits consisting of  your party and all other creatures involved in combat.  A blue border highlights the portrait of the character whose turn it is.  The portraits are listed from left to right in order of initiative.  Once the character on the end of the initiative bar takes his turn, the round is over and a new one begins.Creatures will automatically act when they get the chance, but when it comes to your turn, you will have to tell your character where to go and who to attack.Info:  Hovering over the portrait as well as the creature itself, displays the creature's current condition.
TAG_TUT_COMBAT_ATTACKING:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::: If your character is standing away from the creature, you will need to click to move next to the creature. Then, you can click on the creature and your character will attack. If your character is standing beside the creature, click on the creature and your character will perform a full attack.The Action bar will inform you of whether or not these actions are possible. For example, if you move a great distance, you will not be able to attack the creature once you get there, as this will be an action you will have to save for your next turn.
TAG_TUT_KEYS:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::1: Tutorial: The Logbook and Your Keys
TAG_TUT_KEYS:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: Unlike all other items in the game, keys do not go into personal character inventories, but instead become group communal property listed in the Logbook. The Logbook keeps your quests, keys, and all kinds of stats about your gameplay.  The Logbook can be found on the utility bar in the bottom right corner of the game screen. It is the icon that shows a book.  To check out where the key went that you just looted from the rat, do the following.-Left-click on the Logbook icon and you will see a few different tabs; one of these is the tab for Keys. -Left-click on the Key tab and it will open the Keys interface, which will show all keys you have found on the left, and information on the particular selected key on the right. -When you want to exit the logbook, just left-click on the red exit arrow in the lower right hand corner of the interface.
TAG_TUT_TRADE_ITEMS:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: At this point, you may want to consider giving the Wand of Fireballs that you found on the corpse to Ariel. She is the spellcaster and you are a fighter. As a fighter, you are unable to use wands. In the game, it will generally be more advantageous for certain classes and types of characters to use specific items and this is one example of that. To trade items between players:-Right click on your character to open the radial menu and then your inventory, or right click on your character portrait to open your inventory, to give the Wand of Fireballs to Ariel. -Click and drag the wand in your inventory onto Ariel's character portrait so that she will receive the item in her inventory.-Open Ariel's inventory and the wand is now available for her to use.
TAG_TUT_USE_POTION:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: One way of healing a character who has taken damage is to use a potion.To use a potion to heal:-Right click on the character who will perform the healing (e.g. a wizard) to open the radial menu.-Click on the Inventory icon (backpack) which will bring up an option for Potions.-Click on Potions and select a potion of healing, such as Cure Light or Cure Moderate.-Then, a target selection circle will appear, and your character will either target someone else to heal or target themselves. -Click on the target and the player's HP will increase accordingly.
TAG_TUT_MEMORIZE_SPELLS:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: You now have a wizard in your party!  Spellcasters typically have a bank of spells that they can choose from when casting spells.  Every spellcaster only gets a certain amount of those spells to cast in a day.  They have to choose which ones they want to memorize, and then rest 8 hours to learn them.Here is what you need to do have Ariel memorize her spells:-Left-click on Ariel to make sure she is the only character selected.-Right-click to open her radial menu, hover over the backpack icon, and then select Inventory.-On the top right side of the inventory interface, you will see a tab/icon that looks like a glowing spell effect.  -Left-click on this tab. On the left side, is a list of known spells. On the right side, is the list of memorized (and therefore, usable) spells.-Left-click and drag Magic Missile from the left to one of the available Spell Level 1 slots on the right.Left-click the red exit arrow when you are finished.
TAG_TUT_PASSAGE_ICON:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: You will see a small icon near the ladder in the center of the room.  This is known as a passage icon. Left-clicking on this icon will transfer you to another area.You will find these icons by doors, ladders, and passageways.
TAG_TUT_LOOTING:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: You have killed a rat!  To loot items from a dead creature is the same as looting a chest.  Once the creature has been killed, you can click on his dead body to see if he has any items of value.  In this case, our rat has a key that we will need to open the locked door to the northeast.To loot the golden key from the dead rat:-Left-Click on the dead creature and the loot screen will appear that shows all of the items in its possession.-Left-click and drag the key from the rat's inventory to your own. -A window will pop up, informing you that the key is automatically transferred to the party's logbook, where it will be found in the keys section for future use by the entire party.-Close the loot screen by clicking on the red exit arrow in the lower right hand corner of the interface.
TAG_TUT_LOOTING_SWORD:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: Now that the chest is open, you will see the looting interface for the chest and your character's inventory interface. The looting interface will be on the left side and you will see a sword and shield filling two of the slots. Left-click on the sword and hold the button down to grab the sword.  Now drag the sword icon to an empty slot in your character's inventory and release the button.  Repeat the process for the shield.To equip your new sword and shield:Left-click the sword and drag it from a slot on the right side of your character's inventory into a weapon slot (which has a greyed out sword in it).  Now grab your shield and place it in the shield slot.  Once you are finished equipping your new items, click the red exit arrow in the lower right-hand corner of the interface.  This will return you to the game.Note:  right-clicking on an item in a chest instantly transfers it to your back-pack.  Right-clicking on an item in your back-pack instantly equips the item for you!
TAG_TUT_MULTIPLE_CHARACTERS:TAG_TUT_ROOT: Now that Ariel has memorized her spells, you should adventure deeper into the dungeon.  Since you joined forces with Ariel, you have two members in your party instead of one.To select all of your characters and move them at the same time:-Left-Click and drag a selection square around both characters.-You can also left-click the select-all button on your utility bar in the lower right hand corner of the screen.  The button is the large one on the left showing three people surrounded by a circle.Once you have the entire party selected, click on the ground as usual to move them in unison.
TAG_TUT_PICKLOCK:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: The chest is locked!  When a chest or door is locked you will see the text "locked" float above it.  Since you don't have a key, you must pick the lock in order to open it.All skills, spells, and other special actions are accessed from the radial menu.  To open the chest you will need to access your open lock skill from the radial menu and then select the chest.  Here is how this is accomplished.-Right-clicking brings up the radial menu. -Hovering over the spokes of the radial menu reveals a new level from which to choose.-Hover over the skills tab (looks like a hammer and an anvil) and then left-click on the skill "open lock".  This will close the radial menu.-Left-click on the chest again and the player will begin trying to pick the lock.A floating message will appear above the chest displaying either your success or failure at picking the lock.  You may not always get it on your first try.  If you have the skill necessary, just keep trying and eventually you will. If you have successfully picked the lock, left-clicking on the chest will open the looting interface and will reveal the chest's contents.
TAG_TUT_ROOM1_OVERVIEW:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: "You come through the entrance of the cave and the floor quickly turns from dirt to slate. The walls transform from natural rock to layered brick and stone.  The air grows heavier with every step you take.  There is no question that evil lurks here."
TAG_TUT_ROOM2_OVERVIEW:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: "You enter the room and notice a chest against the wall!  You are surprised to see this chest is in such good repair.  You also notice a sturdy door to the northeast, also appearing in much better condition than the walls surrounding it."
TAG_TUT_ROOM3_OVERVIEW:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: "Just as you round the corner you see a giant rat in the next room!  The creature seems thin and malnourished, even from this distance.  Even though he may not be at full strength, his size and hunger might make him a serious threat."
TAG_TUT_ROOM4_OVERVIEW:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: "You notice a well of some sort in the center of the room.  Leaning against the interior wall of the well you can make out the tip of a ladder."
TAG_TUT_ROOM5_OVERVIEW:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: "You notice a well of some sort in the center of the room.  Leaning against the interior wall of the well you can make out the tip of a ladder."
TAG_TUT_ROOM6_OVERVIEW:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: "You see another well and ladder leading even deeper into the earth.  The air coming from the well is heavy with moisture and the smell of rotting flesh."
TAG_TUT_ROOM7_OVERVIEW:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: "Just as you step off the ladder you see something in the next room.  Even through the dim torchlight, you can make out three creatures with muscle and bone protruding from rotting holes in their skin.  They are tearing furiously at a corpse in front of them."
TAG_TUT_LOCKED_DOOR_REMINDER:TAG_TUT_ROO: "This door is locked.  The lock looks much too complex to pick; a key will be necessary to get through."
TAG_TUT_CAST_SPELLS_MAGIC_MISSILE:TAG_TU: You are now in spell casting mode!  Some spells can have multiple targets, such as Magic Missile, so you will need to select as many targets as your cursor indicates before the spell will be cast. For example, you can left-click on more than one zombie, and designate magic missiles for each of them!  A number will appear on your target when you left-click on them.  This lets you know how many missiles this target will be receiving.  Ariel can cast two missiles simultaneously.  Since there are three zombies, do the following:-Left-click on one zombie.-Left click on a different zombie.Once both of Ariel's missiles have been assigned targets, the spell will automatically fire off!
TAG_TUT_ROOM8_OVERVIEW:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: Now take your fighter and rush in to finish them off!
TAG_TUT_LOOT_PREFERENCE:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: You have found a Wand of Fireballs!  This is a very powerful item and can be used to damage many targets at once.  It is important to know that some items work best  for different classes.  For instance, a sorcerer wearing plate armor will suffer severe penalties when casting spells.  Plate armor would be best for a barbarian because he isn't concerned with casting spells.Your fighter will most likely fail to use the wand correctly.  The wand should definitely go to Ariel.To put an item in any character's inventory is easy.  Left-click and hold to grab the item and move it over one of your player's portraits along the bottom of the screen.  Simply let go and the item will appear in his/her inventory.You can switch between players when the inventory screen is active by selecting different player portraits.
TAG_TUT_LOOT_REMINDER:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: Now that the zombies are dead, remember to loot their bodies!  There might be items you need for the next encounter.
TAG_TUT_ROOM9_OVERVIEW:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: "The groaning and shuffling of a large group of zombies can be heard from the room ahead.  The smell is almost unbearable.  Silhouetting the undead figures is a blazing red light coming from just beyond."
TAG_TUT_WAND_USE:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: This large group of zombies presents a perfect opportunity to have Ariel use the Wand of Fireballs.  Fireball is a spell that deals a large amount of damage to any creature caught in its area of effect.To have Ariel use the wand on the zombies, make sure she alone is selected  by left-clicking on her.  Then access the wand from the radial menu by doing the following:-Right-click  and hover over the inventory tab to reveal all useable objects.-Left-click on the Wand of Fireballs.
TAG_TUT_WAND_FIRE:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::1: Tutorial: Targeting and Firing the Wand
TAG_TUT_WAND_FIRE:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: You now have a large, blue, circular targeting reticle attached to your cursor.  If you move your mouse over the room the zombies are in, you will see an effect ring appear around every zombie within the circular sphere of influence.  This is indicating who will be affected by the spell if it cast in this location.  Make sure that you and Ariel are not within the circle or you will take damage as well!Try to get as many of the zombies in the circle as you can and then left-click to fire the spell!After the wand does its damage, use what you have learned to destroy the rest of the zombies!
TAG_TUT_ARIEL_KILL:TAG_TUT_ROOT:::2: Ariel is an extremely helpful spellcaster.  By killing her, you have made it extremely difficult to fight through the rest of this dungeon.  We suggest you begin again, but you may continue on and see how far you can get!
TAG_TUT_LOOT_PREFERENCE_ARIEL_DEAD:TAG_T: You have found a Wand of Fireballs!  This is a very powerful item and can be used to damage many targets at once.  It is important to know that some items work best for different classes.  For instance, a sorcerer wearing plate armor will suffer severe penalties when casting spells.  Plate armor would be best for a barbarian because he isn't concerned with casting spells.In the case of wands, fighters are not able to use them at all.  Only if you had a spellcaster with you could you use this extremely powerful item.
TAG_TUT_REST_CAMP_ARIEL_DEAD:TAG_TUT_ROO: Look at the utility bar in the lower right hand corner of the game screen. There is an icon that looks like a tent.  This is the rest icon.  Clicking on this will bring up the rest interface.  Resting will allow you to regain your health, memorize spells, or just let time pass.  You can choose to rest for any amount of time.The rest icon changes colors to indicate if resting is possible or not.  Red means you cannot rest here.  Yellow means you may rest here, but it is dangerous and you might get attacked while you are sleeping.  Green means that this is a safe place and you may rest for any amount of time.Sometimes the rest icon will change from a tent to a stop-watch.  The stop-watch icon indicates that you can only pass-time here.  While passing time you will not regain spells or health, but you will not get attacked either.If you have taken any damage from combat, it is good to rest and regain your health.  Here is how to accomplish this:-Left-Click the rest icon.-It is automatically set to 8 hours, but you want to select the "rest until healed" option.-Click "rest" to begin.
TAG_CRAFT_MAGIC_ARMS_ARMOR_POPUP:TAG_DUM: Craft Magic Arms and Armor PopUp
You need to have a masterwork item in order to use Craft Magic Arms and Armor.
TAG_ANIMATED:TAG_DUMMY:::2: An animated shield floats within 2 feet of the wielder, protecting her as if she were using it herself but freeing up both her hands. Only one shield can protect a character at a time.Prerequisites:CL 12th; Craft Magic Arms and Armor, Price +2 bonus
TAG_ARROW_DEFLECTION:TAG_DUMMY:::2: This shield protects the wielder as if he had the Deflect Arrows feat. Once per round when he would normally be struck by a ranged weapon, he can made a DC 20 Reflex save. If the ranged weapon has an enhancement bonus, the DC increases by that amount. If he succeeds, the shield deflects the weapon. He must be aware of the attack and not flat-footed. Attempting to deflect a ranged weapon doesn't count as an action. Exceptional ranged weapons, such as boulders hurled by giants or Melf's acid arrows, can't be deflected.Prerequisites:CL 5th; Craft Magic Arms and Armor; Shield; Price +2 bonus.
TAG_BASHING:TAG_DUMMY:::2: A shield with this special ability is designed to perform a shield bash. A bashing shield deals damage as if it were a weapon of two size categories larger (a Medium light shield thus deals 1d6 points of damage and a Medium heavy shield deals 1d8 points of damage). The shield acts as a +1 weapon when used to bash. (Only light and heavy shields can have this ability).Prerequisites:CL 8th; Craft Magic Arms and Armor; Searing Light; Price +1 bonus.
TAG_DARKWOOD:TAG_DUMMY:::2: This rare magic wood is as hard as normal wood but very light.  Any wooden or mostly wooden item (such as a bow, an arrow, or a spear) made from darkwood is considered a ~masterwork~[TAG_MASTERWORK] item and weighs only half as much as a normal wooden item of that type.  Items not normally made of wood or only partially of wood (such as a battleaxe or a mace) either cannot be made from darkwood or do not gain any special benefit from being made of darkwood.  The armor check penalty of a darkwood shield is lessened by 2 compared to an ordinary shield of its type.Prerequisites:Wooden; Price: To determine the price of a darkwood item, use the original weight but add 10 gp per pound to the price of a masterwork version of that item.
TAG_FORTIFICATION_LIGHT:TAG_DUMMY:::2: This suit of armor or shield produces a magical force that protects vital areas of the wearer more effectively. When a critical hit or sneak attack is scored on the wearer, there is a chance that the critical hit or sneak attack is negated and damage is instead rolled normally.Fortification Type   Chance for Normal Damage   Base Price ModifierLight                                             25%                                          +1 bonusPrerequisites:CL 13th; Craft Magic Arms and Armor; Price +1 bonus.
TAG_MITHRAL:TAG_DUMMY:::2: Mithral is a very rare silvery, glistening metal that is lighter than iron but just as hard.  When worked like steel, it becomes a wonderful material from which to create armor and is occasionally used for other items as well.  Most mithral armors are one category lighter than normal for purposes of movement and other limitations.  Heavy armors are treated as medium, and medium armors are treated as light, but light armors are still treated as light.  ~Spell failure~[TAG_ARCANE_SPELL_FAILURE] chances for armors and shields made from mithral are decreased by 10%, maximum ~dexterity~[TAG_DEXTERITY] bonus is increased by 2, and armor check penalties are lessened by 3 (to a minimum of 0).  An item made from mithral weighs half as much as the same item made from other metals.  In the case of weapons, this lighter weight does not change a weapon's size category or the ease with which it can be wielded (whether it is light, one-handed, or two-handed).  Items not primarily of metal are not meaningfully affected by being partially made of mithral.  (A longsword can be a mithral weapon, while a scythe cannot be.)  Weapons or armors fashioned from mithral are always ~masterwork~[TAG_MASTERWORK] items as well; the masterwork cost is included in the prices given below.Prerequisites:Metallic; Price: Light Armor - +1,000 gp, Medium Armor - +4,000 gp, Heavy Armor - +9,000 gp, Shield - +1,000 gp, Other Items - +500 gp/lb.
TAG_SHADOW:TAG_DUMMY:::2: This armor is jet black and blurs the wearer whenever he tries to hide, granting a +5 competence bonus on Hide checks. (The armor's AC penalty still applies normally).Prerequisites:CL 5th; Craft Magic Arms and Armor; Invisibility; Price +15,000 gp.
TAG_SILENT_MOVES:TAG_DUMMY:::2: This armor is well oiled and magically constructed so that it not only makes little sound, but it dampens sound around it. It provides a +5 competence bonus on its wearer's ~Move Silently~[TAG_MOVE_SILENTLY] checks. (The armor's ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS] penalty still applies normally.)Prerequisites:~Craft Magic Arms and Armor~[TAG_CRAFT_MAA]; Price +15,000 gp.
TAG_SLICK:TAG_DUMMY:::2: Slick armor seems coated at all times with a slightly greasy oil. It provides a +5 competence bonus on its wearer's Escape Artist check. (The armor's AC penalty still applies normally.)Prerequisites:CL 4th; Craft Magic Arms and Armor; Grease; Price +3, 750 gp.
TAG_MAGIC_ARMOR_SPELL_RESISTANCE:TAG_DUM: This property grants the armor's wearer ~spell resistance~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_SPELL_RESISTANCE] while the armor is worn. The spell resistance can only be 13.Prerequisites:~Craft Magic Arms and Armor~[TAG_CRAFT_MAA]; ~Spell Resistance~[TAG_SPELLS_SPELL_RESISTANCE]; Price +2 bonus (SR 13).
TAG_ADAMANTINE:TAG_DUMMY:::2: This ultrahard metal adds to the quality of a weapon or suit of armor.  Weapons fashioned from adamantine have a natural ability to bypass hardness when attacking objects, ignoring hardness less than 20.  Armor made from adamantine grants its wearer ~damage reduction~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_DAMAGE_REDUCTION] of 1/- if it's light armor, 2/- if it's medium armor, and 3/- if it's heavy armor.  Adamantine is so costly that weapons and armor made from it are always of ~masterwork~[TAG_MASTERWORK] quality; the masterwork cost is included in the prices given below.  Thus, adamantine weapons and ammunition have a +1 ~enhancement~[TAG_ENHANCEMENT_BONUS] bonus on ~attack rolls~[TAG_ATTACK_ROLL] and the armor check penalty of adamantine armor is lessened by 1 compared to ordinary armor of its type.  Items without metal parts cannot be made from adamantine.  An arrow could be made of adamantine, but a quarterstaff could not.Prerequisites:Metallic; Price: Weapon - +3,000 gp, Ammunition - +60 gp, Light Armor - +5,000 gp, Medium Armor - +10,000 gp, Heavy Armor - +15,000 gp, Shield - +2,000 gp.
TAG_ANARCHIC:TAG_DUMMY:::2: An anarchic weapon is chaotically aligned and infused with the power of chaos. It makes the weapon chaos-aligned and thus bypasses the corresponding damage reduction. It deals an extra 2d6 points of damage against all lawful alignments. It bestows one negative level on any lawful creature attempting to wield it. The negative level remains as long as the weapon is in hand and disappears when the weapon is no longer wielded. This negative level never results in actual level loss, but it cannot be overcome in any way (including Restoration spells) while the weapon is wielded. Bows, crossbows, and slings so crafted bestow the chaotic power upon their ammunition.Prerequisites:CL 7th; ~Craft Magic Arms and Armor~[TAG_CRAFT_MAA]; ~Chaos Hammer~[TAG_SPELLS_CHAOS_HAMMER]; creator must be chaotic; Price +2 bonus.
TAG_AXIOMATIC:TAG_DUMMY:::2: An axiomatic weapon is lawfully aligned and infused with the power of law. It makes the weapon law-aligned and thus bypasses the corresponding damage reduction. It deals an extra 2d6 points of damage against all of chaotic alignment. It bestows one negative level on any chaotic creature attempting to wield it. The negative level remains as long as the weapon is in hand and disappears when the weapon is no longer wielded. This negative level never results in actual level loss, but it cannot be overcome in any way (including Restoration spells) while the weapon is wielded. Bows, crossbows, and slings so crafted bestow the lawful power upon their ammunition.Prerequisites:CL 7th; ~Craft Magic Arms and Armor~[TAG_CRAFT_MAA]; ~Order's Wrath~[TAG_SPELLS_ORDER'S_WRATH]; creator must be lawful; Price +2 bonus.
TAG_DEFENDING:TAG_DUMMY:::2: A defending weapon allows the wielder to transfer some or all of the weapon's ~enhancement~[TAG_ENHANCEMENT_BONUS] bonus to his ~AC~[TAG_ARMOR_CLASS] as a bonus that stacks with all others. As a ~free action~[TAG_FREE_ACTION], the wielder chooses how to allocate the weapon's enhancement bonus at the start of his turn before using the weapon, and the effect to AC lasts until his next turn.Prerequisites:CL 8th; ~Craft Magic Arms and Armor~[TAG_CRAFT_MAA], ~Shield~[TAG_SPELLS_SHIELD] or ~Shield of Faith~[TAG_SPELLS_SHIELD_OF_FAITH]; Price +1 bonus.
TAG_FLAMING:TAG_DUMMY:::2: A flaming weapon is sheathed in fire. The fire does harm the wielder. The effect remains until another command is given. A flaming weapon deals an extra 1d6 points of fire damage on a successful hit. Bows, crossbows, and slings so crafted bestow the fire energy upon their ammunition.Prerequisites:CL 10th; ~Craft Magic Arms and Armor~[TAG_CRAFT_MAA]; ~Flame Strike~[TAG_SPELLS_FLAME_STRIKE] or ~Fireball~[TAG_SPELLS_FIREBALL]; Price +1 bonus.
TAG_FLAMING_BURST:TAG_DUMMY:::2: A flaming burst weapon functions as a flaming weapon that also explodes with flame upon striking a successful ~critical hit~[TAG_CRITICAL_HIT]. The fire does not harm the wielder. In addition to the extra fire damage from the flaming ability, a flaming burst weapon deals an extra 1d10 points of fire damage on a successful critical hit. Bows, crossbows, and slings so crafted bestow the fire energy upon their ammunition. Even if the flaming ability is not active, the weapon still deals its extra fire damage on a successful critical hit. Prerequisites:CL 12th; ~Craft Magic Arms and Armor~[TAG_CRAFT_MAA]; ~Flame Strike~[TAG_SPELLS_FLAME_STRIKE] or ~Fireball~[TAG_SPELLS_FIREBALL]; Price +2 bonus.
TAG_FROST:TAG_DUMMY:::2: A frost weapon is sheathed in icy cold. The cold does not harm the wielder. The effect remains until another command is given. A frost weapon deals an extra 1d6 points of cold damage on a successful hit. Bows, crossbows, and slings so crafted bestow the cold energy upon their ammunition. Prerequisites:CL 8th; ~Craft Magic Arms and Armor~[TAG_CRAFT_MAA]; ~Chill Metal~[TAG_SPELLS_CHILL_METAL] or ~Ice Storm~[TAG_SPELLS_ICE_STORM]; Price +1 bonus.
TAG_HOLY:TAG_DUMMY:::2: A holy weapon is imbued with holy power. This power makes the weapon good-aligned and thus bypasses the corresponding damage reduction. It deals an extra 2d6 points of damage against all of evil alignment. It bestows one negative level on any evil creature attempting to wield it. The negative level remains as long as the weapon is in the hand and disappears when the weapon is no longer wielded. Bows, crossbows, and slings so crafted bestow the holy power upon their ammunition.Prerequisites:CL 7th; ~Craft Magic Arms and Armor~[TAG_CRAFT_MAA]; ~Holy Smite~[TAG_SPELLS_HOLY_SMITE]; creator must be good; Price +2 bonus.
TAG_ICY_BURST:TAG_DUMMY:::2: An icy burst weapon functions as a frost weapon that also explodes with frost upon striking a successful ~critical hit~[TAG_CRITICAL_HIT]. The frost does not harm the wielder. In addition to the extra damage from the frost ability, an icy burst weapon deals an extra 1d10 points of cold damage on a successful critical hit. Bows, crossbows, and slings so crafted bestow the cold energy upon their ammunition. Even if the frost ability is not active, the weapon still deals its extra cold damage on a successful critical hit.Prerequisites:CL 10th; ~Craft Magic Arms and Armor~[TAG_CRAFT_MAA], ~Chill Metal~[TAG_SPELLS_CHILL_METAL] or ~Ice Storm~[TAG_SPELLS_ICE_STORM]; Price +2 bonus.
TAG_KEEN:TAG_DUMMY:::2: This ability doubles the threat range of a weapon. For instance, if it is placed on a ~longsword~[TAG_WEAPONS_LONGSWORD] (which has a normal threat range of 19-20), the keen longsword scores a threat on a 17-20. Only piercing or slashing weapons can be keen. This benefit doesn't stack with any other magical effect that expands the threat range of a weapon (such as the ~Keen Edge~[TAG_SPELLS_KEEN_EDGE] spell or the ~Improved Critical~[TAG_IMPROVED_CRITICAL] feat).Prerequisites:CL 10th; ~Craft Magic Arms and Armor~[TAG_CRAFT_MAA]; Keen Edge; Price +1 bonus.
TAG_MIGHTY_CLEAVING:TAG_DUMMY:::2: A mighty cleaving weapon allows a wielder with the ~Cleave~[TAG_CLEAVE] feat to make one additional cleave attempt in a round.Prerequisites:CL 8th; ~Craft Magic Arms and Armor~[TAG_CRAFT_MAA]; ~Divine Power~[TAG_SPELLS_DIVINE_POWER]; Price +1 bonus.
TAG_SHOCK:TAG_DUMMY:::2: A shock weapon is sheathed in crackling electricity. The electricity does not harm the wielder. The effect remains until another command is given. A shock weapon deals an extra 1d6 points of electricity damage on a successful hit. Bows, crossbows, and slings so crafted bestow the electricity energy upon their ammunition.Prerequisites:CL 8th; ~Craft Magic Arms and Armor~[TAG_CRAFT_MAA]; ~Call Lightning~[TAG_SPELLS_CALL_LIGHTNING] or ~Lightning Bolt~[TAG_SPELLS_LIGHTNING_BOLT]; Price +1 bonus.
TAG_SHOCKING_BURST:TAG_DUMMY:::2: A shocking burst weapon functions as a shock weapon that also explodes with electricity upon striking a successful ~critical hit~[TAG_CRITICAL_HIT]. The electricity does not harm the wielder. A shocking burst weapon deals an extra 1d10 points of electricity damage on a successful critical hit. Bows, crossbows, and slings so crafted bestow the electricity energy upon their ammunition. Even if the shock ability is not active, the weapon still deals its extra electricity damage on a successful critical hit.Prerequisites:CL 10th; ~Craft Magic Arms and Armor~[TAG_CRAFT_MAA]; ~Call Lightning~[TAG_SPELLS_CALL_LIGHTNING] or ~Lightning Bolt~[TAG_SPELLS_LIGHTNING_BOLT]; Price +2 bonus.
TAG_SILVER:TAG_DUMMY:::2: A complex process involving metallurgy and alchemy can bond silver to a weapon made of metal so that it bypasses the ~damage reduction~[TAG_SPECIAL_ABILITIES_DAMAGE_REDUCTION] of creatures, such as lycanthropes.  The alchemical silvering process can't be applied to nonmetal items and it doesn't work on rare metals such as ~adamantine~[TAG_ADAMANTINE] or ~mithral~[TAG_MITHRAL].Prerequisites:Metallic; Price: Two-Handed Weapon - +180 gp, One-Handed Weapon - +90 gp, Light Weapon - +20 gp, Ammunition - +2 gp.
TAG_UNHOLY:TAG_DUMMY:::2: An unholy weapon is imbued with unholy power. This power makes the weapon evil-aligned and thus bypasses the corresponding damage reduction. It deals an extra 2d6 points of damage against all of good alignment. It bestows one negative level on any good creature attempting to wield to it. The negative level remains as long as the weapon is in hand and disappears when the weapon is no longer wielded. This negative level never results in actual level loss, but it cannot be overcome in any way (including Restoration spells) while the weapon is wielded. Bows, crossbows, and slings so crafted bestow the unholy power upon their ammunition.Prerequisites:CL 7th; ~Craft Magic Arms and Armor~[TAG_CRAFT_MAA]; ~Unholy Blight~[TAG_SPELLS_UNHOLY_BLIGHT]; creator must be evil; Price +2 bonus.
TAG_STONECUNNING:TAG_DWARVES:::2: Stonecunning grants dwarves a +2 racial bonus on checks to notice unusual stonework, such as sliding walls, stonework traps, new construction, unsafe stone surfaces, shaky stone ceilings, and the like.
TAG_HMU_OPTIONS_UI_ADAPTOR:TAG_HMU_OPTIO: Allows selection between multiple video cards, if available.
TAG_HMU_OPTIONS_UI_RESOLUTION:TAG_HMU_OP: Allows you to select between supported game resolutions.
TAG_HMU_OPTIONS_UI_REFRESH:TAG_HMU_OPTIO: Allows selection of the refresh rate of the game.
TAG_HMU_OPTIONS_UI_ANTI_ALIASING:TAG_HMU: Anti-aliasing produces better video quality at a cost in frame rate.
TAG_HMU_OPTIONS_UI_QUAD_BLENDING:TAG_HMU: Quad Blending produces better video quality at the expense of frame rate on some video cards.
TAG_HMU_OPTIONS_UI_GLOSS_MAPPING:TAG_HMU: Some monsters, such as frogs and slimes, use a technique called gloss mapping to make them look shiny.  Disabling this option could result in a frame rate speed up.
TAG_HMU_OPTIONS_UI_HIGH_QUALITY_CLOTH:TA: If enabled, more processor time is spent making cloth and hair in the game animate realistically.
TAG_HMU_OPTIONS_UI_PARTICLE_FIDELITY:TAG: Some particle systems are scaled depending on the Particle Fidelity setting.  Setting this option to 0 sets the minimum amount of particles used by spells and environmental effects, while a setting of 100 guarantees maximum amount of eye candy.
TAG_HMU_OPTIONS_UI_SHADOW_TYPE:TAG_HMU_O: Simple - Shadows for creatures in the game are rendered as a simple circle.Geometry - Shadows for the creatures are rendered as polygons projected onto the ground plane.  Maps - The creatures are rendered onto an off screen buffer and then applied to the scene.Experiment with different options to get the best results for your graphics card.
TAG_HMU_OPTIONS_UI_CONCURRENT_TURNS:TAG_: If this option is enabled, monsters who are able to take turns at the same time will do so. Enabling this option speeds up combat, but may subtlely change certain events.  For example, if you have the combat reflexes feat,  you may not be able to take an ~attack of opportunity~[TAG_AOO] against a second opponent.  Also, if two monsters move into flanking position both may get the bonus while if concurrent turns were disabled only one would get the bonus.
TAG_HMU_OPTIONS_UI_END_TURN_TIME:TAG_HMU: This option can be enabled in order to speed up combat.Never - If this option is selected, you will have to end each character's turn manually, either by hitting return or by pressing the red next turn button beneath the action bar.5-foot step - A player's turn will end when the character has only a 5 foot step remaining. Move - A player's turn will end if he's only got a move action remaining.
TAG_HMU_OPTIONS_UI_END_TURN_DEFAULT:TAG_: If this option is enabled, the character's turn will end if he has performed a default attack on an opponent.  A default attack is one performed by just clicking on the opponent as opposed to selecting the attack through the radial menu.
TAG_ASSASSIN_NOTE:TAG_DUMMY:::2: To my most trusted assassin,Our trader agents in Hommlet have informed me that Lareth has been slain. The fool who did so made a grave mistake, his last. Find and kill this person. When your task is complete, return to the temple for a new assignment. DO NOT FAIL ME!Smigmal Redhand<directions to the temple are scrawled below>
TAG_BURNE_MAP:TAG_DUMMY:::2: This map specifies the location of Hommlet and a nearby site labeled "the Moathouse".
TAG_ALIRA_MAP:TAG_DUMMY:::2: This map specifies the location of Nulb and a nearby site labeled "the temple".
TAG_TERJON_NOTE:TAG_DUMMY:::2: Dear Terjon,Please accept this Copper Starburst Pendant of St. Cuthbert on your promotion to Chief Cleric of Willip.May St. Cuthbert always guide your path,Your Father
TAG_TATTERED_NOTE:TAG_DUMMY:::2: Dear Zaxis,I pray that you will one day find this note.  It was a mistaketo leave home without you.  I have missed you.  And I miss our parents.  My days shall soon end, I fear.  I can only hope that I will die quickly.  My memories of yourbeautiful songs are all that keep me alive...May Fharlanghn watch over you!Your loving sister,Ima
TAG_RAGGED_PARCHMENT:TAG_DUMMY:::2: On three in six lies nine - but none shall ever seeVile Good cloaked by Fair Evil for eternityWill you answer, Answerer? Where is your power, pray?With the whelp of Mitrik, and there until doomsday.
TAG_ZUG_POEM:TAG_DUMMY:::2: The two united in the past,a place to build and spells to cast.Their power grew and took the land,and people round as they had planned.A key without a lock they made,of gold and gems, and overlaidwith spells, a tool for men to wieldto force the powers of good to yield.But armies came, their weapons bared,while evil was yet unprepared.The Hart was followed by the Crownsand Moon, and people of the towns.The two were split; one got awaybut she, when came the judgment day,did break the key, and sent the rocksto boxes four, with magic locks.In doing so, she fell behindas he escaped. She was confinedamong her own; her very lairbecame her prison and despair.The place was ruined, torn apartand left with chains around the heartof evil power -  but the keywas never found in the debris.He knows not where she dwells today.She set the minions path, the wayto lift her temple high againwith tools of flesh, with mortal men.Many now have gone to diein water, flame, in earth or sky.They did not bear the key of oldthat must be found -  the orb of gold.Beware my friend for you shall fallunless you have the wherewithalto find and search the boxes fourand then escape for evermore.But with the key you might succeedin throwing down her power and greed.Destroy the key when you are doneand then rejoice, the battle won!
TAG_EXTRAPLANAR_NOTE:TAG_DUMMY:::2: Thank you for using Cerulean's Extraplanar Chest.To return the chest to the Ethereal Plane, use the miniature chest again.Before you do, however, there are two things to keep in mind:Firstly, any and all charged magic items (wands, staves, rods, etc.) put into the chest will be unrecoverable once you send the chest to the Ethereal Plane.DO NOT PUT CHARGED ITEMS INTO THIS CHEST.Secondly, any magic arms and armour with crafted attributes will lose those attributes once the chest is sent to the Ethereal Plane.DO NOT PUT CRAFTED ARMS AND ARMOUR INTO THIS CHEST.Magic arms and armour you find will not suffer this effect, unless you have crafted additional attributes onto them.At this time we do not know why this is happening, but we suspect that there are some form of magic devouring creatures on the Ethereal Plane that are responsible.The best course of action is to not put those items in the chest.Once again, thank you for using Cerulean's Extraplanar Chest.
TAG_PARCHMENT_OF_CHALLENGE:TAG_DUMMY:::2: This parchment contains a map to a place called Hickory Branch, somewhere deep in the Gnarly Wood.
TAG_OTIS_LETTER:TAG_DUMMY:::2: Dear Mom,Sorry its been so long, I just wanted to let you know I am fine and doing well, I am currently doing some smith-work to make ends meet. I hope things are well at home, and your hobby isn't getting you into trouble... well, you know how I feel about that so I will say no more.I was wondering if you had heard from our darling uncle recently? A woman, a bard, passed through town recently and she said something that... [the letter is unfinished.]

TAG_PANATHAES_NOTES_1:TAG_DUMMY:::2: FREEDAYESCAPED!! The fools left my window open. I heard a grasshopper calling and I simply followed. Now what to do?STARDAYTwo small children have elected to join me on my adventures. Delightful! And their emerald transfixes me! When I handle it I seem to almost enter a different mind.SUNDAYWe've decided on the sewers for our temporary accommodation. Very nice! And some might think me crazy, but I'm sure I saw some sort of lizard creature slither by.MOONDAYI don't care for those other two down here. They're positively mischievous.GODSDAYSomeone is coming for me, I can feel it. The children are restless. I must hide them away.WATERDAYSelected a wonderful spot for them beneath some tables and chairs down one of the corridors. Must remember where it is!EARTHDAYI feel dreadful. I've seen those horrible things searching. They jitter and twitch their buggy eyes as they scurry by like the infernal insects they are.FREEDAYThose others told me they want me to stay now, forever, but first I have to go to sleep in a puddle of water. I don't think I want to. Let those beasts come now - I am ready to go home.
TAG_PANATHAES_NOTES_2:TAG_DUMMY:::2: FREEDAYESCAPED!! The fools left my window open. I heard a grasshopper calling and I simply followed. Now what to do?STARDAYI've decided on the sewers for my temporary accommodation. Very nice! And some might think me crazy, but I'm sure I saw some sort of lizard creature slither by.SUNDAYI don't care for those other two down here. They're positively mischievous.MOONDAYThat brown-robed jackal brought too small children down here today, as if the place isn't crowded enough! The boy dropped an emerald. It transfixes me! When I handle it I seem to almost enter a different mind.GODSDAYSomeone is coming for me, I can feel it. I hear them calling to me through the roof of this dungeon from above.WATERDAYThe brown-robed monster put those children beneath some tables and chairs down one of the corridors. Must remember where it is!EARTHDAYI feel dreadful. I've seen those horrible things searching. They jitter and twitch their buggy eyes as they scurry by like the infernal insects they are.FREEDAYThose others told me they want me to stay now, forever, but first I have to go to sleep in a puddle of water. I don't think I want to. Let those beasts come now - I am ready to go home.

They're positively mischievous.MOONDAYThat black-robed devil brought too small children down here tonight, as if the place isn't crowded enough! The girl dropped an emerald. It transfixes me! When I handle it I seem to almost enter a different mind.GODSDAYSomeone is coming for me, I can feel it. I hear them calling to me through the roof of this dungeon from above.WATERDAYThe black-robed beast put those children beneath some tables and chairs down one of the corridors. Must remember where it is!EARTHDAYI feel dreadful. I've seen those horrible things searching. They jitter and twitch their buggy eyes as they scurry by like the infernal insects they are.FREEDAYThose others told me they want me to stay now, forever, but first I have to go to sleep in a puddle of water. I don't think I want to. Let those beasts come now - I am ready to go home.

TAG_NOTICE_ABIRAM:TAG_DUMMY:::2: Your presence is requested at the desk of Captain Abiram in City Hall at your earliest convenience.Kindest regards,Captain AbiramVerbobonc Constabulary
TAG_NOTICE_ANONYMOUS:TAG_DUMMY:::2: Watch your back and feel afraid, dear friend, for you are now accursed of the Gremlich. It shall be your constant companion in the shadows of your imagination, until such time as it emerges from the dark to kill you. The mystic Mona in Nulb knows more, should you be too dimwitted to understand your fate.Condolences,Samaritan of Hextor
TAG_NOTICE_WILFRICK_1:TAG_DUMMY:::2: Your urgent presence is requested in the chambers of Lord Viscount Wilfrick in City Hall.Please make haste,Lord Viscount Wilfrick
TAG_NOTICE_WILFRICK_2:TAG_DUMMY:::2: Your immediate presence is needed in the chambers of Lord Viscount Wilfrick. If it is evening, see me at my residence.Do not delay,Lord Viscount Wilfrick
TAG_NOTICE_ZOOK_IV:TAG_DUMMY:::2: My dearest adventurer,Please come to see me in my chambers in the Gnome Quarter when you have the opportunity. I look forward to your visit with delighted anticipation.Yours,Prince Zook IV
TAG_NOTICE_CITY_COUNCIL:TAG_DUMMY:::2: Citizens of the Viscounty,It is with the heaviest of hearts that the City Council must announce the destruction of the village of Hommlet. Raiders from a violent and militaristic sect of the evil cult of Hextor descended upon the helpless village and murdered many of the town's inhabitants, pillaged their goods, and by most accounts took many other townsfolk captive.We deeply regret that the local group enlisted to defend the town in lieu of the Regional Patrol failed in their assigned task.The village of Hommlet is deserted and barren now, and we recommend that all citizens avoid it on your travels, as it will no doubt become a haven for bandits, vandals, thrillseekers, and other lowly men and women of their ilk.Our deepest condolences to the families of the lost,The Verbobonc City Council
TAG_NOTICE_CONSTABULARY:TAG_DUMMY:::2: Citizen,You were observed attempting to trespass in the drainage tunnels antechamber in City Hall. Consequently you have been fined 100 gold pieces. Kindly refrain from doing this in the future.The Verbobonc Constabulary
TAG_NOTICE_ASAPH:TAG_DUMMY:::2: Dear friend and citizen,We have never met, but this writing is from Captain Asaph, commander of the Verbobonc Regional Patrol. I am in need of a private force to investigate some possible resumed illegal activity at the Moathouse, and I have been told that you are good in a pinch, shall we say. I believe you are familiar with this location? We have received reports of strange goings on in the area from nearby villages and travelers, with the assumption being that another group of bandits has taken up residence. Please go root them out, as the Regional Patrol cannot spare any troops at this time.All the best,Captain AsaphVerbobonc Constabulary
TAG_NOTICE_ASAPH_2:TAG_DUMMY:::2: Good friend,My sources tell me that the trouble at the Moathouse - whatever it was - is ended. Thank you so much for taking care of this for our great viscounty.I petitioned the city council on your behalf for reward money, but unfortunately I'm told the viscounty cannot allocate any resources to that end at this time.You have my deepest gratitude nonetheless,Captain AsaphVerbobonc Constabulary
TAG_NOTICE_ASAPH_3:TAG_DUMMY:::2: My good friend,Please be so kind as to be on the lookout for an officer of ours who has gone missing, one Lieutenant Bethany Sadonius.Lieutenant Sadonius is a ranger who is assigned to reconnaissance work in the Kron Hills area. She normally works alone. A few days ago she failed to report back to us on her whereabouts via courier as per normal procedure, this after having advised that she was tracking a pack of orcs or some such.If you should happen to run across her, please send her back to her post in Verbobonc. Poor Corporal Holly is worried about her.The lieutenant is a bit of a firebrand, but she's harmless enough.Best wishes,Captain AsaphVerbobonc Constabulary
TAG_NOTICE_ASAPH_4:TAG_DUMMY:::2: My good friend,Please be so kind as to be on the lookout for an officer of ours who has gone missing, one Lieutenant Bethany Sadonius.Lieutenant Sadonius is a ranger who is assigned to reconnaissance work in the Kron Hills area.
